symbols.name: sap.ui.comp
symbols.description:
SAPUI5 library with smart controls.
Note: The controls in this library only support OData V2 (see sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel) and a default model (named undefined).
Note: Properties of a complex type (used in an OData entity type) cannot be bound by or used with controls of this library.
Note: Most controls in this library do not support key user adaptation. Please see Key User Adaptation: Enable Your App for a list of supported controls.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar
symbols.description:
The FilterBar displays filters in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The FilterBar consists of a row containing the SmartVariantManagement control, the related buttons, and an area underneath displaying the filters.

The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The area containing the filters can be hidden or shown using the Hide FilterBar / Show FilterBar button. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Adapt Filters button shows the Adapt Filters Dialog.

In this dialog, the user has full control over the FilterBar.

properties.name: advancedMode
properties.description: The advanced mode is only relevant for the value help scenario. UI representation is different from the standard FilterBar.

properties.name: considerGroupTitle
properties.description:
If this property is set, then the label for filters will be prefixed with the group title.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: deltaVariantMode
properties.description:
Stores the delta as compared to the standard variant.

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: disableSearchMatchesPatternWarning
properties.description:
Disables the warning for special symbols.

Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

Since: 1.102.

properties.name: expandAdvancedArea
properties.description: Collapses/expands the advanced area.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.30.0. Replaced by property filterBarExpanded This property is mapped to the filterBarExpanded property.

properties.name: filterBarExpanded
properties.description:
Shows the filters area. When property useToolbar is set to false, filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note: When SmartFilterBar is used inside a ValueHelpDialog, it is initially collapsed. The filter bar is initially expanded in the following cases:

- When there is no basic search field.

- When preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog is set to true or the fetchValues property of the valueList annotation is set to 2.

- When there are mandatory fields, all fields are expanded (not only the first 7).

Since: 1.26.1.

properties.name: filterContainerWidth
properties.description:
Sets the width of the filters container.

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: header
properties.description:
Specifies header text that is shown in the toolbar on the first position. This property is ignored, when useToolbar is set to false.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Specifies the semantic header level of the header text property. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel. This property is ignored, when useToolbar is set to false.

Since: 1.121.

properties.name: isRunningInValueHelpDialog
properties.description: Sets whether the filter bar should look like the filters area in a ValueHelpDialog. True for SmartFilterBar when used in a ValueHelpDialog. False otherwise.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data. Only if the persistencyKey is provided, will the VariantManagement control be used.

properties.name: searchEnabled
properties.description: Enables/disables the Search button.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32.0. with no replacement.

properties.name: showAllFilters
properties.description:
If set to true, when the FilterBar is expanded it will show all filters, not only the first 7.

Note: This is valid only when the FilterBar is used inside a ValueHelpDialog

Since: 1.116.0.

properties.name: showClearButton
properties.description: Handles visibility of the Clear button on the Filters dialog.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.84. with no replacement. Users can select any Variant instead.

properties.name: showClearOnFB
properties.description:
Handles visibility of the Clear button on the FilterBar.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: showFilterConfiguration
properties.description:
Handles visibility of the Filters button on the FilterBar.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: showGoButton
properties.description:
Handles visibility of the Go button on the FilterBar.

Since: 1.26.1.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.28.0. Replaced by property showGoOnFB

properties.name: showGoOnFB
properties.description:
Handles visibility of the Go button on the FilterBar.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: showRestoreButton
properties.description:
Handles visibility of the "Restore" button on the "Filters" dialog. Note: Restore works only automatically when a property persistencyKey is set and therefore Variant Management is used. In all other cases the "restore" behavior needs to be implemented by the app, based on the event reset. Since 1.84 the "Restore" button text is changed to "Reset"

Since: 1.26.1.

properties.name: showRestoreOnFB
properties.description:
Handles visibility of the Restore button on the FilterBar.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: useSnapshot
properties.description:
Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.

  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all


Since: 1.44.

properties.name: useToolbar
properties.description:
Determines what design is used. Default is the design with toolbar. If the property useToolbar is set to false, the property filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note:
If set to false, the VariantManagement control is not available at all. This scenario is only intended for the sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar.

Since: 1.38.0.

aggregations.name: _parameters
aggregations.description: Special handling for analytic parameters.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Do NOT use this aggregation directly. The FilterBar control is not meant to be used with arbitrary content. It renders filterFields which are added by filterGroupItems aggregation. If you need to add some content below the FilterBar, this can be done by adding it as sibling of the FilterBar. For example, if FilterBar is child of DynamicPageHeader, the custom content can be added to the DynamicPageHeader as well.
aggregations.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.122. with no replacement.

aggregations.name: filterGroupItems
aggregations.description:
Contains all FilterBar filters.
Note:In case a filter has to be added to the basic group

  • the property groupName has to be set to the constant sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.INTERNAL_GROUP
  • the property groupLabel will be handled internally and will be ignored, if set
  • the property partOfCurrentVariant has to be set to true
  • if the property visibleInFilterBar is set to true, the property partOfCurrentVariant will be set internally also to true

aggregations.name: filterItems
aggregations.description: Filters belonging to the basic group.
aggregations.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. Use aggregation filterGroupItems instead.

associations.name: basicSearch
associations.description:
Populates the basic search area on the FilterBar and the Filters dialog.

Since: 1.30.0.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FilterBar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: afterVariantLoad

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context of the event. Can also be null or undefined

parameters.name: executeOnSelect
parameters.description:
executeOnSelect indicates if the variant will trigger search

Since: 1.44.0.

events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been loaded and applied to the FilterBar. The event can be used to adapt custom filters with data from the variant.

events.name: afterVariantSave
events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been saved.

events.name: assignedFiltersChanged
events.description:
This event is fired when the filters information has changed. It indicates specifically that the count of assigned filters may be changed. One of the intended reaction to this event would be to call retrieveFiltersWithValuesAsText method.

Since: 1.38.0.

events.name: beforeVariantFetch
events.description:
This event is fired before a variant is fetched.

Since: 1.28.13.

events.name: beforeVariantSave

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context of the event. Can also be null or undefined

events.description: This event is fired before a variant is saved. The event can be used to adapt the data of the custom filters, which will be saved as variant later. Note: This event is not fired during key user adaptation of the FilterBar right away. The variant is saved when the key user saves the draft. Therefore it's recommended to use the beforeVariantFetch event to adapt the data of custom filters for key user scenarios.

events.name: cancel
events.description: This event is fired when the Cancel button on the Filters dialog is pressed and the variant is marked as dirty.

events.name: clear

parameters.name: selectionSet
parameters.description: Visible controls

events.description: This event is fired when the Clear button is pressed. The consumer has to clear all filters.

events.name: filterChange

parameters.name: added
parameters.description: This property is provided, whenever a filter is added via the add/remove filters dialog.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: This property is provided, whenever a filter is removed via the add/remove filters dialog.

parameters.name: filterItem
parameters.description: The filter item is only provided along with added or deleted properties.

events.description: This event is fired when a filter or multiple filters has changed.

events.name: filtersDialogBeforeOpen
events.description:
This event is fired after the filters dialog is opened.

Since: 1.48.0.

events.name: filtersDialogCancel
events.description:
This event is fired when the Cancel button on the filters dialog is pressed.

Since: 1.48.0.

events.name: filtersDialogClosed

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context of the event. Can also be null or undefined

events.description:
This event is fired after the filters dialog is closed.

Since: 1.34.0.

events.name: filtersDialogSearch
events.description:
This event is fired when the Go button on the filters dialog is pressed.

Since: 1.48.0.
events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.84. with no replacement.

events.name: filtersDialogSearchForFilters

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: Contains the entered search filed value

events.description:
This event is fired when search field of the filter dialog is changed.

Since: 1.48.0.
events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.84. with no replacement.

events.name: initialise
events.description: This event is fired when the FilterBar is initialized to indicate that metadata are available.

events.name: initialized
events.description:
This event is fired after the FilterBar has been initialized, the user's default variant has been applied, and a stable filter state has been achieved. With this event all relevant filter information, for example, for navigation-related actions, is available via sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar#getUiState.

Since: 1.38.0.

events.name: reset

parameters.name: selectionSet
parameters.description: Visible controls

events.description: This event is fired when the Restore button is pressed.

events.name: search

parameters.name: selectionSet
parameters.description: Visible controls

parameters.name: firedFromFilterBar
parameters.description:
Set to true when event is fired due to user action in FilterBar

Since: 1.107.

events.description: This event is fired when the Go button is pressed.

methods.name: getConsiderGroupTitle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property considerGroupTitle.

If this property is set, then the label for filters will be prefixed with the group title.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation content.

Do NOT use this aggregation directly. The FilterBar control is not meant to be used with arbitrary content. It renders filterFields which are added by filterGroupItems aggregation. If you need to add some content below the FilterBar, this can be done by adding it as sibling of the FilterBar. For example, if FilterBar is child of DynamicPageHeader, the custom content can be added to the DynamicPageHeader as well.

methods.name: getDisableSearchMatchesPatternWarning

returnValue.description: Value of property disableSearchMatchesPatternWarning

methods.description:
Gets current value of property disableSearchMatchesPatternWarning.

Disables the warning for special symbols.

Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getFilterBarExpanded

returnValue.description: Value of property filterBarExpanded

methods.description:
Gets current value of property filterBarExpanded.

Shows the filters area. When property useToolbar is set to false, filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note: When SmartFilterBar is used inside a ValueHelpDialog, it is initially collapsed. The filter bar is initially expanded in the following cases:

- When there is no basic search field.

- When preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog is set to true or the fetchValues property of the valueList annotation is set to 2.

- When there are mandatory fields, all fields are expanded (not only the first 7).

Default value is true.

methods.name: getFilterContainerWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property filterContainerWidth

methods.description:
Gets current value of property filterContainerWidth.

Sets the width of the filters container.

Default value is "12rem".

methods.name: getFilterDialogContent

returnValue.description: of filters dialog content.

methods.description: Returns the filter dialog content. Node:The original content is a Form. The form may be enhanced with a toolbar to enable the inner switch to an added custom content. Besides such operations, the original content should not be manipulated in any way.
methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.84. with no replacement.

methods.name: getFilterGroupItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation filterGroupItems.

Contains all FilterBar filters.
Note:In case a filter has to be added to the basic group

  • the property groupName has to be set to the constant sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.INTERNAL_GROUP
  • the property groupLabel will be handled internally and will be ignored, if set
  • the property partOfCurrentVariant has to be set to true
  • if the property visibleInFilterBar is set to true, the property partOfCurrentVariant will be set internally also to true

methods.name: getFilterItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation filterItems.

Filters belonging to the basic group.
methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. Use aggregation filterGroupItems instead.

methods.name: getHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property header

methods.description:
Gets current value of property header.

Specifies header text that is shown in the toolbar on the first position. This property is ignored, when useToolbar is set to false.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getHeaderLevel

returnValue.description: Value of property headerLevel

methods.name: getUseSnapshot

returnValue.description: Value of property useSnapshot

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useSnapshot.

Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.

  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all

methods.name: getUseToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useToolbar.

Determines what design is used. Default is the design with toolbar. If the property useToolbar is set to false, the property filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note:
If set to false, the VariantManagement control is not available at all. This scenario is only intended for the sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar.

Default value is true.

methods.description: Returns the associated VariantManagement control. The returned VariantManagement instance should not be cached or manipulated in any ways. returnValue.description: A string that contains the number of set filters and their names

Returns a summary string that contains information about the filters currently assigned. This string is intended to be used in expanded state. Example:
(3) filters active (1 hidden)

parameters.description: New value for property filterBarExpanded

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property filterBarExpanded.

Shows the filters area. When property useToolbar is set to false, filterBarExpanded is ignored automatically and the FilterBar is always expanded. Note: When SmartFilterBar is used inside a ValueHelpDialog, it is initially collapsed. The filter bar is initially expanded in the following cases:

- When there is no basic search field.

- When preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog is set to true or the fetchValues property of the valueList annotation is set to 2.

- When there are mandatory fields, all fields are expanded (not only the first 7).

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setUiState

parameters.name: oUiState
parameters.description: object representing the ui-state. Currently only the SelectionVariant part is considered.

parameters.name: mProperties
parameters.description: controls the API behavior

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: Replaces existing filter data

parameters.name: strictMode
parameters.description:
Determines filters and parameters based on the name.

  • true: Determines filters and parameters based on their exact name and type. If there is no exact match, the filter/parameter will be ignored.
  • false: Determines parameters first following this rule set:
    • If a parameter is found, use it.
    • If a filter is found, check first if a matching parameter exists with the filter name prefixed with "P_". If there is a match, use it as parameter, otherwise use it as filter.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData
symbols.description:
Stores display text together with a navigation target hyperlink.
The LinkData class is used by SmartLink and SemanticObjectController to define the visible links on NavigationPopover.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover
symbols.description: The NavigationPopover control is used to present information in a specific format. Note: This control is used by the NavigationPopoverHandler and must not be used manually.

properties.name: appStateKey
properties.description:
The application state key passed to retrieve the navigation targets.

Since: 1.28.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. The property appStateKey is obsolete as target determination is no longer done by NavigationPopover. Instead the NavigationPopoverHandler is responsible for target determination.

properties.name: availableActionsPersonalizationText
properties.description:
Determines the text of personalization link. If this property is set to some string, choosing the personalization link will trigger the availableActionsPersonalizationPress event. If this property is not set, the personalization link is not shown.

Since: 1.44.0.

properties.name: mainNavigationId
properties.description:
Sets the description of the main navigation link. If mainNavigation also contains an href description, then mainNavigationId is displayed. If mainNavigationId is set to an empty string '', neither description nor subtitle are displayed.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: semanticAttributes
properties.description:
Describes the semantic attributes. The attribute has to be a map.

Since: 1.28.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. The property semanticAttributes is obsolete as target determination is no longer done by NavigationPopover. Instead the NavigationPopoverHandler is responsible for target determination.

properties.name: semanticObjectName
properties.description:
The name of the semantic object.

Since: 1.28.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. The property semanticObjectName is obsolete as target determination is no longer done by NavigationPopover. Instead the NavigationPopoverHandler is responsible for target determination.

aggregations.name: availableActions
aggregations.description:
A list of available actions shown as links.

Since: 1.28.0.

aggregations.name: mainNavigation
aggregations.description:
The main navigation link. If mainNavigationId is not set then text of mainNavigation is displayed. Otherwise the mainNavigationId is displayed.

Since: 1.28.0.

aggregations.name: ownNavigation
aggregations.description: The navigation taking the user back to the source application.

deprecated.text: The property ownNavigation is obsolete as target determination is no longer done by NavigationPopover. Instead the NavigationPopoverHandler is responsible for target determination.

associations.name: component

associations.name: extraContent
associations.description:
In addition to main navigation link and available links some additional content can be displayed in the popover.

Since: 1.28.0.

associations.name: source
associations.description:
Source control for which the popover is displayed.

Since: 1.28.0.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.121
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.121. SmartLink no longer opens a NavigationPopover, it got replaced by the sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel in a sap.m.ResponsivePopover

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopoverHandler
symbols.description:
The NavigationPopoverHandler control determines navigation targets for a semantic object and shows them together with further information in a Popover.
Note: Navigation targets are determined using CrossApplicationNavigation of the unified shell service.

properties.name: additionalSemanticObjects
properties.description:
Names of additional semantic objects which are used to determine target navigations.

Since: 1.42.0.

properties.name: beforeNavigationCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a Promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:

  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent


Since: 1.75.0.

properties.name: contactAnnotationPath
properties.description:
Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

Since: 1.40.0.

properties.name: enableAvailableActionsPersonalization
properties.description:
Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control.

Since: 1.44.0.

properties.name: fieldName
properties.description:
The metadata field name for this NavigationPopoverHandler control.

Since: 1.36.0.

properties.name: mapFieldToSemanticObject
properties.description:
If set to false, the NavigationPopoverHandler control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several NavigationPopoverHandler on the same semantic object. *

Since: 1.36.0.

properties.name: navigationTargetsObtainedCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

Since: 1.126.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description:
Name of semantic object which is used to determine target navigations.

Since: 1.36.0.

properties.name: semanticObjectController
properties.description:
The semantic object controller controls events for several NavigationPopoverHandler controls. If the controller is not set manually, it tries to find a SemanticObjectController in its parent hierarchy.

Since: 1.36.0.

properties.name: semanticObjectLabel
properties.description:
Shown title of semantic object.

Since: 1.36.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. Title section with semanticObjectLabel has been removed due to new UI design

aggregations.name: _popover
aggregations.description: Stores the inner popover to influence design-time

associations.name: control
associations.description:
The parent control.

Since: 1.36.0.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new navpopover/NavigationPopoverHandler.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: beforePopoverOpens

parameters.name: semanticObject
parameters.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets will be retrieved.

parameters.name: semanticAttributes
parameters.description: Map containing the semantic attributes calculated from the binding that will be used to retrieve the navigation targets.

deprecated.text: The parameter semanticAttributes is obsolete. Instead use the parameter semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.

parameters.name: semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects
parameters.description:
A map of semantic objects for which the navigation targets will be retrieved and it's semantic attributes calculated from the binding context. The semantic attributes will be used as parameters in order to retrieve the navigation targets.

Since: 1.42.0.

parameters.name: setSemanticAttributes
parameters.description:
This callback function enables you to define a changed semantic attributes map. Signatures: setSemanticAttributes(oSemanticAttributesMap) Parameter:

  • {object} oSemanticAttributesMap New map containing the semantic attributes
  • {string} sSemanticObject Semantic Object for which the oSemanticAttributesMap belongs

parameters.name: setAppStateKey
parameters.description:
This callback function sets an application state key that is used over the cross-application navigation. Signatures: setAppStateKey(sAppStateKey) Parameter:

  • {string} sAppStateKey

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the NavigationPopoverHandler.

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: This callback function triggers the retrieval of navigation targets and leads to the opening of the navigation popover. Signatures: open() If the beforePopoverOpens has been registered, the open function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover.

events.description:
Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are getting retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of NavigationPopoverHandler, the beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.

Since: 1.36.0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The UI text shown in the clicked link.

parameters.name: href
parameters.description: The navigation target of the clicked link.

parameters.name: semanticObject
parameters.description: The semantic object used to retrieve this target.

parameters.name: semanticAttributes
parameters.description: Map containing the semantic attributes used to retrieve this target.

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the NavigationPopoverHandler.

events.description:
This event is fired after a navigation link on the navigation popover has been clicked. This event is only fired, if the user left-clicks the link. Right-clicking the link and selecting 'Open in New Window' etc. in the context menu does not fire the event.

Since: 1.36.0.

events.name: navigationTargetsObtained

parameters.name: mainNavigation
parameters.description: The main navigation object.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: Array of available navigation target objects.

parameters.name: ownNavigation
parameters.description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is by default not visible on the popover.

parameters.name: popoverForms
parameters.description: Array containing contact data.

parameters.name: semanticObject
parameters.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets have been retrieved.

parameters.name: semanticAttributes
parameters.description: Map containing the semantic attributes.

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the NavigationPopoverHandler.

parameters.name: show
parameters.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()

  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

events.description:
After the navigation targets are retrieved, navigationTargetsObtained is fired and provides the possibility to change the targets.

Since: 1.36.0.
events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.126. replaced by navigationTargetsObtainedCallback property.

Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopoverHandler
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.121
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.121. SmartLink no longer uses the NavigationPopoverHandler, it got replaced by a sap.ui.mdc.Link implementation. All event handlings can be done directly on the SmartLink / SemanticObjectController.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets
symbols.description: Object holding the information regarding the obtained navigation targets and extra content. This is used as parameter and return value of the Promise in the navigationTargetsObtainedCallback.

properties.name: mainNavigationId
properties.description: The text of the main link / text that is displayed in the header of the popover.

properties.name: mainNavigation
properties.description: The main navigation object

properties.name: actions
properties.description: Array of available navigation target objects

properties.name: ownNavigation
properties.description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is not visible on the popover by default.

properties.name: popoverForms
properties.description: Array containing contact data. Manipulating this property won't have an effect, it's only relevant to be streamlined with the old API. The extraContent property is used to return the intended content.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets have been retrieved

properties.name: semanticAttributes
properties.description: Map containing the semantic attributes

properties.name: originalId
properties.description: The ID of the SmartLink or other parent control

properties.name: extraContent
properties.description: The control that is displayed in the extra content section on the popover. If set to null, the extra content is removed. If set to undefined, a sap.m.VBox containing the popoverForms as items is used as extra content. The popoverForms can be empty.

symbols.title: typedef sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
symbols.description: The SemanticObjectController control operates as a single entry point for SmartLink controls created automatically by SmartTable control, SmartChart control, SmartForm control and SmartField control based on OData metadata. Additionally, all events provided by the SmartLink control are registered by the SemanticObjectController and can be consumed there in a single place. As usual, the SemanticObjectController can be defined within the XML view as well as in the code.

properties.name: beforeNavigationCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:

  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent


Since: 1.75.0.

properties.name: contactAnnotationPaths
properties.description:
Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, '\{"Supplier":"to_Supplier", "CompanyName":"to_Company"\}' . An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

Since: 1.40.0.

properties.name: enableAvailableActionsPersonalization
properties.description:
Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control. For example, '\{"Supplier":false, "CompanyName":true\}' .

Since: 1.44.0.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The name of the entity set used. If entitySet has not been defined, the SemanticObjectController tries to retrieve the name from its parents. Note: This is not a dynamic UI5 property.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: fieldSemanticObjectMap
properties.description:
Maps the fields to the related semantic objects. When accessing this property for the first time, the mapping will be calculated from the metadata within the provided model.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: forceLinkRendering
properties.description:
Object containing fields for which the corresponding SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPaths is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called.\n

Note: The ignoredFields property and the ignoreLinkRendering property of the SmartLink control take precedence over forceLinkRendering.\n

Example of usage: '\{"Supplier":"true", "CompanyName":"true"\}'

Since: 1.58.0.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
Comma-separated list of fields that must not be displayed as links.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: mapFieldToSemanticObject
properties.description:
If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: navigationTargetsObtainedCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the SmartLinkFieldInfo. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

Since: 1.126.

properties.name: prefetchNavigationTargets
properties.description:
If set to true, the SemanticObjectController will retrieve all navigation targets once and will disable links for which no targets were found. Setting this value to true will trigger an additional roundtrip.

Since: 1.28.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.42.0. The property prefetchNavigationTargets is obsolete as navigation targets are determined automatically. The SmartLink controls are re-rendered as soon as the asynchronous determination of navigation targets has been completed.

properties.name: replaceSmartLinkNavigationTargetsObtained
properties.description:
Determines if the navigationTargetsObtained event handling of the SmartLink should be replaced when this SemanticObjectController is set as SemanticObjectController on the SmartLink.

Since: 1.97.

parameters.name: sID
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: beforePopoverOpens

parameters.name: semanticObject
parameters.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets will be retrieved.

parameters.name: semanticAttributes
parameters.description: Map containing the semantic attributes calculated from the binding that will be used to retrieve the navigation targets.

deprecated.text: The parameter semanticAttributes is obsolete. Instead use the parameter semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.

parameters.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.42.0. The parameter semanticAttributes is obsolete. Instead use the parameter semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects.

parameters.name: semanticAttributesOfSemanticObjects
parameters.description:
A map of semantic objects for which the navigation targets will be retrieved and it's semantic attributes calculated from the binding context. The semantic attributes will be used as parameters in order to retrieve the navigation targets.

Since: 1.42.0.

parameters.name: setSemanticAttributes
parameters.description:
This callback function enables you to define a changed semantic attributes map. Signatures: setSemanticAttributes(oSemanticAttributesMap) Parameter:

  • {object} oSemanticAttributesMap New map containing the semantic attributes
  • {string} sSemanticObject Semantic Object for which the oSemanticAttributesMap belongs

parameters.name: setAppStateKey
parameters.description:
This callback function sets an application state key that is used over the cross-application navigation. Signatures: setAppStateKey(sAppStateKey) Parameter:

  • {string} sAppStateKey

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the control that fires this event. If beforePopoverOpens is registered on the SmartLink, originalId is the same as the event's source ID which is also the SmartLink's ID. If the beforePopoverOpens is registered on the SemanticObjectController, originalId helps to identify the original SmartLink control which triggered the event.

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: This callback function triggers the retrieval of navigation targets and leads to the opening of the navigation popover. Signatures: open() If beforePopoverOpens has been registered, open function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover or trigger a direct navigation.

events.description:
Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of SmartLink, beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.

Since: 1.28.0.

events.name: navigate

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The UI text shown in the clicked link.

parameters.name: href
parameters.description: The navigation target of the clicked link.

parameters.name: semanticObject
parameters.description: The semantic object used to retrieve this target.

parameters.name: semanticAttributes
parameters.description: Map containing the semantic attributes used to retrieve this target.

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the control that fires this event. If navigate is registered on the SmartLink, originalId is the same as the event's source ID which is the SmartLink's ID. If navigate is registered on the SemanticObjectController, originalId helps to identify the original SmartLink control which triggered the event.

events.description:
This event is fired after a navigation link on the navigation popover has been clicked. This event is only fired, if the user left-clicks the link. Right-clicking the link and selecting 'Open in New Window' etc. in the context menu does not fire the event.

Since: 1.28.0.

events.name: navigationTargetsObtained

parameters.name: mainNavigation
parameters.description: The main navigation object.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: Array of available navigation target objects.

parameters.name: ownNavigation
parameters.description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is by default not visible on the popover.

parameters.name: popoverForms
parameters.description: Array containing contact data.

parameters.name: semanticObject
parameters.description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets have been retrieved.

parameters.name: semanticAttributes
parameters.description: Map containing the semantic attributes.

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the control that fires this event. If navigationTargetsObtained is registered on the SmartLink, originalId is the same as the event's source ID which is also the SmartLink's ID. If navigationTargetsObtained is registered on the SemanticObjectController, originalId helps to identify the original SmartLink control which triggered the event.

parameters.name: show
parameters.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()

  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

events.description:
After the navigation targets have been retrieved, navigationTargetsObtained is fired and makes it possible you to change the targets.

Since: 1.28.0.
events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.126. replaced by navigationTargetsObtainedCallback property.

parameters.name: semanticObjects
parameters.description: A map containing all semantic objects as keys for which at least one navigation target has been found. The value for each semantic object key is an array containing the available actions found for this semantic object.

events.description:
If the property prefetchNavigationTargets is set to true, event prefetchDone is fired after all navigation targets have been retrieved.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the control that fires this event. If beforePopoverOpens is registered on the SmartLink, originalId is the same as the event's source ID which is also the SmartLink's ID. If the beforePopoverOpens is registered on the SemanticObjectController, originalId helps to identify the original SmartLink control which triggered the event.

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: This callback function triggers the retrieval of navigation targets and leads to the opening of the navigation popover. Signatures: open() If beforePopoverOpens has been registered, open function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover or trigger a direct navigation.

parameters.name: show
parameters.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()

  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross-application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

methods.name: getBeforeNavigationCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property beforeNavigationCallback

methods.description:
Gets current value of property beforeNavigationCallback.

Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:

  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

methods.name: getContactAnnotationPaths

returnValue.description: Value of property contactAnnotationPaths

methods.description:
Gets current value of property contactAnnotationPaths.

Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, '\{"Supplier":"to_Supplier", "CompanyName":"to_Company"\}' . An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control. For example, '\{"Supplier":false, "CompanyName":true\}' .

The name of the entity set used. If entitySet has not been defined, the SemanticObjectController tries to retrieve the name from its parents. Note: This is not a dynamic UI5 property.

returnValue.description: Value of property fieldSemanticObjectMap

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fieldSemanticObjectMap.

Maps the fields to the related semantic objects. When accessing this property for the first time, the mapping will be calculated from the metadata within the provided model.

methods.name: getForceLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Value of property forceLinkRendering

methods.description:
Gets current value of property forceLinkRendering.

Object containing fields for which the corresponding SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPaths is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called.\n

Note: The ignoredFields property and the ignoreLinkRendering property of the SmartLink control take precedence over forceLinkRendering.\n

Example of usage: '\{"Supplier":"true", "CompanyName":"true"\}'

If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes.

methods.name: getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback

methods.description:
Gets current value of property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback.

Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the SmartLinkFieldInfo. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

methods.name: getPrefetchNavigationTargets

returnValue.description: Value of property prefetchNavigationTargets

methods.description:
Gets current value of property prefetchNavigationTargets.

If set to true, the SemanticObjectController will retrieve all navigation targets once and will disable links for which no targets were found. Setting this value to true will trigger an additional roundtrip.

Default value is false.

deprecated.text: The property prefetchNavigationTargets is obsolete as navigation targets are determined automatically. The SmartLink controls are re-rendered as soon as the asynchronous determination of navigation targets has been completed.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink
symbols.description:
The SmartLink control uses a semantic object to display NavigationPopover for further navigation steps.
Note: Navigation targets are determined using CrossApplicationNavigation of the unified shell service.

Important: Keep in mind that SmartLink, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application.

With time, SmartLink can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartLink only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

properties.name: additionalSemanticObjects
properties.description:
Semantic object names which can be used additional to the default semanticObject property in order to get navigation targets links.

Since: 1.42.0.

properties.name: beforeNavigationCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:

  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent


Since: 1.75.0.

properties.name: contactAnnotationPath
properties.description:
Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

Since: 1.40.0.

properties.name: createControlCallback
properties.description:
Function that enables the SmartLink control to create an alternative control, which is displayed if ignoreLinkRendering is enabled. The function has no parameters and has to return an instance of sap.ui.core.Control.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: enableAvailableActionsPersonalization
properties.description:
Determines whether the personalization link is shown inside the NavigationPopover control.

Since: 1.44.0.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Determines whether the link can be triggered by the user.

properties.name: fieldName
properties.description:
The metadata field name for this SmartLink control.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: forceLinkRendering
properties.description:
If set to true, the SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPath is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called.

Note: The ignoreLinkRendering property and the ignoredFields property of the associated SemanticObjectController take precedence over forceLinkRendering.

Since: 1.58.0.

properties.name: ignoreLinkRendering
properties.description:
If set to true, the SmartLink control will render the innerControl or the control provided by createControlCallback instead of the actual link. This is used for example by the SemanticObjectController if this SmartLink is listed in its ignoredFields or no navigation targets were found during prefetch.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: mapFieldToSemanticObject
properties.description: If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several SmartLink controls on the same semantic object.

properties.name: navigationTargetsObtainedCallback
properties.description:
Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

Since: 1.126.

properties.name: semanticObject
properties.description:
Name of semantic object which is used to fill the navigation popover. Note: Setting a value triggers an asynchronous determination, so the effect can be delayed.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: semanticObjectController
properties.description:
The semantic object controller controls events for several SmartLink controls. If the controller is not set manually, it tries to find a SemanticObjectController in its parent hierarchy.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: semanticObjectLabel
properties.description:
Shown label of semantic object.

Since: 1.28.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. Title section with semanticObjectLabel has been removed due to new UI design

properties.name: uom
properties.description:
Additionally to the text property the Unit of Measure can be displayed.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Determines whether the link text is allowed to wrap when there is no sufficient space.

aggregations.name: innerControl
aggregations.description:
Control that is displayed instead of SmartLink control, if the SmartLink is disabled (for example, if no navigation targets are available). If innerControl is not provided, the SmartLink control tries to create one with property createControlCallback.

Since: 1.28.0.

annotations.name: semanticObjectMapping
annotations.description:
Maps properties of the annotated EntityType or sibling properties of the annotated property to properties of the Semantic Object. The SmartLink control can be created from the XML view or from the OData metadata. XML Example of OData V4 with SemanticObjectMapping on Product/Name

 <Annotations Target="ProductCollection.Product/Name" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticObject" String="SemanticObjectName" />
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticObjectMapping">
			<Collection>
				<Record>
					<PropertyValue Property="LocalProperty" PropertyPath="SupplierId" />
					<PropertyValue Property="SemanticObjectProperty" String="SupplierIdOfSemanticObjectName" />
				</Record>
			</Collection>
		</Annotation>
	</Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.0.

annotations.name: contact
annotations.description:
Renders the contact information inside the NavigationPopover control. The Contact annotation contains various ContactType which can be used for providing additional information for distinguishing between the contact details. List of enumeration types supported is listed below:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.PhoneType/fax: This enumeration type can be used for defining a fax number.
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.PhoneType/work: This enumeration type can be used for defining a work phone number.
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.PhoneType/cell: This enumeration type can be used for defining a mobile number.
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.ContactInformationType/work": This enumeration type can be used for defining a work email address.
XML Example of OData V4 with Contact Annotation

   <Annotations Target="EntityTypeName.Supplier"
     xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact">
        <Record>
          <PropertyValue Property="fn" Path="FormattedName" />
          <PropertyValue Property="title" Path="Title" />
          <PropertyValue Property="org" Path="CompanyName" />
          <PropertyValue Property="role" Path="OrganizationRole" />
          <PropertyValue Property="photo" Path="Photo" />
          <PropertyValue Property="tel">
            <Collection>
              <Record>
                <PropertyValue Property="type"
                  EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.PhoneType/fax" />
                <PropertyValue Property="uri" Path="FaxNumber" />
              </Record>
              <Record>
                <PropertyValue Property="type"
                  EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.PhoneType/work />
                <PropertyValue Property="uri" Path="PhoneNumber" />
              </Record>
              <Record>
                <PropertyValue Property="type"
                  EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.PhoneType/cell" />
                <PropertyValue Property="uri" Path="MobileNumber" />
              </Record>
            </Collection>
          </PropertyValue>
          <PropertyValue Property="email">
            <Collection>
              <Record>
                <PropertyValue Property="type"
                  EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.ContactInformationType/work" />
                <PropertyValue Property="address" Path="EmailAddress" />
              </Record>
            </Collection>
          </PropertyValue>
        </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

The SmartLink control interprets the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden annotation. Fields which are annotated as Bool: "true" are not shown in the contact information but the corresponding data is requested by the backend.

XML Example of OData V4 with com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden Title Property 

	<Annotations Target="EPM_DEVELOPER_SCENARIO_SRV.Supplier/Title" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden"/>
	</Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.40.1.

annotations.name: semanticObjectUnavailableActions
annotations.description:
List of actions of the related semantic object that are not shown in the navigation popover. XML Example of OData with SemanticObjectUnavailableActions on Product/CustomerId

 <Annotations Target="ProductCollection.Product/CustomerId" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticObject" String="CustomerSO" />
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticObjectUnavailableActions">
			<Collection>
					<String>DeleteCustomer<String/>
			</Collection>
		</Annotation>
	</Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.0.

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: This callback function triggers the retrieval of navigation targets and leads to the opening of the navigation popover. Signatures: open() If the beforePopoverOpens has been registered, the open function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover or trigger a direct navigation.

events.description:
Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are getting retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of SmartLink control, the beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.

parameters.name: mainNavigation
parameters.description: The main navigation object.

parameters.description: Array of available navigation target objects.

parameters.description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is by default not visible on the popover.

parameters.description: Array containing contact data.

parameters.name: semanticAttributes
parameters.description: Map containing the semantic attributes.

parameters.name: originalId
parameters.description: The ID of the SmartLink control.

parameters.name: show
parameters.description:
This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()

  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

events.description:
After the navigation targets are retrieved, navigationTargetsObtained is fired and provides the possibility to change the targets.

Since: 1.28.0.

returnValue.description: Value of property additionalSemanticObjects

methods.description:
Gets current value of property additionalSemanticObjects.

Semantic object names which can be used additional to the default semanticObject property in order to get navigation targets links.

Default value is [].

methods.name: getBeforeNavigationCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property beforeNavigationCallback

methods.description:
Gets current value of property beforeNavigationCallback.

Function that is called before the actual navigation happens. This function has to return a promise resolving into a Boolean value for which the navigation will wait. If the Boolean value is true, the navigation will be processed. The beforeNavigationCallback(oNavigationInfo) parameter contains the following data:

  • {String} text: Text of the navigation intent
  • {String} href: HREF of the navigation intent
  • {String} originalId: ID of the control that fires the navigation intent
  • {String} semanticObject: Name of the SemanticObject of the navigation intent
  • {Object} semanticAttributes: Object containing the SemanticAttributes of the navigation intent

methods.name: getContactAnnotationPath

returnValue.description: Value of property contactAnnotationPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property contactAnnotationPath.

Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, 'to_Supplier'. An empty string means that the related entity type is the current one.

Default value is undefined.

methods.name: getCreateControlCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property createControlCallback

methods.description:

The metadata field name for this SmartLink control.

methods.name: getForceLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Value of property forceLinkRendering

methods.description:
Gets current value of property forceLinkRendering.

If set to true, the SmartLink control is rendered as a link even if contactAnnotationPath is not set and navigation targets do not exist. Setting this property to true allows the application, for example, to modify the SmartLink control in the event handler, after the user has clicked on a link and the registered event handler has been called.

Note: The ignoreLinkRendering property and the ignoredFields property of the associated SemanticObjectController take precedence over forceLinkRendering.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getIgnoreLinkRendering

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoreLinkRendering

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoreLinkRendering.

If set to true, the SmartLink control will render the innerControl or the control provided by createControlCallback instead of the actual link. This is used for example by the SemanticObjectController if this SmartLink is listed in its ignoredFields or no navigation targets were found during prefetch.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getInnerControl
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation innerControl.

Control that is displayed instead of SmartLink control, if the SmartLink is disabled (for example, if no navigation targets are available). If innerControl is not provided, the SmartLink control tries to create one with property createControlCallback.

returnValue.description: The value of innerControl aggregate or the text of the SmartLink

returnValue.description: Value of property mapFieldToSemanticObject

methods.description:
Gets current value of property mapFieldToSemanticObject.

If set to false, the SmartLink control will not replace its field name with the according semanticObject property during the calculation of the semantic attributes. This enables the usage of several SmartLink controls on the same semantic object.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback

returnValue.description: Value of property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback

methods.description:
Gets current value of property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback.

Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnNavigationTargetsObtainedCallback
parameters.description: New value for property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property navigationTargetsObtainedCallback.

Function that is called when the navigation targets provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad are obtained. The function is called with one oNavigationTargets parameter of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. This function has to return a Promise resolving into an Object of type sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationTargets. The provided oNavigationTargets can be manipulated in this callback before being returned to the NavigationPopoverHandler. The Popover will open after the Promise has been resolved. This function replaces the navigationTargetsObtained event. The event handling is ignored if this callback is set.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartchart.SelectionMode'.

properties.description: Multi selection mode, multiple sets of data points can be selected at once.
