symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart
symbols.description:
The SmartChart control creates a chart based on the OData metadata and the provided configuration. To use the control, the entitySet property must be specified. This property is used to fetch the metadata, from which the chart UI will be generated.
Based on the chartType property, this control will render initially the corresponding chart.
Note: Most of the properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

Important: Keep in mind that SmartChart, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application.

With time, SmartChart can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartChart only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

properties.name: activateTimeSeries
properties.description:
Enables the use of timeseries on the inner chart when corresponding annotation is given

Note: This timeseries is only supported for the following TimeUnitTypes and the following chart types sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame#getVizType.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: chartBindingPath
properties.description: Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart to be created by the SmartChart control.

properties.name: currentVariantId
properties.description: Retrieves or applies the current variant.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns.
Note This is not a dynamic property.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Semantic level of the header.
For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Since: 1.118.

properties.name: headerStyle
properties.description:
Defines style of the header.
For more information, see sap.m.Title#setTitle.

Since: 1.119.

properties.name: ignoreFromPersonalisation
properties.description:
CSV of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: ignoredChartTypes
properties.description:
CSV of fields that is not shown in the list of available chart types.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartChart control.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: legendVisible
properties.description:
Set chart's legend properties.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: noData
properties.description:
Defines the custom text that will be displayed in case no data is found for the current binding.

Since: 1.46.

properties.name: notAssignedText
properties.description:
Text that is shown for values of an empty string. Note: The property does not change the behavior for charts of type timeseries. Note: Can only be changed in the XML/JS view. It cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

Since: 1.106.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data.

properties.name: requestAtLeastFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
Chart selection mode. Supported values are sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Single or sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SelectionMode.Multi, case insensitive, always return in upper case. Unsupported values will be ignored.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showChartTooltip
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true , an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip will be created and shown when hovering over a data point.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showChartTypeSelectionButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart type selection button.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: showDetailsButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Details button. If set to true, the datapoint tooltip will be disabled as the information of selected datapoints will be found in the details popover. This will also set the drill-down button to invisible.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showDimensionsTitle
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the title in the dimension area of the chart.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: showDownloadButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart download button.

Since: 1.39.

properties.name: showDrillBreadcrumbs
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showDrillButtons
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the Drill Up and Drill Down buttons.

properties.name: showFullScreenButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the FullScreen button.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showLegendButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showMeasuresTitle
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the title in the measure area of the chart.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: showSemanticNavigationButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: showToolbar
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the toolbar.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: showVariantManagement
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Variant Management.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: showZoomButtons
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: smartFilterId
properties.description: ID of the corresponding SmartFilter control. If specified, the SmartChart control searches for the SmartFilter control (also in the closest parent view) and attaches to the relevant events of the SmartFilter control to fetch data, show overlay etc.

properties.name: toolbarStyle
properties.description:
Defines the visual style of the smart charts Toolbar. Note: The visual styles are theme-dependent.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: useChartPersonalisation
properties.description: If set to true, personalized chart settings are defined. If you want to persist the chart personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

properties.name: useListForChartTypeSelection
properties.description:
Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.

Since: 1.38.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

properties.name: useTooltip
properties.description:
Specifies weather an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip or sap.viz.ui5.controls.Popover is used. If set to true, a tooltip will be displayed, a popover otherwise.

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: useVariantManagement
properties.description: If set to true, variants are used. As a prerequisite, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActionGroups
aggregations.description:
Actions on group level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

Since: 1.48.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActions
aggregations.description:
Actions on footer level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

Since: 1.48.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsItemActions
aggregations.description:
Actions on item level which can be specified for the selection details popover.

Since: 1.48.

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description:
The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

Since: 1.36.

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: A custom toolbar that can be specified by the user to define their own buttons, icons, etc. If this is added, the SmartChart control does not create its own toolbar, but uses this one instead. However, if default actions, such as showSemanticNavigation, showFullScreenButton etc. are set, these actions are added at the left-hand side of the toolbar.

associations.name: smartVariant
associations.description:
Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.

Since: 1.38.

annotations.name: semanticObject
annotations.description:
Defines a name of the SemanticObject that can be represented with an EntitySet, EntityType or identified by a Property. With this annotation in place, the SemanticObjectController will provide all the available features for the SmartChart control. XML Example of OData V4 with SemanticObject on ProductName
Note: Navigation targets are determined using CrossApplicationNavigation of the unified shell service.

   <Annotations Target="ProductName">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SemanticObject" String="SemanticObjectName" />
  </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: fieldVisible
annotations.description:
Defines whether a field in the SmartChart control is visible. The SmartChart interprets the EnumMember FieldControlType/Hidden of the FieldControl annotation for setting the visibility. Note: Currently only FieldControlType/Hidden is supported for statically hiding the fields. XML Example of OData V4 with hidden Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Property Name="Customer">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>

For OData v2 the sap:visible annotation on the Property can be used to assign visibility.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:visible="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:visible="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: presentationVariant
annotations.description:
Renders the initial chart fields for the SmartChart control. A PropertyPath and an AnnotationPath can be used for constructing PresentationVariant annotation. XML Example of OData V4 with Customer and CompanyCode Properties as PresentationVariant

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Visualizations">
         <Collection>
           <AnnotationPath>@UI.Chart</AnnotationPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
       <PropertyValue Property="RequestAtLeast">
         <Collection>
           <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="SortOrder">
           <Collection>
             <Record>
               <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode"/>
               <PropertyValue Property="Descending" Bool="true"/>
             </Record>
             <Record>
               <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer"/>
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a chart based on the information that is provided within the Chart annotation. Chart annotation must be defined for an EntityType

XML Example of OData V4 with Chart Annotation and ChartType Column Chart

   <Annotations Target="Item" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Line Items" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInTransactionCurrency</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.34.1.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the UI.DataPoint that is provided by the measure attributes, semantic patterns and coloring can be defined for the chart. The UI.DataPoint annotation must be defined for an EntityType XML Example of OData V4 with DataPoint Annotation with semantic coloring For more information see sap.chart.ColoringType.Criticality

   <Annotations Target="Item" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Line Items" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInTransactionCurrency</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
              <Record>
                 <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#semanticColoring" />
              </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="semanticColoring" >
	  <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
		<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
		<PropertyValue Property="Criticality" EnumMember="sap.chart.ColoringType.Negative" />
	  </Record>
    </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

Using this UI.DataPoint annotation, the semantic coloring for a measure changes as follows:

   var oColorings = {
       Criticality: {
          MeasureValues: {
              "AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency": {
                   Static: sap.chart.ColoringType.Negative
              }
          }
   }

XML Example of OData V4 with DataPoint Annotation with semantic pattern For more information see sap.chart.data.MeasureSemantics

   <Annotations Target="Item" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Line Items" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>TargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
              <Record>
                 <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
                 <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#semanticPattern" />
              </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="semanticPattern" >
	  <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
		<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
		<PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="TargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency" />
	  </Record>
    </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

Using this UI.DataPoint annotation, the semantics of the chart measures are set as follows:

var oAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency = oChart.getMeasureByName("AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency");
oAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency.setSemantics(sap.chart.data.MeasureSemantics.Actual);

var oTargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency = oChart.getMeasureByName("TargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency");
oTargetAmountInCompanyCodeCurrency.setSemantics(sap.chart.data.MeasureSemantics.Reference);

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.0.

annotations.name: text
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property. If no text arrangement has been defined, the default display behavior is TextFirst.

An example how this is set in OData v4 is shown here:

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="ProductName">

In OData v2 it looks like this:

    <Property name="ProductId" ... sap:text="ProductName"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: textArrangement
annotations.description:
Describes the arrangement of an ID value and its description.

The following enumeration members are allowed:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextSeparate: The control displays the specified ID only.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst: The control displays the specified description followed by its ID.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast: The control displays the specified ID followed by its description.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextOnly: The control displays the specified description only.

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on an entity's property

<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Category">
	<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CategoryName">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast" />
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on entity Product

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.ProductType">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: IsFiscalYear
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the value of the annotated Entity Data Model (EDM) property represents a fiscal year number following the YYYY(Y*) pattern.

The logical pattern YYYY(Y*) consists of at least four digits.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Year" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Year">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYear" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.82.

annotations.name: IsFiscalYearPeriod
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the value of the annotated Entity Data Model (EDM) property represents a fiscal year and period number following the YYYY(Y*)PPP pattern.

The logical pattern YYYY(Y*)PPP consists of at least seven digits, where the last three digits represent the fiscal period of the year.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Year" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Year">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearPeriod" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.82.

annotations.name: IsFiscalPeriod
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'M' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'M' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalPeriod" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsFiscalQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'Q' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'Q' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsFiscalYearQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'yQ' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'yQ' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsFiscalWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'w' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'w' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsFiscalYearWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'Yw' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'Yw' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsCalendarYear
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the value of the annotated Entity Data Model (EDM) property represents a calendar year following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*).

The logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*) consists of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least four digits.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Year" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Year">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYear" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.82.

annotations.name: IsCalendarQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the 'Q' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'Q' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsCalendarMonth
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the 'm' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'm' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarMonth" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsCalendarWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the 'w' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'w' pattern.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: IsCalendarYearQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the value of the annotated Entity Data Model (EDM) property represents a calendar year and quarter following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)Q.

The logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)Q consists of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least five digits, where the last digit represents the quarter.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Year" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Year">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYearQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.82.

annotations.name: IsCalendarYearMonth
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the value of the annotated Entity Data Model (EDM) property represents a calendar year and month following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)MM.

The logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)MM consists of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least six digits, where the last two digits represent the months January to December.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Year" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Year">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYearMonth" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.82.

annotations.name: IsCalendarYearWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the value of the annotated Entity Data Model (EDM) property represents a calendar year and week following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)WW.

The logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)WW consists of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least six digits, where the last two digits represent the week numbers of the year.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

	  <Property Name="Year" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Year">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYearWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.82.

annotations.name: IsCalendarDate
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the pattern 'YYYYMMDD'.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP date strings with the pattern 'YYYYMMDD'.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarDate" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.118.

annotations.name: timezone
annotations.description:
Indicates whether a Property of type Edm.DateTimeOffset contains a time zone.

XML Example of the OData V4 Timezone Annotation

   <Annotations Target="Created">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Timezone" Path="Timezone"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.117.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control that is generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new SmartChart instance.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: afterVariantApply

parameters.name: currentVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

parameters.name: variantContext
parameters.description: Context in which the variant has been applied

events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been applied.

events.name: afterVariantInitialise
events.description: This event is fired after the variant management in the SmartChart control has been initialized.

events.name: afterVariantSave

parameters.name: currentVariantId
parameters.description: ID of the currently selected variant

events.description: This event is fired after a variant has been saved. This event can be used to retrieve the ID of the saved variant.

events.name: beforeRebindChart

parameters.name: bindingParams
parameters.description: The bindingParams object contains filters, sorters, and other binding-related information for the chart

parameters.name: preventChartBind
parameters.description: If set to true by the listener, binding is prevented

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: The combined filter array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Filter instances of the SmartChart and SmartFilter controls; can be modified by users to influence filtering

parameters.name: sorter
parameters.description: An array containing a set of sap.ui.model.Sorter instances of the SmartChart control (personalization); can be modified by users to influence sorting

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: The maximal number of items that is displayed for the SmartChart control

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: a map of parameters which is passed to the binding

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: map of event listeners for the binding events (since 1.56). The events listeners can only be registered while the binding is created. So, ensure that the events parameter is filled from the beginning, so that the registration can be done while the binding is created.

events.description:
This event is fired right before the SmartChart control triggers the binding / rebinding of the inner chart.
Note: In certain cases the inner chart triggers a rebinding by itself. In these cases, the event is not fired.

events.name: chartDataChanged

parameters.name: changeTypes
parameters.description: Object which contains a boolean flag for dimeasure, filter, sort. If set to true, it has been changed.

events.description:
This event is fired when SmartChart control data changes, due to changes in the personalization dialog or drill operations.
The data can be changed via sorters, filters or drill-ups/drill-downs.

events.name: dataReceived
events.description: This event is fired when data is received after binding. This event is fired if the binding for the chart is done by the SmartChart control itself.

deprecated.text: Use beforeRebindChart event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.56. Use beforeRebindChart event to attach/listen to the binding "events" directly

events.name: fullScreenToggled

parameters.name: fullScreen
parameters.description: If true the control is in full screen mode

events.description:
This event is fired right after the full screen mode of the SmartChart control has been changed.

Since: 1.46.

events.name: initialise
events.description: This event is fired once the control has been initialized. Note: For compatibility reasons the sap.chart library is loaded synchroniously as soon as a event handler for the initialise event has been attached. Since this event does not fulfill CSP requirements, please use event initialized instead.
events.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.65. replaced by initialized.

events.name: initialized
events.description: This event is fired once the control has been initialized, asynchronous successor of initialise.

events.name: selectionDetailsActionPress

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action that has to be processed once the action has been pressed

parameters.name: itemContexts
parameters.description: If the action is pressed on one of the items, the parameter contains the context of the pressed item. If a custom action or action group of the SelectionDetails popover is pressed, this parameter contains all contexts of the items.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The action level of action buttons. The available levels are Item, List and Group

events.description:
This event is fired when any action in the selection details popover is pressed.

Since: 1.48.

events.name: showOverlay
events.description: This event is fired right before the overlay is shown.

events.name: uiStateChange
events.description:
This event is fired when the UI state changes either via the sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart#setUiState method or the chart personalization.

Since: 1.96.15.

methods.name: getActivateTimeSeries

returnValue.description: Value of property activateTimeSeries

methods.description:
Gets current value of property activateTimeSeries.

Enables the use of timeseries on the inner chart when corresponding annotation is given

Note: This timeseries is only supported for the following TimeUnitTypes and the following chart types sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame#getVizType.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getChart

returnValue.description: The inner chart object

methods.description:
Returns the chart object used internally.
Note: Direct changes made to the inner chart object or its vizFrame might lead to inconsistencies and side effects during runtime, as the SmartChart control doesn"t listen to all changes made to the inner chart instance. To avoid this, please use the API provided by the SmartChart control itself. Note: Calling this method when the chart is not yet initialized causes the inner chart to load synchronously. This does not fulfill CSP requirements. Please use getChartAsync instead.
methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.57. replaced by #getChartAsync

methods.name: getChartAsync

returnValue.description: Promise for inner chart object

methods.description:
Returns a promise which will be resolved with the internally used chart object, once all dependencies have been loaded.
Note: Direct changes made to the inner chart object or its vizFrame might lead to inconsistencies and side effects during runtime, as the SmartChart control doesn't listen to all changes made to the inner chart instance. To avoid this, please use the API provided by the SmartChart control itself.

methods.name: getChartBindingPath

returnValue.description: Value of property chartBindingPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property chartBindingPath.

Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

methods.name: getChartType

returnValue.description: Value of property chartType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property chartType.

Specifies the type of chart to be created by the SmartChart control.

methods.name: getCurrentVariantId

returnValue.description: ID of the currently selected variant

methods.description: Returns the ID of the currently selected variant.

methods.name: getEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoBinding

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableAutoBinding.

If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEntitySet

returnValue.description: Value of property entitySet

methods.description:
Gets current value of property entitySet.

The entity set name from which to fetch data and generate the columns.
Note This is not a dynamic property.

methods.name: getHeader

returnValue.description: Value of property header

methods.description:
Gets current value of property header.

Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

methods.name: getHeaderLevel

returnValue.description: Value of property headerLevel

methods.description:
Gets current value of property headerLevel.

Semantic level of the header.
For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getHeaderStyle

returnValue.description: Value of property headerStyle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property headerStyle.

Defines style of the header.
For more information, see sap.m.Title#setTitle.

methods.name: getRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Value of property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property requestAtLeastFields.

CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history.

methods.name: getToolbar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation toolbar.

A custom toolbar that can be specified by the user to define their own buttons, icons, etc. If this is added, the SmartChart control does not create its own toolbar, but uses this one instead. However, if default actions, such as showSemanticNavigation, showFullScreenButton etc. are set, these actions are added at the left-hand side of the toolbar.

methods.name: getUseListForChartTypeSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property useListForChartTypeSelection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useListForChartTypeSelection.

Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.

Default value is true.

deprecated.text: Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types.

properties.description: The property specifies how value help, that is available for input fields, is presented. For example, it specifies whether the descriptions of the values shown in the result after a query are displayed.

properties.description: If there are value help annotations for a smart field, it is possible to specify whether the table in the value help dialog for this field will be filled initially. The default value is false, which means the table will be filled as the data fetch is not prevented. Note: As of version 1.78 the default value has been changed from true to false.
