symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField
symbols.description:
The SmartField control interprets metadata that represents entity-relationship models, data types, service capabilities, and annotations in OData services to automatically generate the underlying inner controls and reduce the amount of code needed for developing applications.

Binding and Context

Important: You must always use the standard two-way binding and provide binding context. In some cases, the OData entity is derived from the control's binding context. The OData entity property that is changed or displayed with the control is derived from the value property of the control.

Structure

The SmartField control contains a basic UI element and an optional label. In display mode the following UI elements are available to be rendered depending on the metadata:

  • Text
  • Link
  • SmartLink
In edit mode, the available UI elements are:
  • One or two Input fields (with or without a ValueHelpDialog)
  • Select
  • ComboBox
  • TextArea
  • Checkbox
  • DatePicker
  • DateTimePicker
  • TimePicker
The SmartField comes with additional built-in features, such as autocomplete and suggestions, value help dialog, recently used and recommended values, textInEditModeSource, validation, and message handling.

Usage

When to use

  • You use an OData service for your app (only OData version 2).
  • You use the smart table and your app is not performance critical. The SmartField control offers more flexibility than the controls provided directly by the smart table, especially for editing.
  • You use a smart form.

When not to use

  • You are not using OData version 2.
  • You need a different control for entering or displaying data, such as multi input, a multi combo box, step input, a radio button, or a title. In this case, use the corresponding control directly.
  • You need a different dialog for offering value help, such as the select dialog or table select dialog.
  • You use the smart table and your app is performance critical. In this case, the controls offered directly by the smart table offer less flexibility but better performance.
  • You need custom validations.

Important: Keep in mind that the SmartField control, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application.

With time, SmartField can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartField only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

properties.name: _internalFieldGroupIds
properties.description: Providing value here will overwrite the internally assigned FieldGroupIds calculated from the service metadata. This property accepts comma delimited list of FieldGroupIds.

properties.name: clientSideMandatoryCheck
properties.description:
Determines if the mandatory check of whether the field has a value happens on the client side - true or on the server side - false.

Note: If the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property of type different from Edm.String annotated as Nullable="false", the mandatory validation is performed on the client side regardless of the clientSideMandatoryCheck setting.

Example:

    <Property Name="CategoryID" Type="Edm.Decimal" Nullable="false"/>


Since: 1.38.3.

properties.name: contextEditable
properties.description:
Notifies the control whether controls using the SmartField control are editable.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: controlContext
properties.description:
Defines the context in which the layout of the SmartField control has to be interpreted.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: editable
properties.description:
Indicates whether the control is in display or edit mode.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab order.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The name of an entity set for which the control manages values. This is an optional property.

If this property is left empty, the entity set is computed by parsing the binding context path, for example, Tasks('id-1428419016778-51') is parsed to Tasks.

properties.name: expandNavigationProperties
properties.description:
Indicates if entities related to navigation properties inside the metadata are requested. If set to true, then these related entities are loaded with an $expand request.

Annotations that can have navigation properties are the following:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text for text arrangements
  • Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit and Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency for units
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl for field control

Note: Independent of the fetchValueListReadOnly value, setting this flag to true requests data from the backend.

Note: The back-end request to expand the navigation properties is sent only if the entity to which SmartField is bound is persisted. For transient entities, there is no back-end request since no such data is available.

Since: 1.48.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.117. It is recommended the expand to be using the OData Model.

properties.name: fetchValueListReadOnly
properties.description:
Indicates whether the value list collection is fetched in display mode from the resource path specified in the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList annotation.

This collection data is used to infer a descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control. However, fetching the value list collection for every SmartField instance individually may not be ideal in some performance-critical scenarios. To optimize this default behavior, you can set this property to false and provide the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation, which is used to specify the URL path name to the Entity Data Model (EDM) property from which the descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control is fetched, for example, LT (Laptop).

Note: Setting this property to false only has an effect if the value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String. In addition, applications or frameworks have to make sure the descriptive text is fetched, for example, by expanding a navigation property.

Since: 1.42.0.

properties.name: fixedValueListValidationEnabled
properties.description:
If the property is set to true, a standard validation for sap.m.ComboBox is performed. An inner control sap.m.ComboBox is created and the binding is to selectedKey. Changes at runtime are not reflected.

Note: This property switches the control in legacy mode. If set to true this will override any setting to textInEditModeSource property regarding ComboBox validation.

Note: If the property is set to false, the inner control is sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ComboBox and the binding is to enteredValue. In this case, any entered value is valid irrespective of whether it's in the predefined list or not.

Note: This property is applicable only for fixed-value scenarios.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: historyEnabled
properties.description:
If the property is set to false, history values are disabled. Changes at runtime are not reflected. The historyEnabled property is not applied to custom controls.

Note: For sap.m.ComboBox and sap.m.MultiComboBox the history values are disabled by default. To enable them for these controls, you need to set the historyEnabled property to true.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: importance
properties.description:
Specifies the importance of the field. Applicable only when the SmartField is used inside SmartForm.

Since: 1.87.

properties.name: jsontype
properties.description: Data types to be used, if the SmartField control is interacting with a JSON model. If the value property of the control is bound to a property of an OData entity set, this property is not taken into consideration.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.31.0. with no replacement.

properties.name: mandatory
properties.description:
Indicates whether user input is required.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven and this property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property is annotated with the Nullable annotation. The Nullable annotation is a capability of the OData service that specifies whether a value is mandatory, hence it overrules the control's API settings. Therefore, if the Nullable attribute is specified as Nullable="false", a value is mandatory.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description:
Defines the highest possible number of permitted input characters that the user can enter into the text input field.

Computed maxLength

If the specified maxLength value is greater than the maxLength value specified for the underlying bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property in the service metadata document, the maxLength value of the EDM property takes precedence. Likewise, if the application code provides a binding data type for the value property of the SmartField control and the binding data type has maxLength constraints defined, this maxLength is also taken into consideration to compute the final maxLength value.

Validation Behavior

By design, the SmartField control does not restrict/validate the highest number of permitted input characters for every keystroke, but only when the text input field has changed, and the browser focus leaves the text input field or the ENTER key is pressed. The SmartField control is used more generically in broader contexts, and adding a maxLength attribute to the HTML text input control may break data type formatting in two-way data-binding scenarios. Let's say the maxLength property is set to 3, but the text input control has a formatter function attached to it to format the entered value "DE" to "Germany (DE)". In this case, the formatted value will be truncated by the maxLength setting.

properties.name: name
properties.description: To be used in the HTML code (for example, for HTML forms that send data to the server via 'submit').

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Text shown when no value available.

properties.name: proposedControl
properties.description:
Proposes a control to be rendered. The SmartField control can ignore the proposal.

Since: 1.32.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32.0. with no replacement.

properties.name: showLabel
properties.description: If set to false the label is not displayed.

properties.name: showSuggestion
properties.description: If set to true, the suggestion feature for a hosted control is enabled, if the hosted control supports it.

properties.name: showValueHelp
properties.description: If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the hosted control, if the hosted control supports this.

properties.name: showValueStateMessage
properties.description: Defines whether the value state message is shown or not.

properties.name: suppressEmptyStringRequest
properties.description:
Controls if a query is sent to the backend in case of an empty string.

Since: 1.124.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Horizontal alignment of the text.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description:
The available text direction options are LTR and RTL. By default, the control inherits the text direction from its parent control.

The textDirection property can be used when, for example, the text direction in the application is LTR but you want a specific field to have RTL text direction.

Note: The textDirection property is not applicable for the SmartField control for units of measure use cases.

Since: 1.86.0.

properties.name: textInEditModeSource
properties.description:
Sets the source from which text descriptions for IDs are fetched in edit mode, for example, for LT (Laptop).

Note: The sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty and sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueList enumeration members are only supported if the following applies:

  • The value property of the SmartField control instance is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String or Edm.Guid.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation for the bound EDM property or entity type is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file.
  • The binding mode for the value property of the SmartField control is the two-way binding mode.
  • The field from which the description is fetched is filterable.

Note: In addition, the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty enumeration member is only supported if the following applies:

  • The EDM navigation property association is defined in the service metadata document.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation for the bound EDM property is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file whose Path attribute points to a EDM navigation property of a lookup entity set/type whose single key property is the ID, which contains (among other properties) the descriptive value.
  • The lookup entity must be loaded. The lookup entity can be loaded by expanding the EDM navigation property via a $expand query parameter.
  • The EDM navigation property association defines a referential constraint that ties values of the dependent editable entity type/set to the lookup entity type/set in the service metadata document.
  • The EDM navigation property association end multiplicity of the lookup entity type/set is defined as 1 in the service metadata document. There must be a single-valued navigation from the editable entity set/type to the lookup entity set/type.
  • The lookup entity type/set from which the descriptive value is fetched contains a single-key EDM property.

Note: As of version 1.82, if SmartField is used inside a SmartForm, defaultTextInEditModeSource can be added as custom data to the form and it will be propagated to all smart fields that cover the above criteria. However, if textInEditModeSource is added to the SmartField as property, it will override the defaultTextInEditModeSource propagated from the SmartForm custom data.

Note: As of version 1.107 the property will be used to configure the validation for fixed list fields of type ComboBox. The values that will be considered:

  • ValueList - strict validation
  • ValueListWarning - non-strict validation


Since: 1.83.

properties.name: textLabel
properties.description: This property contains the text of an associated SmartLabel.

properties.name: tooltipLabel
properties.description: This property contains the tool tip of the associated SmartLabel control.

properties.name: uomEditState
properties.description:
This property is for internal use only.

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: uomEditable
properties.description:
Indicates whether the unit of measure field is in display or edit mode.

Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

properties.name: uomEnabled
properties.description: Enabled state of the unit, if the SmartField control addresses unit of measure use cases, for example, an amount and its associated currency.

properties.name: uomVisible
properties.description:
Indicates whether the unit of measure field is visible.

Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this property can be ignored if the bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Contains a URL which is used to render a link. The link is rendered, if the OData property, to which the value property of the control is bound, is of type Edm.String and the SmartField is in display mode.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The binding path expression used to determine the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Important: The SmartField is a metadata-driven control. Avoid direct interaction with the value property, as it should be accessed or modified via the model itself.

Note: Composite binding expressions for this property are not supported. Note: Custom formatters for this property are not supported. The SmartField control usually creates its own data type based on the service metadata for the formatting of values. Also, when a custom formatter is specified for a property, the binding mode is automatically switched to one-way binding mode. Note: Named models are not supported, only the default model (named undefined) is supported. For example, when the binding path expression contains a > sign, the string preceding it is a named model and the remainder after the > is the binding path.

properties.name: valueHelpTitleSource
properties.description:
Controls if the title is taken from the label of the main property or from the label of the value list.

Since: 1.132.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success, Information.

Note: This method is public because of an implementation side effect and should not be used for validation purposes as it may conflict with the SmartField control's own binding type validation logic based on the underlying metadata of the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Invoking the .setValueState() and/or .setValueStateText() methods in a change event handle to set an error state does not prevent an invalid value from being stored in the binding/model in two-way data binding scenarios. In addition, it does not fire the validationError event, which is usually required by some upstream modules, for example, the message manager.

Custom validation logic must be implemented in a custom binding type rather than in a change event handler.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description:
Defines the text of the value state message popup.

Note: This method is public because of an implementation side effect and should not be used for validation purposes as it may conflict with the SmartField control's own binding type validation logic based on the underlying metadata of the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Invoking the .setValueState() and/or .setValueStateText() methods in a change event handle to set an error state does not prevent an invalid value from being stored in the binding/model in two-way data binding scenarios. In addition, it does not fire the validationError event, which is usually required by some upstream modules, for example, the message manager.

Custom validation logic must be implemented in a custom binding type rather than in a change event handler.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description:
Indicates whether the control break lines (in display mode) to prevent overflow.

Since: 1.36.6.

aggregations.name: _ariaLabelInvisibleText
aggregations.description:
Collects the texts to be used for the ARIA labels.
The InvisibleText controls will be added to the DOM by the SmartField control.

Since: 1.34.2.

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description: The content aggregation is used to hold the control that is hosted by the SmartField control.

aggregations.name: configuration
aggregations.description:
Optional configuration for SmartField.

Note: By default, the value of the displayBehaviour property is not evaluated in edit mode. To enable this feature in edit mode, set the textInEditModeSource control property to a non-default value.

aggregations.name: controlProposal
aggregations.description: Proposes a control to be rendered. The SmartField control can ignore the proposal.
aggregations.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.34.0. with no replacement.

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description:
Association to controls / IDs that describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

Since: 1.96.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

Since: 1.34.2.

annotations.name: dataType
annotations.description:
Based on the data type the SmartField determines the rendering of the inner control. Additionally the FieldControl is used. FieldControl is an annotation that contains a collection of EnumMembers that can dynamically set the state of the control. Controls used for the SmartField control during runtime are:

  • sap.m.Input of type Edm.String without value help.
    Used if control is editable and the EntityType is updatable.
  • sap.m.Input of type Edm.String with value help and suggestion list.
    Used if control is editable, the EntityType is updatable, and a ValueHelp annotations exists.

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: fieldControl
annotations.description:
Defines whether a field is mandatory, hidden, or in read-only/editable mode.

An Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be dynamically annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation in OData V4 models or with the sap:field-control annotation in OData V2 models by providing a binding path to another EDM property typed as Edm.Byte whose value in the data model can be:

  • 0; indicates that the field is hidden. Note: Hidden is a deprecated synonym for inapplicable, do not use it to statically hide a field on the user interface, but use the static FieldControl annotation instead.
  • 1; indicates that the field is in read-only mode, and its value cannot be changed. Note: To statically annotate an EDM property as read-only, use the Org.OData.Core.V1.Computed annotation instead.
  • 3; indicates that the field is editable and optional (default).
  • 7; indicates that the field is mandatory from a business perspective. This value does not imply any restrictions on the value range of an EDM property. For restricting the value range use, for example, the standard type facet Nullable with a value of false must be used to exclude the null value, or terms from the Org.OData.Validation.V1 vocabulary must be used.

Example for dynamic use, in a travel expense report the EDM property DestinationCountry is is not applicable if the trip type is domestic, and mandatory if the trip type is international. Whenever the value in the data model of the referenced EDM property changes, the field adapts its state accordingly.

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Annotated with the Dynamic FieldControl OData V4 Annotation in a Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" Path="CompanyCodeFC"/>
   </Property>

   <Property Name="CompanyCodeFC" type="Edm.Byte"/>

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Annotated with the Dynamic sap:field-control OData V2 Annotation in a Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" sap:field-control="CompanyCodeFC"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCodeFC" type="Edm.Byte"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldVisible
annotations.description:
Defines whether a field is hidden.

In OData V4 models, an Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be statically annotated as hidden with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation. A fixed value can be provided as an enumeration member (EnumMember) of the FieldControlType enumeration.

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Hidden in an OData V4 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
   </Property>

In OData V2 models, an EDM property can be statically annotated as hidden with the sap:visible annotation:

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Hidden in an OData V2 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" sap:visible="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldReadOnly
annotations.description:
Defines whether the field is read-only.

In OData V4 models, an Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be statically annotated as read-only with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

A fixed value can be provided as an enumeration member (EnumMember) of the FieldControlType enumeration.

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Read-only in an OData V4 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/ReadOnly"/>
   </Property>

In OData V2 models, an EDM property can be statically annotated as read-only with the sap:updatable annotation:

XML Example Extract of an EDM Property Statically Annotated as Read-only in an OData V2 Service Metadata Document

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:updatable="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldMandatory
annotations.description:
Defines whether the control is mandatory. A fixed value can be provided as EnumMember FieldControlType/Mandatory of the FieldControl annotation. The mandatory property of the SmartField control renders the field as mandatory input. A SmartField can only be mandatory if the corresponding EntityType is at least annotated as com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Updatable.

XML Example of OData V4 with static Mandatory Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Property Name="Customer">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Mandatory"/>
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Mandatory"/>
   </Property>

For OData V2 the Nullable property on the Property can be used to specify whether the field is mandatory.

   <Property Name="Customer" ...Nullable="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... Nullable="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldMasked
annotations.description:
Determines that a control must not display the actual value in a field with sensitive data, but replace it with a placeholder, for example, *. Use this annotation for sensitive data.

XML Example of OData V4 with Masked Password property

  <Property Name="Password" />
  <Annotations Target="Password" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Masked" />
  </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldLabel
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for labels on user interfaces. Renders the value associated with the label annotation of a Property, which can be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with CustomerName as Label for Customer

  <Property Name="Customer">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label" Path="CustomerName" />
  </Property>
  <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String" />

For OData V2 the sap:label annotation on the Property can be used to assign a label.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:label="Customer Name"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:label="Company Code"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldText
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property. Note: The value must be a dynamic expression when used as metadata annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 Text on CustomerName Property

<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CustomerName" />
Note: The Path property is mandatory.

For OData V2 the sap:text annotation on the Property can be used to assign a text/description.

   <Property Name="Customer" type="Edm.String" sap:text="CustomerName"/>
   <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String"/>

Note: If textInEditModeSource is set to None, the Text annotation won't be taken into consideration in edit mode.

Note: The Text annotation is not respected in edit mode and dropdown scenario when a sap.m.ComboBox or a sap.m.Select is rendered. For example, when added the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation and set com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListWithFixedValues to true, the text will be populated with corresponding value from the ValueList Collection's item. The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement will be applied in both cases.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldTextArrangement
annotations.description:
Describes the arrangement of an ID value and its description.

Note: By default, this annotation is not evaluated in edit mode. To enable this feature in edit mode, set the textInEditModeSource control property to a non-default value.

The following enumeration members are allowed:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextSeparate: The control displays the specified ID only.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst: The control displays the specified description followed by its ID.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast: The control displays the specified ID followed by its description.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextOnly: The control displays the specified description only.

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on an entity's property

<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Category">
	<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CategoryName">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast" />
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on entity Product

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.ProductType">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: fieldCurrencyCode
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
Defines a currency code for an amount according to the ISO 4217 standard. ISOCurrency annotation can point to a Property, which can also be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with Price and CurrencyCode as ISOCurrency

   <Property Name="Price">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency" Path="CurrencyCode" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CurrencyCode" type="Edm.String" />

For OData V2 the sap:semantics="currency-code" along with sap:unit annotations on the Property can be used to assign a currency code to the field.

   <Property Name="Price" ... sap:unit="CurrencyCode"/>
   <Property Name="CurrencyCode" ... sap:semantics="currency-code"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldUnitOfMeasure
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The unit of measure for this measured quantity, for example, cm for centimeters. Renders the value associated with the unit annotation of a Property, which can be null.

XML Example of OData V4 with OrderedQuantity and OrderedUnit as Unit

   <Property Name="OrderedQuantity">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit" Path="OrderedUnit" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="OrderedUnit" type="Edm.String" />

For OData V2 the sap:semantics="unit-of-measure" along with sap:unit annotations on the Property can be used to assign a unit of measure to the field.

   <Property Name="OrderedQuantity" ... sap:unit="OrderedUnit"/>
   <Property Name="OrderedUnit" ... sap:semantics="unit-of-measure"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldScale
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
Defines the number of digits that are to be displayed after the decimal point. This annotation can be applied to a Property.

XML Example of OData V4 with Scaled Price and Weight Properties

   <Property Name="Price">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Scale" Path="PriceScale" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="Weight">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Scale" Path="WeightScale" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="PriceScale" type="Edm.Byte" />
   <Property Name="WeightScale" type="Edm.Byte" />

For OData V2 the sap:precision annotation on the Property can be used to scale the number of digits that are displayed after the decimal point.

   <Property Name="Price" ... sap:precision="2"/>
   <Property Name="Weight" ... sap:precision="3"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldQuickInfo
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for tooltips in user interfaces.

XML Example of OData V4 with Tooltip on CompanyCode Property

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.QuickInfo" Path="CompanyCodeQuickInfo" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyQuickInfo" type="Edm.String" />

For OData V2 the sap:quickinfo annotation on the Property can be used to assign information relevant for tooltips of the field.

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:quickinfo="Company Code quickinfo"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldMultiLineText
annotations.description:
Properties annotated with this annotation are rendered as multi-line text (for example, text area).

XML Example of OData V4 with Multi-line Text Description Property

   <Property Name="Description" />
   <Annotations Target="Description">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.MultiLineText" />
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldUpperCase
annotations.description:
Defines whether a string value is capitalized.

XML Example of OData V4 with Capitalized Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsUpperCase">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:display-format="UpperCase" annotation on the Property can be used to render the text in uppercase format.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldDigitSequence
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property contains only digit sequences (non-negative numeric values).

Other input leads to validation errors and the value state message popup is shown. In addition, whenever the control's value property is changed on the user interface side, and the change has to be propagated back into the data model, then the value is either filled with leading zeroes (if the maxLength attribute is given) or the leading zeroes are removed (if no maxLength attribute is given).

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP NUMC (numeric text) data type.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsDigitSequence" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.46.

annotations.name: fieldRecommendationState
annotations.description:
Indicates whether a field has a recommended value. Intelligent systems can help users by recommending input the user may prefer.

This annotation is intended for editable fields for which a recommended input has been pre-filled by a system and is used to highlight a field.

Note: The RecommendationState annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

<Property Name="Name" Type="Edm.String" />
<Property Name="Name_sr" Type="Edm.Byte"/>
...
<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Name">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.RecommendationState" Path="Name_sr" />
</Annotations>

The following values are allowed for the edm:property typed as Edm.Byte:

  • 0 regular: With human or default input, no recommendation
  • 1 highlighted: Without human input and with recommendation
  • 2 warning: With human or default input and with recommendation

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.61.

annotations.name: fieldCalendarDate
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the pattern 'yyyyMMdd'.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the pattern 'YYYYMMDD'.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarDate" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

   <Property Name="Email" Type="Edm.String"/>

       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.IsEmailAddress" Bool="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Indicates whether a Property contains a phone number.

   <Annotations Target="Phone">

   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.46.

annotations.name: fieldUrl
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Core.V1
annotations.description:
Indicates whether a Property contains a URL.

XML Example of the OData V4 URL Annotation

   <Property Name="URL" Type="Edm.String"/>

       <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Core.V1.IsURL" Bool="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.46.

annotations.name: fieldCreatable
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
Defines whether an EntitySet can be created.

XML Example of OData V4 with Insertable ProductCollection EntitySet

  <EntitySet Name="ProductCollection">
    <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions">
      <Record>
        <PropertyValue Property="Insertable" Bool="true" />
      </Record>
    </Annotation>
  </EntitySet>

For OData V2 the sap:creatable annotation on the Property can be used to specify that the field is creatable.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:creatable="true"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:creatable="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldComputed
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Core.V1
annotations.description:
Defines whether a Property can be created. A value for this Property is generated on both insert and update actions.

XML Example of OData V4 with Computed Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Core.V1.Computed">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:creatable and sap:updatable annotation on the Property can be used to specify whether a value has to be created on insert and update actions.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:creatable="true"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:creatable="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldUpdatableEntitySet
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
Defines whether an EntitySet can be updated.

XML Example of OData V4 with Updatable ProductCollection EntitySet

  <Annotations Target="namespace/ProductCollection">
    <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions">
      <Record>
        <PropertyValue Property="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictionsType/Updatable" Bool="false" />
      </Record>
    </Annotation>
  </Annotations>

For OData V2 the sap:updatable annotation on the Property can be used to specify whether a field is updatable.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:updatable="true"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:updatable="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldImmutable
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Core.V1
annotations.description:
A value for this non-key property can be provided on insert and cannot even be changed on update actions.

XML Example of OData V4 with Immutable Customer and CompanyCode properties

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Core.V1.Immutable">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:updatable and sap:creatable annotation on the Property can be used to avoid changes that can be done on update actions.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:creatable="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:creatable="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldSideEffects
annotations.description:
Changes to the source properties may have side-effects on the target properties or entities. If neither TargetProperties nor TargetEntities are specified, a change to the source property values may have unforeseeable side-effects. An empty NavigationPropertyPath may be used in TargetEntities to specify that any property of the annotated entity type may be affected. Actions are a special case: here the change trigger is the action invocation, so SourceProperties and SourceEntities have no meaning, only TargetProperties and TargetEntities are relevant. They are addressed via the binding parameter of the action. SideEffects can be associated with the given entity, which can be a complex type, entity type or entity set. In addition to this, SideEffects can also be applied to a PropertyPath or a NavigationPropertyPath of the given entity.

XML Example of OData V4 with Side Effect on CurrencyCode Property

  <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.SideEffects" Qualifier="ExampleQualifierName">
    <Record>
      <PropertyValue Property="SourceProperties">
        <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>CurrencyCode</PropertyPath>
        </Collection>
      </PropertyValue>
      <PropertyValue Property="TargetProperties">
        <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>CurrencyCode</PropertyPath>
        </Collection>
      </PropertyValue>
      <PropertyValue Property="EffectTypes" EnumMember="ValidationMessage" />
    </Record>
  </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: valueList
annotations.description:
Specifies how to get a list of acceptable values for a property or parameter. Provides the value help dialog and type-ahead function.

Note: This annotation is only supported for Entity Data Model (EDM) properties typed as:

  • Edm.String
  • Edm.Guid

The annotation supports a FetchValues property. When it is set to 2, the table in the ValueHelpDialog is not populated on initial load. When it is set to 1, the table is populated with values on initial load.

Note: The CollectionPath property does not support paths with navigation properties.

Note: The CollectionRoot property is not supported.

Optional: ValueListParameterIn specifies a property that is used to filter the value list.

Experimental: InitialValueIsSignificant property for ValueListParameterIn specifies initial property value is considered significant when filtering the value list.

Optional: ValueListParameterOut specifies a property that is filled depending on the selection from the value list.

Optional: ValueListParameterConstant specifies a constant value that is used to filter the value list with exact match. The constant value is hidden from the UI.

Optional: Each parameter can be statically annotated as important with the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance annotation. com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/High must be provided as an enumeration member (EnumMember).

Only the important parameters are displayed as columns in the suggestion list.

If the Importance annotation is not used, all of the parameters are displayed.

Example in OData V4 annotation with property "Category" with a ValueList

XML Example of OData V4 Value List on Category Property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Category" />
       <PropertyValue Property="CollectionPath" String="Category" />
       <PropertyValue Property="SearchSupported" Bool="true" />
       <PropertyValue Property="FetchValues" Int="2" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Parameters">
         <Collection>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterInOut">
             <PropertyValue Property="LocalDataProperty" PropertyPath="Category" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="Description" />
             <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance"
               EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/High" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly">
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="CategoryName" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterIn">
             <PropertyValue Property="LocalDataProperty" PropertyPath="Supplier" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="SupplierName" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterOut">
             <PropertyValue Property="LocalDataProperty" PropertyPath="Product" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="ProductId" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterConstant">
             <PropertyValue Property="Constant" String="Automotive" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="CategoryType" />
           </Record>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: valueListRelevantQualifiers
annotations.description:
List of qualifiers of relevant ValueList annotations

The value of this annotation is a dynamic expression that allows you to limit the number of relevant value list qualifiers based on the specific values of one or more other properties.

Example in OData V4 annotation with property "Category" with a ValueList

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.Category">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListRelevantQualifiers">
       <Collection>
         <String>ShowAlways<String>
         <If>
           <Path>IS_MANAGER</Path>
           <String>Manager</String>
         </If>
         <If>
           <Eq>
             <Path>USER_TYPE</Path>
             <String>personnel</String>
           </Eq>
           <String>Personnel</String>
         </If>
       </Collection>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.96.

annotations.name: valueListWithFixedValues
annotations.description:
If set to true, there's only one value list mapping, and its value list consists of a small number of fixed values. The value list is rendered as a dropdown list containing all possible values.

Note: As of version 1.78, value lists with fixed values support the use of the ValueListParameterIn and ValueListParameterOut properties.

Note: This annotation is only supported for Entity Data Model (EDM) properties typed as:

  • Edm.String
  • Edm.Guid
  • Edm.Boolean
  • Edm.Byte
  • Edm.Decimal
  • Edm.Double
  • Edm.Float
  • Edm.Single
  • Edm.Int16
  • Edm.Int32
  • Edm.Int64

XML Example of OData V4 Value List on Category Property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListWithFixedValues" Bool="true"/>

* For OData V2, the sap:value-list="fixed-values" annotation can be added to the Property.

   <Property Name="Name" ... sap:value-list="fixed-values"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.1.

annotations.name: isConfigurationDeprecationCode
annotations.description:
Defines the status of all fields of the ValueHelpDialog control as valid, deprecated or revoked. Each status has a corresponding letter. For deprecated it's W, for revoked E and for valid we use an empty string. Note: Values with revoked status are hidden. The only way to visualize them is to filter all values by typing the corresponding letter for revoked types E in the DeprecationCode filtering input field in the ValueHelpDialog.

Note: As of version 1.132.0, revoked values are considered invalid and selecting them will result in a value state error. Deprecated values are treated as valid but marked with a warning. This scenario is limited only to cases when textInEditModeSource is used. * Example in OData V4 notation with property DeprecationCode 

    <Property Name="DeprecationCode" Type="Edm.String" MaxLength="1"/>

    <Annotations Target="DeprecationCode" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.CodeList.v1.IsConfigurationDeprecationCode" Bool="true"/>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.77.

annotations.name: currencyCodes
annotations.description:
Defines a custom list for currencies in the model.

Note: Annotation is applied to entity container.

When this annotations is added, the SmartField takes care of the validation and formatting of the values according to the definitions in the custom list.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation with property CurrencyCode 

    <Property Name="CurrencyCode" Type="Edm.String" MaxLength="3" sap:label="CurrencyCode" sap:updatable="true" sap:creatable="false" sap:semantics="currency-code"/>

    <EntityType Name="SAP__Currency" sap:content-version="1">
        <Key/>
            <PropertyRef Name="CurrencyCode"/>
        </Key>
        <Property Name="CurrencyCode" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="5" sap:label="Currency" sap:semantics="currency-code"/>
        <Property Name="ISOCode" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="3" sap:label="ISO Code"/>
        <Property Name="Text" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="15" sap:label="Short Text"/>
        <Property Name="DecimalPlaces" Type="Edm.Byte" Nullable="false" sap:label="Decimals"/>
    </EntityType>

    <EntityContainer Name="EmployeesNamespace_Entities" m:IsDefaultEntityContainer="true" sap:supported-formats="atom json xlsx">
        <EntitySet Name="SAP__Currencies" EntityType="EmployeesNamespace.SAP__Currency" sap:creatable="false" sap:updatable="false" sap:deletable="false" sap:pageable="false" sap:content-version="1"/>
    </EntityContainer>

    <Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="EmployeesNamespace.EmployeesNamespace_Entities">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.CodeList.v1.CurrencyCodes">
            <Record>
                <PropertyValue Property="Url" String="./$metadata"/>
                <PropertyValue Property="CollectionPath" String="SAP__Currencies"/>
            </Record>
        </Annotation>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.91.

annotations.name: unitsOfMeasure
annotations.description:
Defines a custom list for units of measures in the model.

Note: Annotation is applied to entity container.

When this annotations is added, the SmartField takes care of the validation and formatting of the values according to the definitions in the custom list.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation with property UnitCode 

    <Property Name="UnitCode" Type="Edm.String" sap:semantics="unit-of-measure" MaxLength="3" sap:label="Unit" sap:updatable="true"/>

    <EntityType Name="SAP__UnitsOfMeasure" sap:content-version="1">
        <Key/>
            <PropertyRef Name="UnitCode"/>
        </Key>
        <Property Name="UnitCode" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="3" sap:label="Internal UoM" sap:semantics="unit-of-measure"/>
        <Property Name="ISOCode" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="3" sap:label="ISO Code"/>
        <Property Name="ExternalCode" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="3" sap:label="Commercial"/>
        <Property Name="Text" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="30" sap:label="UoM Text"/>
        <Property Name="DecimalPlaces" Type="Edm.Int16" sap:label="Decimal Places"/>
    </EntityType>

    <EntityContainer Name="EmployeesNamespace_Entities" m:IsDefaultEntityContainer="true" sap:supported-formats="atom json xlsx">
        <EntitySet Name="SAP__UnitsOfMeasure" EntityType="EmployeesNamespace.SAP__UnitsOfMeasure" sap:creatable="false" sap:updatable="false" sap:deletable="false" sap:pageable="false" sap:content-version="1"/>
    </EntityContainer>

    <Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="EmployeesNamespace.EmployeesNamespace_Entities">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.CodeList.v1.UnitsOfMeasure">
            <Record>
                <PropertyValue Property="Url" String="./$metadata"/>
                <PropertyValue Property="CollectionPath" String="SAP__UnitsOfMeasure"/>
            </Record>
        </Annotation>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.91.

annotations.name: presentationVariant
annotations.description:
Provides the possibility to order the values of the value list by property and in ascending or descending order. Note: The annotation should point to the EntityType of the value list with fixed values. Note: The property by which the values are ordered should be part of the EntityType of the value list with fixed values.

Example in OData V4 notation with property CompanyCode 

 <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant">
   <Record>
    <PropertyValue Property="SortOrder">
      <Collection>
        <Record>
          <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode"/>
          <PropertyValue Property="Descending" Bool="true"/>
        </Record>
      </Collection>
    </PropertyValue>
   </Record>
 </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: fieldHighImportance
annotations.description:

Since: 1.87.0.

annotations.name: hidden
annotations.description:
Defines whether a field is hidden.

In OData V4 models, an Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be statically annotated as hidden with the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 with com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden Title Property 

    <Annotations Target="ProductPictureURL" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden"/>
    </Annotations>

An EDM property can also be dynamically annotated as hidden by providing a binding path to another EDM property of type Edm.Boolean.

XML Example of OData V4 with com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden Title Property with binding path 

    <Annotations Target="ProductPictureURL" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden" Path="CompanyCode" />
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.90.

annotations.name: fieldMediumImportance
annotations.description:
Indicates that the SmartField is of medium importance. When SmartField is used inside SmartForm, the field will be hidden when the importance property of the form is set to low.

Note: If the field is annotated as mandatory or hidden, its visibility will not change based on this annotation.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" />
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/Medium"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.87.0.

annotations.name: fieldLowImportance
annotations.description:
Indicates that the SmartField is of low importance. When SmartField is used inside SmartForm, the field will be hidden when the importance property of the form is set to medium or high.

Note: If the field is annotated as mandatory or hidden, its visibility will change based on this annotation.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" />
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/Low"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.87.0.

annotations.name: timezone
annotations.description:
Indicates whether a Property of type Edm.DateTimeOffset contains a timezone.

XML Example of the OData V4 Timezone Annotation

   <Annotations Target="Created">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Timezone" Path="Timezone"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.113.

annotations.name: calendarYear
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the 'y' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'y' pattern.

Note: The IsCalendarYear annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYear" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: lineItem
annotations.description:
Configures Criticality for the SmartField to rendered ObjectStatus control.

XML Example of OData V4 Customer and Criticality Properties as LineItem 

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem">
       <Collection>
			<Record Type="UI.DataField">
				<PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
				<PropertyValue Property="CriticalityRepresentation" EnumMember="UI.CriticalityRepresentationType/WithoutIcon"/>
				<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Customer"/>
			</Record>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

The following record type is supported: DataField.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.123.

annotations.name: dataFieldDefault
annotations.description:
Configures Criticality for the SmartField to rendered ObjectStatus control.

XML Example of OData V4 Customer Property with DataFieldDefault 

<Annotations Target="Namespace.EntityType/Customer">
	<Annotation Term="UI.DataFieldDefault">
		<Record Type="UI.DataField">
			<PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
			<PropertyValue Property="CriticalityRepresentation" EnumMember="UI.CriticalityRepresentationType/WithoutIcon"/>
		</Record>
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

The following record type is supported: DataField.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
The current value inside the text field

Note: This value is the formatted value, and in some cases it might differ from the value stored in the binding/model. Usually, the value that is sent to the back-end system should be the value stored in the binding/model, which is the parsed and validated value.

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The new value inside the text field

events.description:
The event is fired after the text in the field has been changed and the focus leaves the field, or after the Enter key has been pressed.

Note: This event is fired even if the value of the text input field is subject to data type constraints and the constraints are violated. Also, the invalid value is not stored in the binding/model.

events.name: changeModelValue

parameters.name: valueChanged
parameters.description: Indicates whether the field quantity field has changed

parameters.name: valueLastValueState
parameters.description: Last value of the valueState property of the field quantity field

parameters.name: unitChanged
parameters.description: Indicates whether the field unit field has changed

parameters.name: unitLastValueState
parameters.description: Last value of the valueState property of the field unit field

events.description:
Fired after the text in the field has been changed by user interaction in combination with one of the following actions:

  • The focus leaves the field
  • The Enter key is pressed
  • The value is selected from the suggestions list
  • The value is selected from the ValueHelpDialog

If the value of the text input field is subject to data type constraints, the constraints must be fulfilled, which implies the value is stored in the binding/model before the event is fired.

This event bubbles up the control hierarchy.

events.name: contextEditableChanged

parameters.name: editable

events.description:
Fired when the control is rendered if the value of contextEditable property of the control has changed.

parameters.name: editable

events.description:

methods.name: _setVisibilityBasedOnImportance

parameters.name: sFormImportance
parameters.description: The SmartForm importance property

methods.description: Changes the visibility of the SmartField based on the SmartField and SmartForm importance property. When the SmartForm has importance high, only fields with high importance will be visible. When the SmartForm has importance medium, only fields with high or medium importance will be shown. When the SmartForm has importance low, all fields will be visible.

methods.name: checkClientError

returnValue.description: true, if a client error has been detected, false otherwise

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description: Settings

parameters.name: handleSuccess
parameters.description: Indicates whether client error checks are performed for the current value regardless of the current error state of the control. If the handleSuccess setting is set to true, the text input field fires a sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationSuccess if its validation passes.

methods.description:
Checks whether a client error has been detected in edit mode. Additionally the error message is shown, if this is not the case already.

This method is typically used to check whether the value of every inner text input field in edit mode is subject to data type constraints and whether the constraints are fulfilled.

A data type constraint for a bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be violated in many ways, for example:

  • The Nullable constraint for an EDM property typed as Edm.String is violated.
  • A user input is invalid for the bound EDM property typed as Edm.DateTime.

If this happens, the following applies:

  • A validation error state is set on the text input field.
  • A validation error message is displayed for the text input field.
  • The validation error message (possibly generated by a user input) is added to a sap.ui.core.message.MessageManager object instance if, for example, a view object instance is registered to it.
  • The inner private text input field fires a sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationError, or sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:parseError event.
methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.64. replaced by sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#checkValuesValidity

methods.name: checkUnitValidity

returnValue.description: Indicates validity of the values

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description: Additional settings

methods.description: Checks the validity of the values for the given control.

methods.name: checkValuesValidity

returnValue.description: A fulfilled Promise object or a Promise object to be fulfilled if the value of every text input field is valid, otherwise a rejected Promise object or a Promise object to be rejected

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description: Settings

parameters.name: handleSuccess
parameters.description: Indicates whether client error checks are performed for the current value regardless of the current error state of the control. If the handleSuccess setting is set to false, the text input field will not fire a sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationSuccess if its validation passes.

methods.description:
Checks whether the value of every inner text input field in edit mode is valid.

This method is typically used to check whether the value of every inner text input field in edit mode is subject to data type constraints and whether the constraints are fulfilled.

Note: In some scenarios, invoking this method may also trigger a back-end request to check whether the value is valid.

A data type constraint for a bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be violated in many ways, for example:

  • The Nullable constraint for an EDM property typed as Edm.String is violated.
  • A user input is invalid for the bound EDM property typed as Edm.DateTime.

If this happens, the following applies:

  • A validation error state is set on the text input field.
  • A validation error message is displayed for the text input field.
  • The validation error message (possibly generated by a user input) is added to a sap.ui.core.message.MessageManager object instance if, for example, a view object instance is registered to it.
  • The inner private text input field fires a sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationError, or sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:parseError event. Note that the events are fired synchronously if the value is validated on client side or asynchronously if, for example, the value is validated on back-end side.

The inner private text input field fires a sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationSuccess if its validation passes.

Note: In display mode, this method always returns a fulfilled Promise object.

Note: In two-way data binding scenarios, it is usually not necessary to invoke this method explicitly to validate user input, as the data type validation is done automatically when the value in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the text input field or the enter key is pressed. However, in two-way data binding scenarios, this method may be used to check whether a value is valid before submitting it to the back-end system.

examples.data:
Example: Example usage of sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#checkValuesValidity method

	var oPromise = oSmartField.checkValuesValidity();
	oPromise.then(function() {
		// the value is valid and pending model changes can be submitted to the back-end system
	}).catch(function() {
		// the value is invalid
	});

methods.name: getClientSideMandatoryCheck

returnValue.description: Value of property clientSideMandatoryCheck

methods.description:
Gets current value of property clientSideMandatoryCheck.

Determines if the mandatory check of whether the field has a value happens on the client side - true or on the server side - false.

Note: If the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property of type different from Edm.String annotated as Nullable="false", the mandatory validation is performed on the client side regardless of the clientSideMandatoryCheck setting.

Example:

    <Property Name="CategoryID" Type="Edm.Decimal" Nullable="false"/>

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEditable

returnValue.description: Value of property editable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property editable.

Indicates whether the control is in display or edit mode.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property enabled

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enabled.

Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab order.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEntitySet

returnValue.description: Value of property entitySet

methods.description:
Gets current value of property entitySet.

The name of an entity set for which the control manages values. This is an optional property.

If this property is left empty, the entity set is computed by parsing the binding context path, for example, Tasks('id-1428419016778-51') is parsed to Tasks.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getExpandNavigationProperties

returnValue.description: Value of property expandNavigationProperties

methods.description:
Gets current value of property expandNavigationProperties.

Indicates if entities related to navigation properties inside the metadata are requested. If set to true, then these related entities are loaded with an $expand request.

Annotations that can have navigation properties are the following:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text for text arrangements
  • Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit and Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency for units
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl for field control

Note: Independent of the fetchValueListReadOnly value, setting this flag to true requests data from the backend.

Note: The back-end request to expand the navigation properties is sent only if the entity to which SmartField is bound is persisted. For transient entities, there is no back-end request since no such data is available.

Default value is false.

deprecated.text: It is recommended the expand to be using the OData Model.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.117. It is recommended the expand to be using the OData Model.

methods.name: getFetchValueListReadOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property fetchValueListReadOnly

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fetchValueListReadOnly.

Indicates whether the value list collection is fetched in display mode from the resource path specified in the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList annotation.

This collection data is used to infer a descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control. However, fetching the value list collection for every SmartField instance individually may not be ideal in some performance-critical scenarios. To optimize this default behavior, you can set this property to false and provide the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation, which is used to specify the URL path name to the Entity Data Model (EDM) property from which the descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control is fetched, for example, LT (Laptop).

Note: Setting this property to false only has an effect if the value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String. In addition, applications or frameworks have to make sure the descriptive text is fetched, for example, by expanding a navigation property.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getFixedValueListValidationEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property fixedValueListValidationEnabled

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fixedValueListValidationEnabled.

If the property is set to true, a standard validation for sap.m.ComboBox is performed. An inner control sap.m.ComboBox is created and the binding is to selectedKey. Changes at runtime are not reflected.

Note: This property switches the control in legacy mode. If set to true this will override any setting to textInEditModeSource property regarding ComboBox validation.

Note: If the property is set to false, the inner control is sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ComboBox and the binding is to enteredValue. In this case, any entered value is valid irrespective of whether it's in the predefined list or not.

Note: This property is applicable only for fixed-value scenarios.

Default value is false.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.31.0. with no replacement.

methods.name: getMandatory

returnValue.description: Value of property mandatory

methods.description:
Gets current value of property mandatory.

Indicates whether user input is required.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven and this property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property is annotated with the Nullable annotation. The Nullable annotation is a capability of the OData service that specifies whether a value is mandatory, hence it overrules the control's API settings. Therefore, if the Nullable attribute is specified as Nullable="false", a value is mandatory.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getMaxLength

returnValue.description: Value of property maxLength

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxLength.

Defines the highest possible number of permitted input characters that the user can enter into the text input field.

Computed maxLength

If the specified maxLength value is greater than the maxLength value specified for the underlying bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property in the service metadata document, the maxLength value of the EDM property takes precedence. Likewise, if the application code provides a binding data type for the value property of the SmartField control and the binding data type has maxLength constraints defined, this maxLength is also taken into consideration to compute the final maxLength value.

Validation Behavior

By design, the SmartField control does not restrict/validate the highest number of permitted input characters for every keystroke, but only when the text input field has changed, and the browser focus leaves the text input field or the ENTER key is pressed. The SmartField control is used more generically in broader contexts, and adding a maxLength attribute to the HTML text input control may break data type formatting in two-way data-binding scenarios. Let's say the maxLength property is set to 3, but the text input control has a formatter function attached to it to format the entered value "DE" to "Germany (DE)". In this case, the formatted value will be truncated by the maxLength setting.

Default value is 0.
