methods.description:
Gets current value of property textAlign.

Horizontal alignment of the text.

Default value is Initial.

methods.name: getTextDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property textDirection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property textDirection.

The available text direction options are LTR and RTL. By default, the control inherits the text direction from its parent control.

The textDirection property can be used when, for example, the text direction in the application is LTR but you want a specific field to have RTL text direction.

Note: The textDirection property is not applicable for the SmartField control for units of measure use cases.

Default value is Inherit.

methods.name: getTextInEditModeSource

returnValue.description: Value of property textInEditModeSource

methods.description:
Gets current value of property textInEditModeSource.

Sets the source from which text descriptions for IDs are fetched in edit mode, for example, for LT (Laptop).

Note: The sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty and sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueList enumeration members are only supported if the following applies:

  • The value property of the SmartField control instance is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String or Edm.Guid.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation for the bound EDM property or entity type is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file.
  • The binding mode for the value property of the SmartField control is the two-way binding mode.
  • The field from which the description is fetched is filterable.

Note: In addition, the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty enumeration member is only supported if the following applies:

  • The EDM navigation property association is defined in the service metadata document.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation for the bound EDM property is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file whose Path attribute points to a EDM navigation property of a lookup entity set/type whose single key property is the ID, which contains (among other properties) the descriptive value.
  • The lookup entity must be loaded. The lookup entity can be loaded by expanding the EDM navigation property via a $expand query parameter.
  • The EDM navigation property association defines a referential constraint that ties values of the dependent editable entity type/set to the lookup entity type/set in the service metadata document.
  • The EDM navigation property association end multiplicity of the lookup entity type/set is defined as 1 in the service metadata document. There must be a single-valued navigation from the editable entity set/type to the lookup entity set/type.
  • The lookup entity type/set from which the descriptive value is fetched contains a single-key EDM property.

Note: As of version 1.82, if SmartField is used inside a SmartForm, defaultTextInEditModeSource can be added as custom data to the form and it will be propagated to all smart fields that cover the above criteria. However, if textInEditModeSource is added to the SmartField as property, it will override the defaultTextInEditModeSource propagated from the SmartForm custom data.

Note: As of version 1.107 the property will be used to configure the validation for fixed list fields of type ComboBox. The values that will be considered:

  • ValueList - strict validation
  • ValueListWarning - non-strict validation

Default value is None.

methods.name: getUomEditable

returnValue.description: Value of property uomEditable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property uomEditable.

Indicates whether the unit of measure field is in display or edit mode.

Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this control property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable annotation.
  • The bound EDM property or its entity set are annotated with the sap:creatable annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V2 sap:updatable-path annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.InsertRestrictions annotation.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.UpdateRestrictions annotation.

methods.name: getValue

returnValue.description: Value of property value

methods.description:
Gets current value of property value.

The binding path expression used to determine the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Important: The SmartField is a metadata-driven control. Avoid direct interaction with the value property, as it should be accessed or modified via the model itself.

Note: Composite binding expressions for this property are not supported. Note: Custom formatters for this property are not supported. The SmartField control usually creates its own data type based on the service metadata for the formatting of values. Also, when a custom formatter is specified for a property, the binding mode is automatically switched to one-way binding mode. Note: Named models are not supported, only the default model (named undefined) is supported. For example, when the binding path expression contains a > sign, the string preceding it is a named model and the remainder after the > is the binding path.

methods.name: getValueState

returnValue.description: Value of property valueState

methods.description:
Gets current value of property valueState.

Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success, Information.

Note: This method is public because of an implementation side effect and should not be used for validation purposes as it may conflict with the SmartField control's own binding type validation logic based on the underlying metadata of the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Invoking the .setValueState() and/or .setValueStateText() methods in a change event handle to set an error state does not prevent an invalid value from being stored in the binding/model in two-way data binding scenarios. In addition, it does not fire the validationError event, which is usually required by some upstream modules, for example, the message manager.

Custom validation logic must be implemented in a custom binding type rather than in a change event handler.

Default value is None.

methods.name: setExpandNavigationProperties

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bExpandNavigationProperties
parameters.description: New value for property expandNavigationProperties

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property expandNavigationProperties.

Indicates if entities related to navigation properties inside the metadata are requested. If set to true, then these related entities are loaded with an $expand request.

Annotations that can have navigation properties are the following:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text for text arrangements
  • Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit and Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency for units
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl for field control

Note: Independent of the fetchValueListReadOnly value, setting this flag to true requests data from the backend.

Note: The back-end request to expand the navigation properties is sent only if the entity to which SmartField is bound is persisted. For transient entities, there is no back-end request since no such data is available.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

deprecated.text: It is recommended the expand to be using the OData Model.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.117. It is recommended the expand to be using the OData Model.

methods.name: setFetchValueListReadOnly

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bFetchValueListReadOnly
parameters.description: New value for property fetchValueListReadOnly

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property fetchValueListReadOnly.

Indicates whether the value list collection is fetched in display mode from the resource path specified in the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList annotation.

This collection data is used to infer a descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control. However, fetching the value list collection for every SmartField instance individually may not be ideal in some performance-critical scenarios. To optimize this default behavior, you can set this property to false and provide the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation, which is used to specify the URL path name to the Entity Data Model (EDM) property from which the descriptive text for the value of the SmartField control is fetched, for example, LT (Laptop).

Note: Setting this property to false only has an effect if the value property of the SmartField control is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String. In addition, applications or frameworks have to make sure the descriptive text is fetched, for example, by expanding a navigation property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

Note: This property switches the control in legacy mode. If set to true this will override any setting to textInEditModeSource property regarding ComboBox validation.

Note: If the property is set to false, the inner control is sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ComboBox and the binding is to enteredValue. In this case, any entered value is valid irrespective of whether it's in the predefined list or not.

Note: This property is applicable only for fixed-value scenarios.

methods.name: setMandatory

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bMandatory
parameters.description: New value for property mandatory

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property mandatory.

Indicates whether user input is required.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven and this property can be ignored if the following applies:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property is annotated with the Nullable annotation. The Nullable annotation is a capability of the OData service that specifies whether a value is mandatory, hence it overrules the control's API settings. Therefore, if the Nullable attribute is specified as Nullable="false", a value is mandatory.
  • The bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setMaxLength

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iMaxLength
parameters.description: New value for property maxLength

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property maxLength.

Defines the highest possible number of permitted input characters that the user can enter into the text input field.

Computed maxLength

If the specified maxLength value is greater than the maxLength value specified for the underlying bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property in the service metadata document, the maxLength value of the EDM property takes precedence. Likewise, if the application code provides a binding data type for the value property of the SmartField control and the binding data type has maxLength constraints defined, this maxLength is also taken into consideration to compute the final maxLength value.

Validation Behavior

By design, the SmartField control does not restrict/validate the highest number of permitted input characters for every keystroke, but only when the text input field has changed, and the browser focus leaves the text input field or the ENTER key is pressed. The SmartField control is used more generically in broader contexts, and adding a maxLength attribute to the HTML text input control may break data type formatting in two-way data-binding scenarios. Let's say the maxLength property is set to 3, but the text input control has a formatter function attached to it to format the entered value "DE" to "Germany (DE)". In this case, the formatted value will be truncated by the maxLength setting.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: setTextInEditModeSource

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTextInEditModeSource
parameters.description: New value for property textInEditModeSource

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property textInEditModeSource.

Sets the source from which text descriptions for IDs are fetched in edit mode, for example, for LT (Laptop).

Note: The sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty and sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueList enumeration members are only supported if the following applies:

  • The value property of the SmartField control instance is bound to an Entity Data Model (EDM) property typed as Edm.String or Edm.Guid.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation for the bound EDM property or entity type is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file.
  • The binding mode for the value property of the SmartField control is the two-way binding mode.
  • The field from which the description is fetched is filterable.

Note: In addition, the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty enumeration member is only supported if the following applies:

  • The EDM navigation property association is defined in the service metadata document.
  • The com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation for the bound EDM property is specified in the service metadata document or annotation file whose Path attribute points to a EDM navigation property of a lookup entity set/type whose single key property is the ID, which contains (among other properties) the descriptive value.
  • The lookup entity must be loaded. The lookup entity can be loaded by expanding the EDM navigation property via a $expand query parameter.
  • The EDM navigation property association defines a referential constraint that ties values of the dependent editable entity type/set to the lookup entity type/set in the service metadata document.
  • The EDM navigation property association end multiplicity of the lookup entity type/set is defined as 1 in the service metadata document. There must be a single-valued navigation from the editable entity set/type to the lookup entity set/type.
  • The lookup entity type/set from which the descriptive value is fetched contains a single-key EDM property.

Note: As of version 1.82, if SmartField is used inside a SmartForm, defaultTextInEditModeSource can be added as custom data to the form and it will be propagated to all smart fields that cover the above criteria. However, if textInEditModeSource is added to the SmartField as property, it will override the defaultTextInEditModeSource propagated from the SmartForm custom data.

Note: As of version 1.107 the property will be used to configure the validation for fixed list fields of type ComboBox. The values that will be considered:

  • ValueList - strict validation
  • ValueListWarning - non-strict validation

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is None.

parameters.description: New value for property uomVisible

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property uomVisible.

Indicates whether the unit of measure field is visible.

Note: This control property is only valid if the SmartField control addresses a unit of measure composite field, for example, an amount field and its associated currency field. The field must then be annotated with one of the following annotations:

  • The bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property or its entity set are annotated with the OData V2 sap:unit annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency annotation.
  • The entity set of the bound EDM property is annotated with the OData V4 Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit annotation.

Note: The SmartField control is metadata-driven, and this property can be ignored if the bound EDM property is annotated with the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl annotation.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setUrl

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sUrl
parameters.description: New value for property url

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property url.

Contains a URL which is used to render a link. The link is rendered, if the OData property, to which the value property of the control is bound, is of type Edm.String and the SmartField is in display mode.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setValue

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oValue
parameters.description: New value for property value

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property value.

The binding path expression used to determine the bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property. Important: The SmartField is a metadata-driven control. Avoid direct interaction with the value property, as it should be accessed or modified via the model itself.

Note: Composite binding expressions for this property are not supported. Note: Custom formatters for this property are not supported. The SmartField control usually creates its own data type based on the service metadata for the formatting of values. Also, when a custom formatter is specified for a property, the binding mode is automatically switched to one-way binding mode. Note: Named models are not supported, only the default model (named undefined) is supported. For example, when the binding path expression contains a > sign, the string preceding it is a named model and the remainder after the > is the binding path.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Controls if the title is taken from the label of the main property or from the label of the value list.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Property.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource
symbols.description:
Enumeration of sources from which text values for Codes/IDs are fetched in edit mode. The text is usually visualized as description/text value for IDs, for example, for LT (Laptop).

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartfield.TextInEditModeSource'.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.NavigationProperty
properties.description: The text is fetched from the OData model property specified in the Path attribute of the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.None
properties.description: The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation and the value of the displayBehaviour property of the configuration aggregation are not evaluated.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueList
properties.description: The text is fetched from the OData model property specified in the Path attribute of the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation of the associated value list entity.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueListNoValidation
properties.description:
The text is fetched from the OData model property specified in the Path attribute of the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation. Could be a value which is not included in the associated value list entity.

Note Note that a scenario where more than one SmartField is bound to the same property could raise a performance issue depending on the number of the smart fields.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource.ValueListWarning
properties.description:
The same behavior as ValueListNoValidation but for values that are considered invalid a warning message will be created.

NOTE: In this mode when the value is sent to the backend there might be 2 messages for the same field from both frontend and backend validation.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfiguration
symbols.description: ControlConfiguration can be used to add additional configuration for filter fields in the SmartFilterBar control, in order to overwrite the default settings from the OData metadata. For instance, it is possible to change the label, index or control type of a filter field.

properties.name: conditionPanelDefaultOperation
properties.description:
Sets default operation for Condition Panel of the Value Help dialog. In case the newly set default operation is not valid for the filter's EDM data type, then it is ignored.

Since: 1.99.

properties.name: controlType
properties.description: The SmartFilterBar calculates which kind of control will be used for a filter fields based on multiple OData Attributes and annotations. Using this property it is possible to overwrite the OData metadata.

properties.name: displayBehaviour
properties.description: The displayBehaviour specifies how the content should be displayed on certain controls. Ex: DescriptionOnly for Combobox (DropDown text) , Description and ID for MultiInput (token text)

properties.name: filterType
properties.description: The filter type specifies whether the filter field is of type single value, multi-value, or interval. The filter type is calculated by the sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar control based on the OData metadata. Using this property the filter type can be configured manually.

properties.name: groupId
properties.description: The groupId can be used to move a field from one group to another. The groupId corresponds to the EntityName from the OData metadata. It is also possible to move a field from the advanced area to the basic area by specifying the groupId _BASIC.

properties.name: hasTypeAhead
properties.description: Property can be used to enable the TypeAhead service. TypeAhead does not work with all controls, e.g it does not work for DropDownListbox

properties.name: hasValidation
properties.description: Specifies whether sap.m.ComboBox selectedKey has corresponding item or not.

properties.name: hasValueHelpDialog
properties.description: Specifies whether a value help dialog is available or not.

properties.name: historyEnabled
properties.description:
If set to false history values are disabled.

Note: For sap.m.ComboBox and sap.m.MultiComboBox the history values are disabled by default. To enable them for these controls, you need to set the historyEnabled property to true.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: index
properties.description: The index property specifies the initial order of fields without any variants. It's zero based so in order for it to be taken into account, its value must be equal to or bigger than 0. Note: To ensure the expected sorting behavior, the index property should have a unique value.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Using this property it is possible to overwrite the label of a filter field in the SmartFilterBar.

properties.name: mandatory
properties.description: Property can be used to overwrite the mandatory state of a filter field. Property can only be set during initialization. Changes at runtime will be ignored.

properties.name: preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog
properties.description: In case there are value help annotations for this filter field, it is possible to specify whether the table in the value help dialog for this field will be filled initially. The default value is false, which means the table will be filled as the data fetch is not prevented. Note: As of version 1.78 the default value has been changed from true to false.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description:
Sets time zone for filter of type Edm.DateTimeOffset

Note: The property is IANA timezone ID, e.g. "America/New_York". An invalid IANA timezone ID will fall back to the UTC.

Since: 1.103.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Using this flag it is possible to hide fields from the OData metadata.

properties.name: visibleInAdvancedArea
properties.description: If set to true this field will be added to the advanced area (aka. Dynamic Selection) by default.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the filter field in a CSS compatible format. The width can be set only once during initialization. Changes at runtime will not be reflected. The width will not be applied to custom controls.

aggregations.name: customControl
aggregations.description: If a custom control is specified, the SmartFilterBar will not create a control but use the custom control. Additional services like TypeAhead have to implemented manually.

aggregations.name: defaultFilterValues
aggregations.description:
Default value for a filter field. The aggregation expects sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption|SelectOption instances, where the values' format (properties low and high) match the type of the referneced property and consider also the given constraints of the property.

Samples for valid formats: Edm.DateTime with constraint sap:display-format='Date': "2018-12-24" (you optionally can provide a time-part and timezone, too, (2018-12-24T00:00:00Z) but this is ignored)

Edm.DateTimeOffset: "2018-12-24T13:55:59Z"

Edm.Time: "PT12H34M56S"

Edm.Boolean: "false"

Edm.Decimal: "2983.12"

parameters.name: sID
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/ControlConfiguration.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar
symbols.description:
The SmartFilterBar is a wrapper that uses the OData metadata of an entity to create a filter bar based on the content defined by the OData service. Whether a field is visible on the filter bar, supports type-ahead and value help, for example, is automatically determined.
Note that all internally created instances are considered as private.
You can use the control configuration and group configuration classes to configure the filter fields and adapt them to your needs. For example:

  • Determine the type of control for example whether a field is shown as a multi input field or as a date picker.
  • Enable the autocomplete suggestions feature.
  • Enable the value help dialog.
  • Overwrite settings from the OData service.
  • Set custom filter groups.
  • Add custom fields.
  • Access the settings of the underlying filter bar.

Note: Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

The SmartFilterBar control supports fiscal annotations, history of the recently used values and value list IN/OUT parameters.

Usage

When to use

  • You use an OData service for your app (only OData version 2).
  • You need a metadata-driven control and the features of the SmartFilterBar control are suitable for your app.
  • You want to develop quickly and efficiently.

When not to use

  • You are not using OData version 2.
  • You need to implement extensive changes to the filter bar.

    • Important: Keep in mind that SmartFilterBar, like all SAPUI5 smart controls, retrieves and analyzes the metadata and annotations of OData services. The OData metadata is its primary API. These OData services are not part of the SAPUI5 framework and are usually maintained by the backend developers of your application.

    With time, SmartFilterBar can evolve and acquire new features. This means that its behavior or functionalities may change if the annotations that define this change are maintained in your backend metadata. To benefit from the new functionalities, your application should be able to adapt the backend metadata. Therefore, we recommend using SmartFilterBar only if you have control over the metadata of your application.

properties.name: basicSearchFieldName
properties.description: Name of the field that is the focus of the basic search.

properties.name: considerAnalyticalParameters
properties.description:
Indicates if the analytical parameters (SelectionVariant) must be taken into consideration.

Since: 1.42.0.

properties.name: considerPresentationVariant
properties.description: Indicates if the annotation com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant is taken into account.

properties.name: considerSelectionVariants
properties.description:
Indicates if the annotation com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant is taken into account.
Note: Only relevant for control level personalization.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.87. Please use the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionPresentationVariant annotation through the sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement#setEntitySet

properties.name: defaultSelectionVariantName
properties.description:
Determines one specific variant that is based on the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant annotation, which is then used as the default variant.
This property is only relevant in case considerSelectionVariants is set to true and will only be applied if there is no user-defined default variant specified.
Note: Only relevant for control level personalization.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.87. Please use the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionPresentationVariant annotation through the sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement#setEntitySet

properties.name: enableBasicSearch
properties.description:
Enables the basic search field. The entered value can be accessed with sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getParameters.
Note: When the SmartFilterBar control is used with a sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable control the parameters are handled automatically. Therefore, this must only be enabled for OData service entities that support basic search.
Note: basic search field is restricted to 1000 characters and spaces.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description: The OData entity set whose metadata is used to create the SmartFilterBar. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

properties.name: entityType
properties.description: The OData entity type whose metadata is used to create the SmartFilterBar. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40. Use entitySet property instead of this one, to enable V4 annotation support

properties.name: liveMode
properties.description:
If set the search will be automatically triggered, when a filter value was set via the change event.
Note: The liveMode only operates on non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if liveMode is set, the following applies:

  • The error messagebox is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.
  • The search is triggered after a variant has been selected.
  • Execute on Select for VariantManagement is not shown and not taken into account


Since: 1.40.

properties.name: navigationProperties
properties.description:
This property is only evaluated if the property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getUseProvidedNavigationProperties is set to true. It contains a comma-separated list of NavigationProperty> names which are checked for filters. It can also contain a list of separate filters from different NavigationProperty names.


Since: 1.48.

properties.name: resourceUri
properties.description: Optional. The OData service URL. If it is not specified, the service URL from the OData model (this.getModel()) will be used. Note: Changing this value after the SmartFilterBar is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.29. Set an ODataModel as the main model on your control/view instead

properties.name: showMessages
properties.description:
If set to true, any errors that occur during the search, are displayed in a message box in addition to the valueState with the error. Note: As of version 1.89, the default value has been changed from true to false.

Since: 1.40.

properties.name: suppressSelection
properties.description:
If set to true all search requests will be ignored. This functionality is only intended to be used internally to enable an optimal solution when the filter bar is controlled by the smart templates. NOTE: As long as this property is set to true, all search requests will be neglected.

Since: 1.44.0.

properties.name: useDateRangeType
properties.description:
If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

Since: 1.46.0.

properties.name: useProvidedNavigationProperties
properties.description:
If set to true, only the navigation properties mentioned in property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getNavigationProperties are checked for further filters.

Since: 1.48.

aggregations.name: controlConfiguration
aggregations.description: Using control configurations you can add additional configuration to filter fields, for example set custom labels, change the order of fields, or change the filter field control type. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

aggregations.name: groupConfiguration
aggregations.description: Provides the possibility to add additional configuration to groups. Groups are used to show fields in the advanced area of the SmartFilterBar. With additional configuration, you can for example set custom labels or change the order of groups. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

associations.name: smartVariant
associations.description:
Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization.

Since: 1.38.

annotations.name: filterRestrictions
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
NonFilterableProperties defines whether a Property can be used for filtering data. All properties are filterable by default. In order to disable filtering capability, these properties must be excluded.

Example using OData V4 annotations on the entity set to excluded Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions">
     <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="NonFilterableProperties">
          <Collection>
          	<PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
          </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:filterable annotation on the Property can be used to exclude properties from filtering.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filterable="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filterable="false"/>

RequiredProperties defines mandatory filter fields. Filter fields with this annotation must be a part of the $filter request sent to the back-end. Note: Support for V4 annotation is added since SAPUI5 version 1.40. XML Example of OData V4 with mandatory filters CompanyCode and Customer

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions">
     <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="RequiresFilter" Bool="true"/>
         <PropertyValue Property="RequiredProperties">
          <Collection>
          	<PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
          </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:required-in-filter annotation on the Property can be used for setting the filter as a mandatory filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:required-in-filter="true"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:required-in-filter="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fieldGroup
annotations.description:
Defines a group with filter fields. The filter fields are listed as DataField records that reference other properties within the same EntityType.

Example in OData V4 notation with properties CompanyName and CompanyIndustry

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FieldGroup" Qualifier="FieldGroup1">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Custom Field Group 1" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Data">
         <Collection>
				<Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField">
					<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="CompanyName" />
					<PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Customer Name" />
				</Record>
				<Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField" >
					<PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="CompanyIndustry" />
					<PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Industry" />
				</Record>
           <PropertyPath>CompanyName</PropertyPath>
           <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterFacet
annotations.description:
Defines the relevant field groups by referencing them as ReferenceFacet. If a filter facet has been defined, only the referenced field groups are displayed in the Adapt Filters dialog, the other filters are omitted.
If you don't define any filter facets all field groups are displayed.

Example in OData V4 notation with two relevant field groups with qualifiers FieldGroup1 and FieldGroup2 (see also annotation FieldGroup for reference)

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FilterFacets" >
     <Collection>
       <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ReferenceFacet" >
         <PropertyValue Property="Target" AnnotationPath="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FieldGroup#FieldGroup1" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Field Group 1" />
     </Record>
       <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ReferenceFacet" >
         <PropertyValue Property="Target" AnnotationPath="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FieldGroup#FieldGroup2" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Field Group 2" />
     </Record>
     </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.

annotations.name: text
annotations.description:
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property.

Note: The value must be a dynamic expression when used as metadata annotation.

XML Example of OData V4 Text on CustomerName Property

<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CustomerName" />
Note: The Path property is mandatory.

For OData V2 the sap:text annotation on the Property can be used to assign a text/description.

   <Property Name="Customer" type="Edm.String" sap:text="CustomerName"/>
   <Property Name="CustomerName" type="Edm.String"/>

Note: The Text annotation is not respected in dropdown scenario when a sap.m.ComboBox or a sap.m.Select is rendered. For example, when you add the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation and set com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListWithFixedValues to true, the text will be populated with corresponding value from the ValueList Collection's item. The com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement will be applied in both cases.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: textArrangement
annotations.description:
Describes the arrangement of an ID value and its description.

The following enumeration members are allowed:

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextSeparate: The control displays the specified ID only.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst: The control displays the specified description followed by its ID.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast: The control displays the specified ID followed by its description.

  • com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextOnly: The control displays the specified description only.

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on an entity's property

<Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="namespace.Product/Category">
	<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text" Path="CategoryName">
		<Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextLast" />
	</Annotation>
</Annotations>

XML Example of OData V4 with TextArrangement annotation on entity Product

   <Annotations Target="Namespace.ProductType">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangementType/TextFirst"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: valueList
annotations.description:
Specifies the structure for the list of possible values. This annotation is rendered as the value help dialog and suggestion list, displayed upon typing. For the suggestion list feature, the annotation without qualifier is used.

Note: This annotation is only supported for Entity Data Model (EDM) properties typed as:

  • Edm.String
  • Edm.Guid

Each parameter on the ValueList annotation has a maximum of two properties:

  • LocalDataProperty - Path to the property of the local entity that triggered the ValueList.
  • ValueListProperty - Path to the property of the ValueList entity.

Optional: ValueListParameterIn specifies a property that is used to filter the value list.

Optional: ValueListParameterOut specifies a property that is filled depending on the selection from the value list.

Optional: ValueListParameterConstant specifies a constant value that is used to filter the value list with exact match. The constant value is hidden from the UI.

Optional: Each parameter can be statically annotated as important with the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance annotation. com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/High must be provided as an enumeration member (EnumMember).

Only the important parameters are displayed as columns in the suggestion list.

If the Importance annotation is not used, all of the parameters are displayed.

The annotation supports a FetchValues property. When it is set to 2, the table in the ValueHelpDialog is not populated on initial load. When it is set to 1, the table is populated with values on initial load.

Note: The CollectionPath property does not support paths with navigation properties.

Note: The CollectionRoot property is not supported.

Example in OData V4 notation with property "Category" with a ValueList

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueList">
     <Record>
       <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="Category" />
       <PropertyValue Property="CollectionPath" String="Category" />
       <PropertyValue Property="SearchSupported" Bool="true" />
       <PropertyValue Property="FetchValues" Int="2" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Parameters">
         <Collection>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterInOut">
             <PropertyValue Property="LocalDataProperty" PropertyPath="Category" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="Description" />
             <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Importance"
					EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType/High" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly">
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="CategoryName" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterIn">
             <PropertyValue Property="LocalDataProperty" PropertyPath="Supplier" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="SupplierName" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterOut">
             <PropertyValue Property="LocalDataProperty" PropertyPath="Product" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="ProductId" />
           </Record>
           <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListParameterConstant">
             <PropertyValue Property="Constant" String="Automotive" />
             <PropertyValue Property="ValueListProperty" String="CategoryType" />
           </Record>
         </Collection>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: valueListWithFixedValues
annotations.description:
If specified as true, there's only one value list mapping and its value list consists of a small number of fixed values. The value list will be rendered as pick list containing all possible values.

Note: As of version 1.78, value lists with fixed values support the use of the ValueListParameterIn and ValueListParameterOut properties.

Example in OData V4 notation Value List on Category Property

    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.ValueListWithFixedValues" Bool="true"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.1.

annotations.name: isConfigurationDeprecationCode
annotations.description:
Defines the status of all fields of the ValueHelpDialog control as valid, deprecated or revoked. Each status has a corresponding letter. For deprecated it's W, for revoked E and for valid we use an empty string. Note: Values with revoked status are hidden. The only way to visualize them is to filter all values by typing the corresponding letter for revoked types E in the DeprecationCode filtering input field in the ValueHelpDialog.

Example in OData V4 notation with property DeprecationCode 

    <Property Name="DeprecationCode" Type="Edm.String" MaxLength="1"/>

    <Annotations Target="DeprecationCode" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.CodeList.v1.IsConfigurationDeprecationCode" Bool="true"/>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.77.

annotations.name: presentationVariant
annotations.description:
Provides the possibility to order the values of the value list with fixed values by property and in ascending or descending order. Note: The annotation should point to the EntityType of the value list with fixed values. Note: The property by which the values are ordered should be part of the EntityType of the value list with fixed values. Note: The annotation will be ignored if the considerPresentationVariant property is set to false.

Example in OData V4 notation with property CompanyCode 

 <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant">
   <Record>
    <PropertyValue Property="SortOrder">
      <Collection>
        <Record>
          <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode"/>
          <PropertyValue Property="Descending" Bool="true"/>
        </Record>
      </Collection>
    </PropertyValue>
   </Record>
 </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.98.

annotations.name: quickInfo
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for tooltips in user interfaces.

XML Example of OData V4 with Tooltip on CompanyCode Property

   <Property Name="CompanyCode">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.QuickInfo" Path="CompanyCodeQuickInfo" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="CompanyQuickInfo" type="Edm.String" />

For OData V2 the sap:quickinfo annotation on the Property can be used to assign information relevant for tooltips of the field.

   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:quickinfo="Company Code quickinfo"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterLabelOnProperty
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for the filter's name. The com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation is defined on the Property. If the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation is given, it has precedence. If none of the annotations are given, then the label will be the Property name.

Example in OData V4 notation where property "CustomerName" contains the label assigned to property "CustomerId"

    <Annotations Target="CustomerId">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label" Path="Customer" String="Customer Name"/>
    </Annotations>

For OData V2 the sap:label annotation on the Property can be used to define the label of the column.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:label="Customer Name"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterLabelOnLineItem
annotations.description:
A short, human-readable text suitable for the filter's name. The Label annotation of com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField is defined within com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem annotation. If the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label annotation is given, it has precedence. If none of the annotations are given, then the label will be the Property name of the column.

Example in OData V4 notation where property "CustomerName" contains the label assigned to "Customer" 

    <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataField">
        <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Customer" />
        <PropertyValue Property="Label" Path="CustomerName" />
    </Record>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: filterExpression
annotations.description:
Note: The annotation com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions has been deprecated and replaced by Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions - FilterExpressionRestrictions.

Enum member MultiValue defines whether multiple values can be used in a single filter. With multi-value filtering, more that one "equals" condition can be defined for filtering the data. Example in OData V4 notation with multi-value properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode"

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      <Collection>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/MultiValue" />
         </Record>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions"
            EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/MultiValue" />
         </Record>
      </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:filter-restriction="multi-value" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering multi-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>

Enum member SingleValue restricts the filter to only one single value entry. With single-value filtering, you cannot define more than one "equals" condition for filtering the data. Note: Support for V4 annotation is added since SAPUI5 version 1.40. Example in OData V4 notation with single-value properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode"

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      <Collection>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/SingleValue" />
         </Record>
         <Record>
            <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
            <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/SingleValue" />
         </Record>
      </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:filter-restriction="single-value" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering a single-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>

Enum member SingleInterval restricts the filter to specify an interval, for example, a date interval for filtering the data present between the given dates. Example in OData V4 notation with Interval Restriction on "DocumentDate" property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
     <Collection>
        <Record>
           <PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="DocumentDate" />
           <PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterExpressionType/SingleInterval" />
        </Record>
     </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:filter-restriction="interval" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering an interval filter field.

   <Property Name="DocumentDate" ... sap:filter-restriction="interval"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: FilterRestrictions
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Capabilities.V1
annotations.description:
The filter expression restriction "MultiValue" defines whether multiple filter clauses can be defined in a filter statement. When the expression "MultiValue" is present, multiple filter clauses that use the "equals" operator can be defined by a user.

XML Example of OData V4 with expression "MutliValue" for properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode" 

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions" >
   	<Record>
   		<PropertyValue Property="FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      		<Collection>
         		<Record>
           			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="MultiValue" />
        		 	</Record>
         		<Record>
            			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="MultiValue" />
         		</Record>
      		</Collection>
      	</PropertyValue>
      </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:filter-restriction="multi-value" annotation on the property can be used for rendering a multi-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="multi-value"/>

The filter expression restriction "SingleValue" restricts the number of filter clauses for the given property to only one in the filter statement. When the expression "SingleValue" is present, a user cannot define more than one "equals" condition for filtering the data.

XML Example of OData V4 with expression "SingleValue" for properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode" 

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions" >
   	<Record>
   		<PropertyValue Property="FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      		<Collection>
         		<Record>
           			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="Customer" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="SingleValue" />
        		 	</Record>
         		<Record>
            			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="CompanyCode" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="SingleValue" />
         		</Record>
      		</Collection>
      	</PropertyValue>
      </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:filter-restriction="single-value" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering a single-value filter field.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:filter-restriction="single-value"/>

Note: When the restriction "SingleVale" / "single-value" is used, the "Is Empty" operator cannot be used.

The filter expression restriction" SingleRange" restricts the filter to specify an interval, for example, a date interval for filtering the data present between the given dates. XML Example of OData V4 with expression "SingleRange" for property "DocumentDate"

   <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.FilterRestrictions" >
   	<Record>
   		<PropertyValue Property="FilterExpressionRestrictions" >
      		<Collection>
         		<Record>
           			<PropertyValue Property="Property" PropertyPath="DocumentDate" />
           			<PropertyValue Property="AllowedExpressions" String="SingleRange" />
        		 	</Record>
      		</Collection>
      	</PropertyValue>
      </Record>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:filter-restriction="interval" annotation on the Property can be used for rendering an interval/range filter field.

   <Property Name="DocumentDate" ... sap:filter-restriction="interval"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.64.

annotations.name: selectionFields
annotations.description:
Defines whether certain fields should be initially visible in the SmartFilterBar control. The fields will be rendered in the order that is specified in this annotation. Note: This annotation is supported since SAPUI5 version 1.40.

Example in OData V4 notation with SelectionFields annotation.

  <Annotations Target="Product">
    <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionFields">
      <Collection>
        <PropertyPath>ProductCategory</PropertyPath>
        <PropertyPath>Supplier</PropertyPath>
        <PropertyPath>Product</PropertyPath>
      </Collection>
    </Annotation>
  </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.40.1.

annotations.name: filterVisible
annotations.description:
Defines whether a filter is visible. The SmartFilterBar control interprets the EnumMembers FieldControlType/Inapplicable and FieldControlType/Hidden (deprecated) of the FieldControl annotation to set the visibility. Note:The FieldControlType/Inapplicable annotation is only supported if you want to statically hide the filter fields.

Example in OData V4 notation with hidden properties "Customer" and "CompanyCode"

    <Annotations Target=".../Customer">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Hidden"/>
    </Annotations>
    <Annotations Target=".../CompanyCode">
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Inapplicable"/>
    </Annotations>

For OData V2 the sap:visible annotation on the Property can be used to assign visibility.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:visible="false"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:visible="false"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.32.1.

annotations.name: hiddenFilter
annotations.description:
Defines a certain field to not be rendered in the SmartFilterBar control, but still used as filter that can be set by the application code. Note:While properties annotated with HiddenFilter are considered during filtering, properties annotated with Hidden are ignored completely. If both annotations exist, Hidden is taken into consideration.

Example in OData V4 notation with invisible, filterable property "LocationName" 

    <Annotations Target="LocationName" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.HiddenFilter"/>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.44.0.

annotations.name: hidden
annotations.description:
Defines a certain property to not be rendered in an application and also not used in the SmartFilterBar control. In contrast to HiddenFilter, a property annotated with Hidden is not used as a filter.

As of version 1.76, when SmartFilterBar is used inside ValueHelpDialog, if a property is annotated with Hidden, it's not rendered but it's used as a filter.

Note:The annotations com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControlType/Inapplicable and Hidden are interchangeable.

Example in OData V4 notation with hidden ProductPictureURL

    <Annotations Target="ProductPictureURL" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Hidden"/>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.54.

annotations.name: selectionBVariant
annotations.description:
Defines variant items, based on SelectionVariant annotation. SelectionVariants with a qualifier will be added as variants to the VariantManagement control. A SelectionVariant annotation without a qualifier will define the Standard variant, in case no vendor Standard variant exists. All mentioned filters will be treated as at least partOfCurrentVariant.

    <Annotations Target="Namespace.Product">
        <Annotation Qualifier="Group" Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant">
            <Record>
                <PropertyValue Text="SelectionVariant from Annotations"/>
                <PropertyValue Property="SelectOptions">
                    <Collection>
        			       <Record Type="UI.SelectOptionType">
           			       <PropertyValue Property="PropertyName" PropertyPath="Bukrs"/>
                            <PropertyValue Property="Ranges" >
                     	       <Collection>
                         	       <Record Type="UI.SelectionRangeType">
           						       <PropertyValue Property="Sign" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeSignType/I"/>
           						       <PropertyValue Property="Option" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeOptionType/EQ"/>
           						       <PropertyValue Property="Low" String="0001"/>
                         	       </Record>
                                </Collection>
                            </PropertyValue>
                        </Record>
                    </Collection>
                </PropertyValue>
            </Record>
        <Annotation>
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.0.

annotations.name: FilterDefaultValue
annotations.description:
Defines a default value for the property to be used in filter expressions. A FilterDefaultValue is ignored when another source for filter initialization is available, like a com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant or a variant saved with the SmartVariantManagement control.

Note: Analytical parameters (see considerAnalyticalParameters) are technically no filters. To initialize these fields use the DefaultValue attribute of the repsective property in the service's OData metadata.

Example in OData V4 notation for a string-typed property "ContactID"

    <Annotations Target="ContactID" >
        <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FilterDefaultValue" String="A0328" />
    </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.48.0.

annotations.name: fiscalYear
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'y' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'y' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYear annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYear" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: upperCase
annotations.description:
Defines whether a string value is capitalized.

XML Example of OData V4 with Capitalized Customer and CompanyCode Properties

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsUpperCase">
       <Collection>
          <PropertyPath>Customer</PropertyPath>
          <PropertyPath>CompanyCode</PropertyPath>
       </Collection>
   </Annotation>

For OData V2 the sap:display-format="UpperCase" annotation on the Property can be used to render the text in uppercase format.

   <Property Name="Customer" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>
   <Property Name="CompanyCode" ... sap:display-format="UpperCase"/>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.28.1.

annotations.name: fiscalPeriod
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'M' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'M' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalPeriod annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalPeriod" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalYearPeriod
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'yM' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'yM' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYearPeriod annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearPeriod" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'Q' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'Q' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalQuarter annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalYearQuarter
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'yQ' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'yQ' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYearQuarter annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearQuarter" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'w' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'w' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalWeek annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: fiscalYearWeek
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a fiscal date following the 'Yw' pattern.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the 'Yw' pattern.

Note: The IsFiscalYearWeek annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsFiscalYearWeek" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: dayOfFiscalYear
annotations.description:

Note: The IsDayOfFiscalYear annotation is currently experimental and might be renamed or redefined.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">

   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.74.

annotations.name: calendarDate
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property is a string that is based on a calendar date following the pattern 'yyyyMMdd'.

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP and follow the pattern 'YYYYMMDD'.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarDate" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.54.

annotations.name: digitSequence
annotations.description:
Indicates whether the annotated Property contains only digit sequences (non-negative numeric values).

Other input leads to validation errors and the value state message popup is shown. In addition, whenever the control's value property is changed on the user interface side, and the change has to be propagated back into the data model, then the value is either filled with leading zeroes (if the maxLength attribute is given) or the leading zeroes are removed (if no maxLength attribute is given).

Intended for Edm.String properties that are stored as ABAP NUMC (numeric text) data type.

XML Example of the OData V4 Annotation

   <Property Name="Price" MaxLength="20" Type="Edm.String"/>
   <Annotations Target="Price">
       <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsDigitSequence" Bool="true"/>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableBasicSearch.

Enables the basic search field. The entered value can be accessed with sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getParameters.
Note: When the SmartFilterBar control is used with a sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable control the parameters are handled automatically. Therefore, this must only be enabled for OData service entities that support basic search.
Note: basic search field is restricted to 1000 characters and spaces.

Default value is false.

Returns an array of filters (sap.ui.model.Filter instances), for visible fields, that can be used to restrict the query result from OData.
The result of this method can directly be used during aggregation binding or OData read.

methods.name: getFiltersWithValues

returnValue.description: Filter items containing a value

methods.description:
Returns all filter items

  • Containing a value
  • With the visible property set to true
  • That are either flagged as partOfCurrentVariant or visibleInFilterBar
  • That are not custom filters
Even hidden filters will be considered as long as the mentioned criteria is fullfilled.

methods.name: getGroupConfiguration
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation groupConfiguration.

Provides the possibility to add additional configuration to groups. Groups are used to show fields in the advanced area of the SmartFilterBar. With additional configuration, you can for example set custom labels or change the order of groups. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

methods.name: getLiveMode

returnValue.description: Value of property liveMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property liveMode.

If set the search will be automatically triggered, when a filter value was set via the change event.
Note: The liveMode only operates on non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if liveMode is set, the following applies:

  • The error messagebox is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.
  • The search is triggered after a variant has been selected.
  • Execute on Select for VariantManagement is not shown and not taken into account

Default value is false.

This property is only evaluated if the property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getUseProvidedNavigationProperties is set to true. methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association smartVariant, or null.

methods.name: getSuppressSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property suppressSelection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property suppressSelection.

If set to true all search requests will be ignored. This functionality is only intended to be used internally to enable an optimal solution when the filter bar is controlled by the smart templates. NOTE: As long as this property is set to true, all search requests will be neglected.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getUseDateRangeType

returnValue.description: Value of property useDateRangeType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useDateRangeType.

If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

methods.name: getUseProvidedNavigationProperties

returnValue.description: Value of property useProvidedNavigationProperties

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useProvidedNavigationProperties.

If set to true, only the navigation properties mentioned in property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getNavigationProperties are checked for further filters.

Default value is false.

methods.description: Overwrites method from base class. Called when user clicks the search button of the FilterBar. The search is executed asynchronously per default, but can be forced to synchronously execution by providing the bSync set to true. Synchronous mode is only supported for non live mode scenarios. In the synchronous mode a mandatory check prior to the search execution is made.

parameters.name: bEnableBasicSearch
parameters.description: New value for property enableBasicSearch

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableBasicSearch.

Enables the basic search field. The entered value can be accessed with sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getParameters.
Note: When the SmartFilterBar control is used with a sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable control the parameters are handled automatically. Therefore, this must only be enabled for OData service entities that support basic search.
Note: basic search field is restricted to 1000 characters and spaces.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setLiveMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bLiveMode
parameters.description: New value for property liveMode

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property liveMode.

If set the search will be automatically triggered, when a filter value was set via the change event.
Note: The liveMode only operates on non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if liveMode is set, the following applies:

  • The error messagebox is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.
  • The search is triggered after a variant has been selected.
  • Execute on Select for VariantManagement is not shown and not taken into account

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setNavigationProperties

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sNavigationProperties
parameters.description: New value for property navigationProperties

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property navigationProperties.

This property is only evaluated if the property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getUseProvidedNavigationProperties is set to true. It contains a comma-separated list of NavigationProperty> names which are checked for filters. It can also contain a list of separate filters from different NavigationProperty names.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.description: Uses the provided resource URI to fetch the OData metadata instead of using the default ODataModel (getModel()). You should only set this if you intend to get the metadata for the filter bar from elsewhere!

Sets a new value for property showMessages.

If set to true, any errors that occur during the search, are displayed in a message box in addition to the valueState with the error. Note: As of version 1.89, the default value has been changed from true to false.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.
