methods.description: Sets the associated smartVariant.

methods.name: setSuppressSelection

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bSuppressSelection
parameters.description: New value for property suppressSelection

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property suppressSelection.

If set to true all search requests will be ignored. This functionality is only intended to be used internally to enable an optimal solution when the filter bar is controlled by the smart templates. NOTE: As long as this property is set to true, all search requests will be neglected.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setUseDateRangeType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseDateRangeType
parameters.description: New value for property useDateRangeType

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useDateRangeType.

If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setUseProvidedNavigationProperties

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseProvidedNavigationProperties
parameters.description: New value for property useProvidedNavigationProperties

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useProvidedNavigationProperties.

If set to true, only the navigation properties mentioned in property sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBar#getNavigationProperties are checked for further filters.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.description: Suspends calls to the search method when not called with the bSync parameter.

returnValue.description: true indicates that all mandatory filters and parameters have values.

methods.description: Verifies if all mandatory filters or parameters have values.

methods.name: verifySearchAllowed

returnValue.description:
An empty object indicates that all is fine and the search can be triggered.
An object with the property mandatory indicates that some mandatory filters or parameters are empty
An object with the property pending indicates that a token validation is going on.
An object with the property error indicates that some filters, parameters or the BasicSearch are in error state.

methods.description: Verifies if search is possible.

properties.name: horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth
properties.description:
Specifies the minimal size in pixels of all group elements of the form if horizontal Layout is used.

Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control. So don't set it manually.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. please do not use this property as it does not have any effect on the current layout of the SmartForm control.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Label for the group.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.88. replaced by title aggregation.

properties.name: useHorizontalLayout
properties.description:
Specifies whether the groups are rendered in a ResponsiveLayout with label on top of the group element. Each group will be rendered in a new line.

Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control.

So don't set it to a different value from the one in the SmartForm control. For performance reasons it might make sense to set it manually to the same value as the one in the SmartForm control when creating the Group element.

methods.name: setTitle

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining

parameters.name: vTitle
parameters.description: The title to set

methods.description:
Sets the aggregated title.

Can either be a Title element or a string. If a Title element is used, the style of the title can be set.

Note: If the title is provided as a string, the title is rendered with a theme-dependent default level. As the SmartForm control cannot know the structure of the page, this might not fit the page structure. In this case provide the title using a Title element and set its level to the required value.

methods.name: setUseHorizontalLayout

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseHorizontalLayout
parameters.description: New value for property useHorizontalLayout

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useHorizontalLayout.

Specifies whether the groups are rendered in a ResponsiveLayout with label on top of the group element. Each group will be rendered in a new line.

Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control.

So don't set it to a different value from the one in the SmartForm control. For performance reasons it might make sense to set it manually to the same value as the one in the SmartForm control when creating the Group element.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.Importance
symbols.description:
Enumeration of SmartForm Importance types

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'smartform.Importance'.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.Importance.High
properties.description: Shows fields that are annotated with UI.ImportanceType/High or have importance property set to High

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.Importance.Low
properties.description: Shows all fields

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.Importance.Medium
properties.description: Shows fields that are annotated with UI.ImportanceType/Medium or UI.ImportanceType/High or have the importance property set to medium or high.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.comp.smartform.Importance

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout
symbols.description: Layout settings to adjust the ResponsiveGridLayout used inside the Form.

properties.name: breakpointL
properties.description: Breakpoint (in pixel) between Medium size and Large size.

properties.name: breakpointM
properties.description: reakpoint (in pixel) between Small size and Medium size.

properties.name: breakpointXL
properties.description:
Breakpoint (in pixel) between large size and extra large (XL) size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: columnsL
properties.description:
Number of columns for large size.
The number of columns for large size must not be smaller than the number of columns for medium size.

properties.name: columnsM
properties.description: Number of columns for medium size.

properties.name: columnsXL
properties.description:
Number of columns for extra large size.
The number of columns for extra large size must not be smaller than the number of columns for large size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: emptySpanL
properties.description: Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on large size.

properties.name: emptySpanM
properties.description: Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on medium size.

properties.name: emptySpanS
properties.description: Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on small size.

properties.name: emptySpanXL
properties.description:
Number of grid cells that are empty at the end of each line on extra large size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: gridDataSpan
properties.description:
A string type that represents Grid's span values for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 1 to 12 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M12", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
The value set here will be set to all group elements when used with horizontal layout (SmartForm property useHorizontalLayout)

properties.name: labelSpanL
properties.description: Default span for labels in large size. This span is only used if more than 1 container is in one line, if only 1 container is in the line the labelSpanM value is used.

properties.name: labelSpanM
properties.description: Default span for labels in medium size. This property is used for full size containers. If more than one Container is in one line, labelSpanL is used.

properties.name: labelSpanS
properties.description: Default span for labels in small size.

properties.name: labelSpanXL
properties.description:
Default span for labels in extra large size.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: singleGroupFullSize
properties.description:
If the SmartForm contains only one single Group and this property is set, the Group is displayed using the full size of the SmartForm. In this case the properties columnsL and columnsM are ignored.
In all other cases the Group is displayed in the size of one column.

Since: 1.34.1.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartform.SemanticGroupElement

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm
symbols.description:
The SmartForm control renders a form (sap.ui.layout.form.Form). When used with the SmartField control the label is taken from the metadata annotation sap:label if not specified directly.

Warning: Do not put any layout or other container controls into the GroupElement. Views are also not supported. This could damage the visual layout, keyboard support and screen-reader support.

properties.name: checkButton
properties.description: Specifies whether a check button is added to the toolbar.

properties.name: editTogglable
properties.description: If set to true, a button to toggle the editable property is shown in the toolbar.

properties.name: editable
properties.description:
Applies a device-specific and theme-specific line height and label alignment to the form rows if the form has editable content. If set, all (not only the editable) rows of the form will get the line height of editable fields.

The labels inside the form will be rendered by default in the according mode.

Note: The setting of this property will be passed to all SmartField controls inside the form, so they will be editable if the form is editable.

Warning: The setting of this property will not be passed to controls other than SmartField. For example, Input controls in a form with editable set to false are still editable.

If controls other than SmartField controls are used, and the edit mode of their control is not set correctly, this might lead to visual issues. The labels and fields might be misaligned, the labels might be rendered in the wrong mode, and the spacing between the single controls might be wrong. Also, controls that do not fit the mode might be rendered incorrectly.

properties.name: entityType
properties.description:
CSV of entity types for which the flexibility features are available.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

properties.name: expandable
properties.description: Specifies whether the control is expandable. Per default the control is not rendered as expanded.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: If expandable, this property indicates whether the state is expanded or not. If expanded, then the toolbar (if available) and the content is rendered; if expanded is false, then only the headerText/headerToolbar is rendered.

properties.name: flexEnabled
properties.description:
Specifies whether the form enables flexibility features, such as adding new fields.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.

properties.name: horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth
properties.description: Specifies the minimal size in pixels of all group elements of the form if the horizontal layout is used.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.48.0. please do not use this property as it does not have any effect on the current layout of the SmartForm control.

properties.name: ignoredFields
properties.description:
A list of fields that must not be available in the key-user adaptation dialog. Listed field names are separated by commas.

The property is designed to be used by SAP Fiori elements, and its not evaluated by the SmartForm control itself.

Note:
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

properties.name: importance
properties.description:
Specifies which smart fields will be visible inside the SmartForm.

If set to high, only smart fields with high importance will be visible.

If set to medium, only smart fields with high and medium importance will be visible.

If set to low (default), all the smart fields will be visible regardless of their importance.

Note: If a smart field is annotated as mandatory or hidden, its visibility will not be affected by the importance property.

Since: 1.87.

properties.name: title
properties.description:
Title of the form.

Note: The title is rendered with a theme-dependent default level. As the SmartForm control cannot know the structure of the page, this might not fit the page structure. In this case provide the title using a Title control and set its level to the required value. Add this title to a Toolbar control and assign it to the SmartForm using the customToolbar aggregation.

properties.name: useHorizontalLayout
properties.description:
Specifies whether the groups are rendered in a ResponsiveLayout with the label above the field. Each group is rendered in a new line.

Note: This property should no longer be used. To arrange the fields in columns, ColumnLayout should be used in the layout aggregation.

Note: The value of this property will be passed on to the useHorizontalLayout property of all Group and GroupElement elements.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.86. replaced by ColumnLayout in the layout aggregation.

properties.name: validationMode
properties.description:
Controls the SmartForm validation mode. The default mode handles only nested SmartField controls with synchronous validation. If the SmartForm should also handle controls with asynchronous validation the property should be set to Async mode which is the recommended mode to be used as all types of nested fields validation are handled.

Note: Using Async mode the method check will return a promise instead of an array.

Note: Using Async mode the event checked will be called asynchronously when all the nested SmartField validations are executed.

Since: 1.81.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Content to be rendered.

aggregations.name: customToolbar
aggregations.description:
An additional toolbar that can be added by the users, which can contain further custom buttons, controls, etc.

Note: If a special title is required inside the Toolbar, it must be added as content to the Toolbar. In this case add the Title to the ariaLabelledBy association. Use the required title level to meet the visual requirements. This might be theme-dependent.

aggregations.name: groups
aggregations.description: Groups are used to group form elements.

aggregations.name: layout
aggregations.description:
Layout settings to adjust the used layout.

Use ColumnLayout to have the current UI.

aggregations.name: semanticObjectController
aggregations.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: Toolbar

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

Since: 1.56.0.

methods.name: check

returnValue.description: An array of fields with errors or a promise depending on the validationMode property setting. If the validationMode is asynchronous the returned promise will resolve with an array containing IDs of all the fields with errors.

parameters.name: vSettings
parameters.description: Settings object or a boolean which determines if only visible fields in visible groups should be considered

parameters.name: considerOnlyVisible
parameters.description: Determines if only visible fields in visible groups should be considered

parameters.name: handleSuccess
parameters.description: Indicates whether client error checks are performed for the current value regardless of the current error state of the text input fields of the SmartForm control. If the handleSuccess setting is set to true, the sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationSuccess will be fired by every of the text input fields if their validation passes

methods.description:
Checks smart fields for client errors.

This method is typically used to check whether the value of every text input field in edit mode is subject to data type constraints and whether the constraints are fulfilled.

A data type constraint for a bound Entity Data Model (EDM) property can be violated in many ways, for example:

  • The Nullable constraint for an EDM property typed as Edm.String is violated.
  • A user input is invalid for the bound EDM property typed as Edm.DateTime.

If this happens, the following applies:

  • A validation error state is set on the text input field.
  • A validation error message is displayed for the text input field.
  • The validation error message (possibly generated by a user input) is added to a sap.ui.core.message.MessageManager object instance if, for example, a view object instance is registered to it.
  • The text input field fires a sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:validationError, or sap.ui.base.EventProvider#event:parseError event.

In this case provide the title using a Title control and set its level to the required value. Add this title to a Toolbar control and assign it to the SmartForm using the customToolbar aggregation.

Note: This property should no longer be used. To arrange the fields in columns, ColumnLayout should be used in the layout aggregation.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEditable
parameters.description: New value for property editable

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property editable.

Applies a device-specific and theme-specific line height and label alignment to the form rows if the form has editable content. If set, all (not only the editable) rows of the form will get the line height of editable fields.

The labels inside the form will be rendered by default in the according mode.

Note: The setting of this property will be passed to all SmartField controls inside the form, so they will be editable if the form is editable.

Warning: The setting of this property will not be passed to controls other than SmartField. For example, Input controls in a form with editable set to false are still editable.

If controls other than SmartField controls are used, and the edit mode of their control is not set correctly, this might lead to visual issues. The labels and fields might be misaligned, the labels might be rendered in the wrong mode, and the spacing between the single controls might be wrong. Also, controls that do not fit the mode might be rendered incorrectly.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property importance.

Specifies which smart fields will be visible inside the SmartForm.

If set to high, only smart fields with high importance will be visible.

If set to medium, only smart fields with high and medium importance will be visible.

If set to low (default), all the smart fields will be visible regardless of their importance.

Note: If a smart field is annotated as mandatory or hidden, its visibility will not be affected by the importance property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Low.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartlist.ListType.List

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.smartlist.ListType.Tree

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.comp.smartlist.ListType

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartlist.SmartList
symbols.description:
A smart control to simplify using the sap.m.List and sap.m.Tree controls in list patterns.

Overview

The SmartList control creates a list or tree based on the configuration specified. There is, however, a difference to other smart controls: This control does not use annotations to automatically create its content. Hence, a template must always be provided for this control.

Structure

The SmartList control consists of the following elements:

  • OverflowToolbar control: Displays the header and other action buttons. Users can add their own toolbar and buttons in the view.
  • List or Tree control: The actual list/tree control. Users can also add this in the view with the required configuration.
The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch the actual data.
The listItemTemplate aggregation must also be specified with the required item template, such as StandardListItem/StandardTreeItem, which will be used during binding.

Note:

Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description:
When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the list using the listBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens right after the initialise event has been fired.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The entity set name from which to fetch data.
Note:
This is not a dynamic UI5 property.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: expandFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be expanded when request is sent to the backend.
Note:
No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.
This property is only needed when used together with an ODataModel.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: header
properties.description:
Specifies header text that is shown in list.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: listBindingPath
properties.description:
Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the list. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is done automatically or when using rebindList)

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: listType
properties.description:
Specifies the type of list to be created in the SmartList control.
Note:
If you add a List or Tree to the content of the SmartList control in the view, this property has no effect.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: selectFields
properties.description:
CSV of fields that must be selected when request is sent to the backend.
Note:
No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.
This property is only needed when used together with an ODataModel.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: showFullScreenButton
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the full screen button.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: showRowCount
properties.description:
The number of rows is shown along with the header text if the property showRowCount is set to true.

Note:

  • To improve your application's performance, activate the inline count for OData bindings to avoid sending dedicated OData requests.
  • If no stable overall count can be retrieved from the binding, the count will not be displayed. This is currently the case for TreeBinding or if no count is requested by the binding.


Since: 1.48.0.

aggregations.name: listItemTemplate
aggregations.description:
Specifies the template that is used for the inner List or Tree control.
Note:
This template is used when binding the items of sap.m.List or sap.m.Tree control, and will not be available in the SmartList control once the binding has been done.

Since: 1.48.0.

associations.name: smartFilter
associations.description:
The SmartFilterBar control to be linked to the SmartList control. Some events of the SmartFilterBar control are then used to fetch data, show overlay etc.

Since: 1.48.0.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new smartlist/SmartList.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartAreaMicroChart control creates a AreaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which Micro Area Chart UI will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialised.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: Only true value is supported: the chart will be bound to the chartBindingPath or to the entitySet

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a AreaMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartAreaMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="AmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="AreaChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Area" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#AreaChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartType
annotations.description:
The ChartType is EnumType that is provided within the Chart annotation. The ChartType property value must be Area or Line. XML Example of using ChartType property with Area

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="AreaChartQualifier">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartDefinitionType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Area" />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the color of the chart is defined due to the thresholds by using the CriticalityCalculation property and ImprovementDirection property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType. The total chart property is defined by MaximumValue annotation.

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="AreaChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="PriceTarget"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
         <Record Type="UI.CriticalityCalculationType">
           <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="UI.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="PriceDeviationLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue" Path="PriceToleranceLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeHighValue" Path="PriceToleranceUpperBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeHighValue" Path="PriceDeviationUpperBound"/>
         </Record>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: dataPointType
annotations.description:
The DataPointType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of the DataPoint annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: criticalityCalculationType
annotations.description:
The CriticalityCalculationType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of CriticalityCalculation property in the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using CriticalityCalculation property with the CriticalityCalculationType type

   <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityCalculationType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
       <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="PriceDeviationLowerBound"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue" Path="PriceToleranceLowerBound"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeHighValue" Path="PriceToleranceUpperBound"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeHighValue" Path="PriceDeviationUpperBound"/>
     </Record>
   </PropertyValue>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: currency
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The ISOCurrency annotation describes the Value property of the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using ISOCurrency annotation

   <Property Name="Revenue">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency" Path="Currency" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="Currency" type="Edm.String" />

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: unit
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The Unit annotation describes the Value property of the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using Unit annotation

   <Property Name="Revenue">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit" Path="Currency" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="Currency" type="Edm.String" />

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: isCalendarYear
annotations.description:
The IsCalendarYear annotation describes the Dimensions property in the Chart annotation. A corresponding formatter is used to format the value of the Dimensions property. XML Example of using IsCalendarYear annotation

   <Property Name="Date">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYear"/>
   </Property>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartBulletMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the BulletMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) property.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a BulletMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartBulletMicroChart with Chart annotation

   <Annotations Target="BmcNamespace.ProductType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="BulletChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Bullet" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Revenue</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Revenue" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#BulletChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: chartType
annotations.description:
The ChartType is EnumType that is provided within the Chart annotation. The ChartType property value must be Bullet. XML Example of using ChartType property with Bullet

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="BulletChartQualifier">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartDefinitionType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Bullet" />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes property, the color of the chart is defined due to the Criticality property directly or to the thresholds by using the CriticalityCalculation property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType XML Example of using DataPoint annotation and Criticality property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="BulletChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Price"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Revenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="TargetRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ForecastValue" Path="ForecastRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MinimumValue" Decimal="0"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MaximumValue" Decimal="200"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

XML Example of using DataPoint annotation and CriticalityCalculation property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="BulletChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="Price"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Revenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue" Path="TargetRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ForecastValue" Path="ForecastRevenue"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MinimumValue" Decimal="0"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="MaximumValue" Decimal="200"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
         <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityCalculationType">
           <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="PriceDeviationLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue" Path="PriceToleranceLowerBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeHighValue" Path="PriceToleranceUpperBound"/>
           <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeHighValue" Path="PriceDeviationUpperBound"/>
         </Record>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

   <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityCalculationType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartColumnMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartColumnMicroChart control creates a ColumnMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified.
The entitySet property is required. The entity set you specify in this property is used to fetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual chart data.
Note:
Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed, once the control has been initialized.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a ColumnMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartColumnMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="CmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="ColumnChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="ChartTitle" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Column" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#ColumnChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.0.

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the values and colors of the chart are defined by using the Value property and Criticality property. Property Title of the column micro chart is set based on the Title property of the DataPoint. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType.
XML Example of using DataPoint annotation

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="ColumnChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title"/>*
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

annotations.description:

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartComparisonMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartComparisonMicroChart control creates a ComparisonMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet property is required to use the control. The entity set you specify in this property is used to feetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual data.
Notes:

  1. Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed, once the control has been initialized.
  2. SmartComparisonMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartComparisonMicroChart cannot be created with a SmartMicroChart.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a ComparisonMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. SmartComparisonMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartComparisonMicroChart cannot be created with SmartMicroChart.
XML Example of SmartComparisonMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="CmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="ComparisonChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#ComparisonChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.58.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.58.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the values, titles and colors of the chart are defined by using the Value property, Title property and Criticality property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType.
XML Example of using DataPoint annotation

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="ComparisonChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.58.0.

annotations.name: dataPointType

The DataPointType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of the DataPoint annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartDeltaMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartDeltaMicroChart control creates a DeltaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The delta micro chart represents the delta of two values as a chart.
The entitySet property is required to use the control. The entity set you specify in this property is used to fetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual data.
Notes:

  • Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
  • SmartDeltaMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartDeltaMicroChart cannot be created with a SmartMicroChart.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic data binding using the chartBindingPath property , if such a property exists.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a DeltaMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. SmartDeltaMicroChart does not have its own ChartType/Enum annotation. This means that ChartType annotation is not specified and SmartDeltaMicroChart cannot be created with SmartMicroChart.
SmartDeltaMicroChart expects two Measures and their respective two DataPoints.
XML Example of SmartDeltaMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="DmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="DeltaChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
             <PropertyPath>Revenue</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#DeltaChartDataPoint1" />
             </Record>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Revenue" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#DeltaChartDataPoint2" />
             </Record>			 *
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.61.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.61.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the values, titles and colors of the chart are defined by using the Value property, Title property and Criticality property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType.
XML Example of using DataPoint annotation

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="DeltaChartDataPoint1" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
       <!-- note that criticality of the first data point is used for color definition -->
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>
   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="DeltaChartDataPoint2" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Revenue" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
       <!-- note that criticality of the first data point is used for color definition -->
     </Record>
   </Annotation>*

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartHarveyBallMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartHarveyBallMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified in the mSettings of the sap.ui.base.ManagedObject.
The entitySet property is required. The entity set is used to fetch OData metadata and annotation information from the provided default OData model. The chart's UI is created based on this data.
Note:
Most of the properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, the chart is automatically bound using the chartBindingPath property, if it is specified.

associations.name: freeText
associations.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the free text provided by annotations. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this free text. The Label annotation from the OData Common vocabulary can be used.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a HarveyBallMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartHarveyBallMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="HbmcNamespace.ProductType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="PieChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" numMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Pie" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Sold</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#PieChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.62.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is a ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.62.0.

annotations.name: chartType
annotations.description:
The ChartType is EnumType that is provided within the Chart annotation. The ChartType property value must be Pie. XML Example of SmartHarveyBallMicroChart with chartType Pie

   <Annotations Target="HbmcNamespace.ProductType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="PieChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Pie" />
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.62.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the color of the chart is defined due to the thresholds by using the Criticality property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType

XML Example with DataPoint annotation and Criticality property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="PieChartDataPointPercent" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Sold" />
       <PropertyValue Property="MaximumValue"> />
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality"> />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.62.0.

annotations.name: dataPointType
annotations.description:
The DataPointType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of DataPoint annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.62.0.

annotations.name: currency
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The ISOCurrency annotation describes the value property of the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of ISOCurrency annotation. The totalScale and fractionScale properties of the chart are defined by this annotation.

   <Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="HbmcNamespace.ProductType/Sold" >
     <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency" Path="Unit"></Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

   </Property>
   <Property Name="Currency" type="Edm.String" />

annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The Unit annotation describes the Value property of the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using Unit annotation

   <Property Name="Revenue">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit" Path="Currency" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="Currency" type="Edm.String" />

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.0.

annotations.name: isCalendarYear
annotations.description:
The IsCalendarYear annotation describes the Dimensions property in the Chart annotation. A corresponding formatter is used to format the value of the Dimensions property. XML Example of using IsCalendarYear annotation

   <Property Name="Date">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYear"/>
   </Property>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.0.

annotations.name: isCalendarYearMonth
annotations.description:
The IsCalendarYearMonth annotation describes the Dimensions property in the Chart annotation. A corresponding formatter is used to format the value of the Dimensions property. XML Example of using IsCalendarYearMonth annotation

   <Property Name="Date">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.IsCalendarYearMonth"/>
   </Property>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.0.

annotations.name: isCalendarDate
annotations.description:
The IsCalendarDate annotation describes the Dimensions property in the Chart annotation. A corresponding formatter is used to format the value of the Dimensions property. XML Example of using IsCalendarDate annotation

   <Property Name="Date">

   </Property>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.60.0.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartLineMicroChart.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChartBase can be used.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartLineMicroChart

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartMicroChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings.
The entitySet property is required. This property is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the specified default OData model. Depending on the UI/ChartType annotation, the control creates a corresponding SmartAreaMicroChart, SmartBulletMicroChart, SmartStackedBarMicroChart, SmartLineMicroChart, or SmartRadialMicroChart instance and delegates it to the internal control.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: chartBindingPath
properties.description: This attribute can be used to specify the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet attribute is used instead and also stored in this property. Calling bindElement binds the control and sets this property.

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart. Note that this property is read-only.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description: The entity set name to fetch data and create the internal chart representation from. Note that this is not a dynamic UI5 property.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description: If this set to true, width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the container in which the control is placed or by the width and height property.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.62. the concept has been discarded.

properties.name: showLabel
properties.description: Determines if any label is shown or not

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The size of the microchart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the micro chart is included.

Since: 1.62.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

aggregations.name: _chart
aggregations.description: This private aggregation is used for the internal instance of Smart<*>MicroChart.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Controls or IDs that label this control. Can be used by screen reader software.

Since: 1.60.0.

associations.name: chartDescription
associations.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Description property of the Chart annotation. Description property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.

associations.name: chartTitle
associations.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Title property of the Chart annotation. Title property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.

associations.name: freeText
associations.description:
If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the free text provided by annotations. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this free text. As of 1.42.0, this association is only available for chart type 'Donut'.

Since: 1.42.0.

associations.name: unitOfMeasure
associations.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Unit of Measure. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this Unit of Measure. It can be either ISOCurrency or Unit from the OData Measures annotations.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a MicroChart based on the information that is provided within the Chart annotation. The Chart annotation contains the ChartType property that must be defined. Supported chart types are Area, Bullet, Donut and Line. XML Example of using Chart annotation with Bullet ChartType

   <Annotations Target="SmartMicroChart.ProductType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="BulletChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Bullet" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" String="ProductTitle" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" String="ProductDescription" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Revenue</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Revenue" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#BulletChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

annotations.name: chartType
annotations.description:
The ChartType is EnumType that is provided within the Chart annotation to define the chart type. Supported chart types are Area, Bullet, Donut and Line. XML Example of using ChartType property with Bullet

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="BulletChartQualifier">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartDefinitionType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Bullet" />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.38.0.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChart

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChartBase
symbols.description: This is an abstract base class for Smart Micro Charts.

properties.name: chartBindingPath
properties.description:
This property can be used to specify a relative path (without '/') to an entity set (not a single entity) that is used during the binding of the chart.
For example, it can be a navigation property that will be added to the context path.
If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead.

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart. Note that this property is read-only.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The OData entity set bound to the smart line micro chart.
This entity set is used to pull data into the micro chart and create its internal representation.
Please note that this property cannot be updated dynamically.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description: If this set to true, width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the container in which the control is placed or by the width and height property.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.62. the concept has been discarded.

properties.name: showLabel
properties.description: Determines if any label is shown or not.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The size of the microchart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the micro chart is included.

Since: 1.62.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property chartBindingPath.

This property can be used to specify a relative path (without '/') to an entity set (not a single entity) that is used during the binding of the chart.
For example, it can be a navigation property that will be added to the context path.
If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.title: abstract class sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChartBase

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartRadialMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the RadialMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

properties.name: enableAutoBinding
properties.description: If set to true, this enables automatic binding of the chart using the chartBindingPath (if it exists) property.

associations.name: freeText
associations.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the free text provided by annotations. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this free text. The Label annotation from the OData Common vocabulary can be used.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a RadialMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartRadialMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="DmcNamespace.ProductType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="DonutChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/Donut" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Sold</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#DonutChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType
annotations.description:
The ChartDefinitionType is a ComplexType that is used to describe the Chart annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: chartType
annotations.description:
The ChartType is EnumType that is provided within the Chart annotation. The ChartType property value must be Donut. XML Example of SmartRadialMicroChart with chartType Donut

   <Annotations Target="DmcNamespace.ProductType" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="DonutChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartType/Donut" />
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint
annotations.description:
Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the color of the chart is defined due to the thresholds by either using the Criticality property or by using both CriticalityCalculation and ImprovementDirection properties. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType

XML Example with DataPoint annotation and Criticality property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="DonutChartDataPointPercent" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue"> />
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality"> />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

XML Example with DataPoint annotation and CriticalityCalculation property

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="DonutChartDataPointPercent" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="TargetValue"> />
       <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
         <Record>
           <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Maximize" />
           <PropertyValue Path="MinSold" Property="DeviationRangeLowValue"/>
           <PropertyValue Path="ToleranceSold" Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue"/>
         </Record>
       </PropertyValue>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: dataPointType
annotations.description:
The DataPointType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of DataPoint annotation.
For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: criticalityCalculationType
annotations.description:
The CriticalityCalculationType is ComplexType that is used to define the type of CriticalityCalculation property in the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using CriticalityCalculation property with CriticalityCalculationType type

   <PropertyValue Property="CriticalityCalculation">
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.CriticalityCalculationType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ImprovementDirection" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImprovementDirectionType/Target" />
       <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeLowValue" Path="DeviationLowerBound"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeLowValue" Path="PriceToleranceLowerBound"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="ToleranceRangeHighValue" Path="PriceToleranceUpperBound"/>
       <PropertyValue Property="DeviationRangeHighValue" Path="PriceDeviationUpperBound"/>
     </Record>
   </PropertyValue>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: currency
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The ISOCurrency annotation describes the value property of the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of ISOCurrency annotation

   <Annotations xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Target="AmcNamespace.StockPrice/Price" >
     <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency" Path="Currency"></Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: unit
annotations.namespace: Org.OData.Measures.V1
annotations.description:
The Unit annotation describes the value property of the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using Unit annotation

   <Property Name="Revenue">
      <Annotation Term="Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit" Path="Currency" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="Currency" type="Edm.String" />

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

annotations.name: label
annotations.description:
The Label annotation describes the value property of the DataPoint annotation. XML Example of using Label annotation

   <Property Name="Revenue">
      <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label" Path="FreeText" />
   </Property>
   <Property Name="FreeText" type="Edm.String" />

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.42.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartStackedBarMicroChart
symbols.description:
The SmartStackedBarMicroChart control creates a StackedBarMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet property is required. The entity set you specify in this property is used to fetch OData metadata and to generate the micro chart's UI. This property can also be used to fetch actual chart data.
Note:
Most properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed, once the control has been initialised.

annotations.name: chart
annotations.description:
Renders a StackedBarMicroChart based on the Chart annotation. XML Example of SmartStackedBarMicroChart with Chart Annotation

   <Annotations Target="SBmcNamespace.StockPrice" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
     <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" Qualifier="StackedBarChartQualifier">
       <Record>
         <PropertyValue Property="Title" Path="Title" />
         <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/BarStacked" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Description" Path="Description" />
         <PropertyValue Property="Dimensions">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Day</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="Measures">
           <Collection>
             <PropertyPath>Price</PropertyPath>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
         <PropertyValue Property="MeasureAttributes">
           <Collection>
             <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureAttributeType">
               <PropertyValue Property="Measure" PropertyPath="Price" />
               <PropertyValue Property="Role" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartMeasureRoleType/Axis1" />
               <PropertyValue Property="DataPoint" AnnotationPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint#StackedBarChartDataPoint" />
             </Record>
           </Collection>
         </PropertyValue>
       </Record>
     </Annotation>
   </Annotations>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.58.0.

annotations.name: chartDefinitionType

     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ChartDefinitionType">
       <PropertyValue Property="ChartType" EnumMember="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart/BarStacked" />
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

Since: 1.58.0.

annotations.name: dataPoint

Based on the DataPoint annotation that is provided by the MeasureAttributes, the values and colors of the chart are defined by using the Value property and Criticality property. DataPoint must be defined for an EntityType.
XML Example of using DataPoint annotation

   <Annotation Term="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPoint" Qualifier="StackedBarChartDataPoint" >
     <Record Type="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.DataPointType">
       <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Price" />
       <PropertyValue Property="Criticality" Path="Criticality"/>
     </Record>
   </Annotation>

For more information, see OData v4 Annotations

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container
symbols.description: The SmartMultiEdit.Container control provides a layout for the smart multi edit fields (sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field) it includes and enables them to access the updated binding contexts.

properties.name: contexts
properties.description: The binding contexts relevant to this mass editing operation.

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The entity set name to fetch metadata for. This entity set should have sap:creatable annotation set to true as this control needs to create an entry internally for a short period of time.
Please note that this is not a dynamic SAP UI5 property: setting it twice will not result in an update of the property.

aggregations.name: layout
aggregations.description: The form that contains smart multi edit fields (sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field controls).

methods.name: getAllUpdatedContexts

returnValue.description: A Promise that is resolved when all contexts (sap.ui.model.Context) are copied and updated.

parameters.name: merge
parameters.description: If true, the returned data structure includes all entity set properties per context.

methods.description:
Provides updated objects, including the values of all sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field instances in the layout aggregation.

The function returns a Promise that is resolved when each sap.ui.model.Context in the contexts property is copied and updated. The fulfilled function is called with an array that contains an object for each context in the contexts property.
Each object in this array contains:

  • A context property that corresponds to the respective context.
  • A data property that contains the updated data object.

Please note that this is not a dynamic SAP UI5 property: setting it twice will not result in an update of the property.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field
symbols.description:
The SmartMultiEdit.Field control enables you to edit multiple homogeneous objects simultaneously. It allows you to select a predefined item from a combo box and apply your selection to all objects being edited.
In addition, SmartMultiEdit.Field can handle metadata for a specific OData property when you need to enable mass editing for multiple contexts. The contexts are handled by the sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container control.

properties.name: applyToEmptyOnly
properties.description:
Indicates whether to check for an existing value in the data model before applying the changes.
Please note that this property does not automatically update the model. It is up to you as the app developer to decide whether you want to consider this property when updating the model or not.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional description of the field.

properties.name: propertyName
properties.description:
The OData property name to fetch metadata for.
Please note that this is not a dynamic SAP UI5 property: setting it twice will not result in a new binding.

properties.name: useApplyToEmptyOnly
properties.description: Indicates whether to display applyToEmptyOnly flag.

properties.name: validateTokenExistence
properties.description:
Defines whether the existence of the selected token should be validated.
If you set this property to true, you should use the sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container#getErroneousFieldsAndTokens method, as the validation becomes asynchronous.

Since: 1.61.0.
