Defines the semantic level of the header. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getHeaderStyle

returnValue.description: Value of property headerStyle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property headerStyle.

Defines style of the header. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setTitle.

methods.name: getIgnoredFields

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoredFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoredFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the SmartTable control.
The SmartTable control will not create built-in columns for the fields defined by this property and will not offer these fields in table personalization.

Note:

  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getIgnoreFromPersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property ignoreFromPersonalisation.

Comma-separated value of fields that is not shown in the personalization dialog.
This property must only be used for use cases where a technical field/column is required to fetch some data from the backend but is hidden in the table personalization and on the UI.

Note:

  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • Visible fields/columns cannot be included in this property as this is not supported by the SmartTable control.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getInitiallyVisibleFields

returnValue.description: Value of property initiallyVisibleFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property initiallyVisibleFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:

  • If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

methods.name: getInitialNoDataText

returnValue.description: Value of property initialNoDataText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property initialNoDataText.

The text shown initially before the control is bound and initialized. The special values $FILTERBAR or $NO_FILTERBAR can be specified to make the SmartTable control show the initial text as if the SmartFilterBar control were associated with it. If nothing is specified, the default behavior is to show the initial text based on whether the SmartFilterBar control is actually associated with the SmartTable control.

methods.name: sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.

methods.name: getNoData
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation noData.

The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance.
The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.

Note: If an sap.m.IllustratedMessage control is used without a title set, the SmartTable will automatically update the illustration and text accordingly.

methods.name: getPersistencyKey

Default value is false.

methods.name: getRequestAtLeastFields

returnValue.description: Value of property requestAtLeastFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property requestAtLeastFields.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be always requested from the backend
This property is mainly meant to be used when there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note:
For AnalyticalTable (supported since 1.54), the following restrictions apply:

  • The property name(s) must not point to a new dimension or a measure.
  • The property name(s) must not point to a navigationProperty/association path, as this might not supported by analytical services.
Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.

methods.name: getShowDetailsButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showDetailsButton

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showDetailsButton.

Controls the visibility of the Show / Hide Details button for the ResponsiveTable scenario.

If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area while the columns with Low importance are hidden. On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden. As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area.

Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowFullScreenButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showFullScreenButton

Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Value of property showRowCount

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showRowCount.

The number of rows is shown along with the header text if the property showRowCount is set to true.

Note:

  • To improve your application's performance, activate the inline count for OData bindings to avoid sending dedicated OData requests.
  • If no stable overall count can be retrieved from the binding, the count will not be displayed. This is currently the case for TreeBinding or if no count is requested by the binding.

Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Value of property showTablePersonalisation

Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

returnValue.description: The table instance or undefined

methods.description:
Returns the internally used table control. Depending on the concrete scenario, the return type is a sap.m.Table, sap.ui.table.Table, sap.ui.table.TreeTable, or sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable.

If the internal table has not been initialized, the function returns undefined.

returnValue.description: Value of property tableBindingPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property tableBindingPath.

This attribute can be used to specify the path that is used during the binding of the table. If not specified, the entitySet attribute is used instead. (used only if binding is established after setting this property: initially due to enableAutoBinding -or- by subsequently calling rebindTable)

returnValue.description: Value of property tableType

Specifies the type of table to be created in the SmartTable control.

returnValue.description: Value of property toolbarStyleClass

A style class which is defined for the toolbar of the table.

methods.name: getUiState

returnValue.description: Current UI state

methods.description:
Returns the current UI state of the SmartTable control.
Note:
The following restrictions apply:

  • Visualizations can only be used to modify the visibility, order, and width of columns, the template or importance of the column cannot be changed
  • MaxItems is not supported
  • RequestAtLeast contains values that are combined from both the SmartTable control property and PresentationVariant annotation, but when it is updated it only affects the internal array. The property in the SmartTable stays the same as before
  • Changes to RequestAtLeast alone will not lead to a new data request
  • RequestAtLeast is not supported in AnalyticalTable scenario
  • Support for column width changes is enabled as of version 1.98.
  • Any other restrictions, like the ones mentioned in sap.ui.comp.state.UIState, also apply

methods.name: getUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips

returnValue.description: Value of property useColumnLabelsAsTooltips

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useColumnLabelsAsTooltips.

If no tooltips have been provided, neither by the QuickInfo annotation nor for custom columns directly via property, the column label will automatically be applied as a tooltip for the column.

To enable this mechanism for custom columns, a sap.m.Label or sap.m.Text must be used as header label. Custom tooltips are not affected by this functionality when they are provided on the column header label for tables of type ResponsiveTable and on the column for other table types.

Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getUseDateRangeType

returnValue.description: Value of property useDateRangeType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useDateRangeType.

If set to true, all date fields in the Filter Panel of the settings dialog with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getUseExportToExcel

returnValue.description: Value of property useExportToExcel

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useExportToExcel.

Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to export data to a spreadsheet application, for example Microsoft Excel.
Note:
If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.GW, any $expand parameters are removed when sending the request to generate the spreadsheet.
As of UI5 version 1.56: If exportType is sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType.UI5Client and TreeTable is used, the worksheet.hierarchyLevel property (see sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet) is filled from the binding, if the relevant information is available there for exporting hierarchical data in the spreadsheet.

Default value is true.
methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.100. replaced by enableExport property.

methods.name: getUseInfoToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useInfoToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useInfoToolbar.

Shows an info toolbar.
Filters that are applied using the table personalization dialog are shown in the info toolbar.
Note:

  • The default value for the property is Auto, which means that the info toolbar is shown by default if table type is ResponsiveTable.
  • The info toolbar is hidden if the property is set to Off.
  • The info toolbar is visible if the property is set to On. Currently the info toolbar is only available for the table type ResponsiveTable.
  • If multiple filters are applied to the same column, then the info toolbar contains the column name only once.
  • In case there is a custom info toolbar used for the responsive table control, then the property must be set to Off. Otherwise, an error is logged in the browser console.

Default value is Auto.

methods.name: getUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property useOnlyOneSolidToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useOnlyOneSolidToolbar.

If set to true, the standard toolbar and custom toolbar will be merged into one toolbar. The combined toolbar will have a solid style.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getUseTablePersonalisation

returnValue.description: Value of property useTablePersonalisation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useTablePersonalisation.

The useTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to define personalized table settings. If you want to persist the table personalization, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setCustomizeConfig

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oCustomizeConfig
parameters.description: New value for property customizeConfig

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property customizeConfig.

Provides customization to the columns/cell templates generated by the SmartTable control.

List of supported settings for the customizeConfig property:

  • textInEditModeSource: For more information, see sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#setTextInEditModeSource
  • insertIgnoreRestrictions: The customData setting for the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField control. Supported as of version 1.103.
  • autoColumnWidth: This property can be used to influence the column width calculation for columns generated by the SmartTable control itself. The supported configuration settings are truncateLabel, min, max, and gap. Supported as of version 1.108. For more information, see sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable#getEnableAutoColumnWidth.
  • clientSideMandatoryCheck: For more information, see sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField#setClientSideMandatoryCheck. Supported as of version 1.111

Examples for the customizeConfig property to change the textInEditModeSource for the default smartField 
<!-- Sets the textInEditModeSource property of all the SmartField controls to ValueList -->
<SmartTable customizeConfig="{'textInEditModeSource': {'*': 'ValueList'}}" >

<!-- Sets the textInEditModeSource property of the smartField with path "Bukrs" to NavigationProperty and
others to ValueList  -->
<SmartTable customizeConfig="{'textInEditModeSource': {'*': 'ValueList','Bukrs':'NavigationProperty'}}" >

<!-- Sets the autoColumnWidth property of all the columns -->
<SmartTable customizeConfig="{'autoColumnWidth': {'*': {'min': 5, 'max': 10, 'gap': 2, 'truncateLabel': false}}}" >

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

The demandPopin attribute can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to display columns as popins on the responsive table

methods.name: setDetailsButtonSetting

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDetailsButtonSetting
parameters.description: New value for property detailsButtonSetting

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property detailsButtonSetting.

Defines which columns should be hidden instead of moved into the pop-in area depending on their importance. See sap.m.Column#getImportance and sap.m.Table#getHiddenInPopin for more details.

Note: To hide columns based on their importance, it's mandatory to set showDetailsButton="true". If no priority is given, the default configuration of sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable#getShowDetailsButton is used. If this property is changed after the SmartTable has been initialized, the new changes take effect only when the Show / Hide Details button is pressed a second time.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setEditable

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEditable
parameters.description: New value for property editable

Sets a new value for property editable.

This attribute can be used to specify if the controls created by the SmartTable control are editable. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario)

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setEditTogglable

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEditTogglable
parameters.description: New value for property editTogglable

Sets a new value for property editTogglable.

Specifies whether the editable property can be toggled via a button on the toolbar. (The automatic toggle of controls works only for the SmartField/SmartToggle scenario)

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setEnableAutoBinding

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableAutoBinding
parameters.description: New value for property enableAutoBinding

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableAutoBinding.

When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the table using the tableBindingPath (if it exists) or entitySet property. This happens just after the initialise event has been fired.

Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setEnableAutoColumnWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableAutoColumnWidth
parameters.description: New value for property enableAutoColumnWidth

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableAutoColumnWidth.

Enables heuristic column width calculation for all supported table types based on metadata information when set to true. The column width calculation takes OData type, column label, text arrangement, possible cell templates, additional fields and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing more precise MaxLength value for the Edm.String type or precision value for numeric OData types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the CssDefaults annotation can be used.

If tableType="ResponsiveTable", the following changes are applied:

  • demandPopin property of the SmartTable is set to true.
  • fixedLayout property of the inner table is set to Strict.
  • contextualWidth property of the inner table is set to Auto.
  • Column resizing feature gets enabled and the wrapping of column headers get disabled for all columns, including custom columns.
Those properties must not be managed by the application.

By default, this feature has no effect on custom columns. To enable heuristic column width calculation also for custom columns, the autoColumnWidth property must be specified in the p13nData custom data.
Note: The automatic column width calculation for custom columns works only when the width property of the custom column is not set.
Note: The custom columns can have unexpected cell templates that might affect the result of the column width calculation, for example, an Edm.Byte field that can only have three digits might be visualized as a sap.m.RatingIndicator that requires more space.
Note: Defining the leadingProperty and a unique columnKey in the p13nData custom data is a prerequisite for all other p13nData properties, including the autoColumnWidth property.
Examples with autoColumnWidth property of the p13nData custom data 

<!-- Enable the automatic column width calculation for a custom column -->
<Column customdata:p13nData='\{"autoColumnWidth": true, "leadingProperty": "PropA", "columnKey": "PropA"}' >

<!-- Restrict the automatic width calculation to a minimum of 5rem and a maximum of 15rem -->
<Column customdata:p13nData='\{"autoColumnWidth": \{ "min": 5, "max": 15 }, "leadingProperty": "PropA", "columnKey": "PropA"}' >

<!-- Define extra 3rem space to the automatic content width calculation -->
<Column customdata:p13nData='\{"autoColumnWidth": \{ "gap": 3 }, "leadingProperty": "PropA", "columnKey": "PropA"}' >

<!-- Define the visible properties that should be considered for the calculation. Multiple property names can be specified here as comma-separated values. The first property is the leading property. -->
<Column customdata:p13nData='\{"autoColumnWidth": \{ "visibleProperty": "PropC" }, "leadingProperty": "PropA", "additionalProperty": "PropB,PropC", "columnKey": "PropA"}' >

<!-- The calculated column width must not be smaller than the column header -->
<Column customdata:p13nData='\{"autoColumnWidth": \{ "truncateLabel": false }, "leadingProperty": "PropA", "columnKey": "PropA"}' >

Note:
The enableAutoColumnWidth is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setEnableCopy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableCopy
parameters.description: New value for property enableCopy

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableCopy.

Enables the copy-to-clipboard functionality of the SmartTable control.

When set to true, a sap.m.plugins.CopyProvider and a sap.m.plugins.CellSelector are automatically created and added to the SmartTable control if a custom CopyProvider or CellSelector are not already used by the application. When set to false, these created code>CopyProvider and CellSelector plugins are removed again.

Note:
We recommend that you set the enableCopy property to false in the following cases:

  • The copy-to-clipboard functionality is not desired
  • Plugins with property settings other than the default ones should be used
  • Only one of the plugins should be used
  • The functionality conflicts with the concrete application scenario, for example, custom columns with special content
  • The functionality conflicts with the known restrictions of the CopyProvider and CellSelector plugins

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setEnableCustomFilter

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableCustomFilter
parameters.description: New value for property enableCustomFilter

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableCustomFilter.

Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

deprecated.text: After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.40.0. After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

Note:

  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • Visible fields/columns cannot be included in this property as this is not supported by the SmartTable control.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

Comma-separated value of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:

  • If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
  • Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters as no validation is done for this property.
  • This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

If nothing is specified, the default behavior is to show the initial text based on whether the SmartFilterBar control is actually associated with the SmartTable control.

Sets a new value for property showDetailsButton.

Controls the visibility of the Show / Hide Details button for the ResponsiveTable scenario.

If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area while the columns with Low importance are hidden. On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden. As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area.

This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setUiState

parameters.name: oUIState
parameters.description: the new representation of UI state

methods.description:
Replaces the current UI state of the SmartTable control with the data represented in sap.ui.comp.state.UIState.
Note:
The following restrictions apply:

  • Visualizations can only be used to modify the visibility, order, and width of columns, the template or importance of the column cannot be changed
  • MaxItems is not supported
  • RequestAtLeast contains values that are combined from both the SmartTable control property and PresentationVariant annotation, but when it is updated it only affects the internal array. The property in the SmartTable stays the same as before
  • Changes to RequestAtLeast alone will not lead to a new data request
  • RequestAtLeast is not supported in AnalyticalTable scenario
  • Support for column width changes is enabled as of version 1.98.
  • Any other restrictions, like the ones mentioned in sap.ui.comp.state.UIState, also apply

methods.name: setUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips
parameters.description: New value for property useColumnLabelsAsTooltips

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useColumnLabelsAsTooltips.

If no tooltips have been provided, neither by the QuickInfo annotation nor for custom columns directly via property, the column label will automatically be applied as a tooltip for the column.

To enable this mechanism for custom columns, a sap.m.Label or sap.m.Text must be used as header label. Custom tooltips are not affected by this functionality when they are provided on the column header label for tables of type ResponsiveTable and on the column for other table types.

Note:
This is not a dynamic property and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setUseDateRangeType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseDateRangeType
parameters.description: New value for property useDateRangeType

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useDateRangeType.

If set to true, all date fields in the Filter Panel of the settings dialog with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setUseInfoToolbar

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sUseInfoToolbar
parameters.description: New value for property useInfoToolbar

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useInfoToolbar.

Shows an info toolbar.
Filters that are applied using the table personalization dialog are shown in the info toolbar.
Note:

  • The default value for the property is Auto, which means that the info toolbar is shown by default if table type is ResponsiveTable.
  • The info toolbar is hidden if the property is set to Off.
  • The info toolbar is visible if the property is set to On. Currently the info toolbar is only available for the table type ResponsiveTable.
  • If multiple filters are applied to the same column, then the info toolbar contains the column name only once.
  • In case there is a custom info toolbar used for the responsive table control, then the property must be set to Off. Otherwise, an error is logged in the browser console.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Auto.

If set to true, the standard toolbar and custom toolbar will be merged into one toolbar. The combined toolbar will have a solid style.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.PersonalizableInfo

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement
symbols.description:
Overview

The SmartVariantManagement control communicates with the flexibility library that offers SAPUI5 flexibility to manage the variants.

Usage

You can use this control in combination with the following controls:

  • SmartFilterBar
  • SmartChart
  • SmartTable


Documentation links:
  • SAPUI5 Flexibility: Adapting UIs Made Easy

properties.name: entitySet
properties.description:
The v2 oData entity set whose metadata is used to create the variant items based on the SelectionPresentationVariant annotation.
Note:This property may be set only once during the initialization phase and may not be changed afterwords.

properties.name: persistencyKey
properties.description: Key used to access personalization data.

aggregations.name: personalizableControls
aggregations.description: All controls that rely on variant handling have to be added to this aggregation.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new SmartVariantManagement.
The call sequence is as follows:
A control for which personalization is used has to be registered first via the personalizableControls association. Then it has to call the initialise method with the arguments fCallback function which will be called once the personalization data has been retrieved and oPersoControl, the control itself.
Note: the function callback has to be defined in the personalizable control.
The old behavior, where the control has to register to the initialise event, before the initialise method call, should not be used any longer and is not supported at all for the page variant scenarios.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
references: {@link topic:a8e55aa2f8bc4127923b20685a6d1621 SAPUI5 Flexibility: Adapting UIs Made Easy}

If the property showCreateTile is not set, this event parameter is skipped.

parameters.description: Variant title. Will be passed for new and for updated variants.

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementAdapter
symbols.description: Handles the odata metadata based information. An instance of this class will be created and used by the SmartVariantManagement control. The adapter transforms odata metadata based SelectionPresentationVariant information to UIState object. For each SelectionPresentationVariant annotation an entry will be added to the VariantManagement control. It will be called by the SmartVariantManagement whenever the user selects the corresponding entry and will provide a valid UIState object.

Overview

The SmartVariantManagementBase control embeds VariantManagement control and communicates with the flexibility library that offers SAPUI5 flexibility to manage the variants for the UI Adaptation scenarios.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementBase
symbols.docuLinkText: Key User Adaptation: Enable Your App

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementMediator
symbols.description:
Can be used to manage variants. You can use this control in most controls that are enabled for key user adaptation.
Note: On the user interface, variants are generally referred to as "views".

properties.name: defaultVariantKey
properties.description: Provides a string value to set the default variant. Used for the save dialog. Has no effect on the selected variant.

properties.name: displayTextForExecuteOnSelectionForStandardVariant
properties.description:
Defines the Apply Automatically text for the standard variant in the Manage Views dialog if the application controls this behavior.

Note: The usage of this property is restricted to sap.fe components only.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Indicates whether the buttons on My Views are visible.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to enable or disable the control.

properties.name: executeOnSelectionForStandardDefault
properties.description: Determines the behavior for Apply Automatically if the standard variant is marked as the default variant.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Semantic level of the header. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Since: 1.104.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description: Indicates whether the control is in error state. If set to true, an error message will be displayed when the variant is opened.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description:
Sets the maximum width of the control.

Since: 1.109.

properties.name: modelName
properties.description: The name of the model containing the data.

properties.name: selectionKey
properties.description: The key of the currently selected item.

properties.name: showCreateTile
properties.description: Indicates that a Create Tile is visible in the Save As dialog.

properties.name: showExecuteOnSelection
properties.description: Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save As and the Manage Views dialogs.

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description: Indicates whether the functionality of setting a default variant is enabled. The Default column in Manage Views and the Set as Default checkbox in Save View will be disabled if set to false.

properties.name: showShare
properties.description: Indicates that the Public checkbox is visible in the Save As and the Manage Views dialogs. Selecting this checkbox allows you to share variants with other users. Note: this property is controlled by the SAPUI5 flexibility service.

properties.name: standardItemText
properties.description: Overwrites the default Standard variant title. Note: This property has to be set during the applySettings method; it will be ignored otherwise.

properties.name: titleStyle
properties.description:
Defines the style of the title. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setTitleStyle.

Since: 1.109.

properties.name: useFavorites
properties.description: Indicates that the 'Favorites' feature is used. Only variants marked as favorites will be displayed in the variant list.

properties.name: variantCreationByUserAllowed
properties.description: Indicates that end users are allowed to create variants Note: this property is controlled by the SAPUI5 flexibility service.

aggregations.name: _embeddedVM
aggregations.description: Used for embedded variant managment.

aggregations.name: variantItems
aggregations.description: Variant items displayed by the SmartVariantManagement control. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control and is populated via the SAP Flexibility service.

associations.name: for
associations.description: Contains the IDs of the relevant controls for which the variant management is used.

symbols.docuLinkText: Key User Adaptation: Enable Your App

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagementUi2
symbols.description: The SmartVariantManagementUi2 control communicates with the Ui2 personalization layer to manage the variants.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to enable or disable the control.

Semantic level of the header. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Since: 1.120.

Since: 1.120.

properties.name: presentationVariant
properties.description:
Object representing the presentation variant. The structure looks like:


{
	ContextUrl: {string},
	MaxItems: {int},
 SortOrder: [],
	GroupBy: [],
	Total: [],
	RequestAtLeast: [],
	Visualizations: []
}

Note:

  • PresentationVariantID property is not provided
  • Text property is not provided because it is translated text
  • TotalBy is not supported yet
  • IncludeGrandTotal is not supported yet
  • InitialExpansionLevel is not supported yet
  • Title of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • Description of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • VariantName property is not part of specified DataSuiteFormat yet

properties.name: selectionVariant
properties.description:
Object representing the selection variant. The structure looks like:


{
 SelectionVariant: {
     SelectionVariantID: {string},
		Parameters: [],
		SelectOptions: []
}

properties.name: semanticDates
properties.description:
Structure containing Date range semantic data of the filter value.


{
	Dates: [
		{
			PropertyName: string,
			Data: {
					calendarType: string,
					key: string,
					operation: string,
					value1: int,
					value2: int
				}
		}
	]
}

properties.name: tableSettings
properties.description:
Structure containing table related settings. The properties might be related to a specific table type and will be ignored if a different table type is used.


{
    fixedColumnCount: int,
    showDetails: boolean
}

properties.name: valueTexts
properties.description:
Structure containing filter value keys and its corresponding descriptions.


{
	Texts: [
		{
			Language: string,
			ContextUrl: string,
			PropertyTexts: [
				{
					PropertyName: string,
					ValueTexts: [
						{
							PropertyValue: string,
							Text: string
						}
					]
				}
			]
		}
	]
}

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpDialog
symbols.description:
Overview

The ValueHelpDialog helps the user to find and select single and multiple values. The user can also define and select multiple conditions. The control is generally called from an input field or a multi-input field by clicking the selection icon (value help icon) of the input field.

This control only supports OData V2 model (see sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel)

Usage

When to use:

  • The user is searching within a very large dataset
  • The user needs to use different attributes to find an object (such as city, company name, and so on).
  • The user needs to define conditions, such as ranges and exclusions.

When not to use:

  • There is a simpler control that fits the use case. Always start with the least complex control. For example, use the select control if the user needs to select only one item from a short list.

properties.name: _conditionPanelCalendarWeekSettings
properties.description:
Used by the ValueHelpProvider to set calendar week setting to date controls in condition panel

Since: 1.119.

properties.name: _conditionPanelShowCurrentDateButton
properties.description:
Used by the ValueHelpProvider to set the showCurrentDateButton property settings to the date controls in the condition panel.

Since: 1.122.

properties.name: _enhancedExcludeOperations
properties.description:
Used by the ValueHelpProvider to enable enhanced exclude operations

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: basicSearchText
properties.description:
Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: conditionPanelDefaultOperation
properties.description:
Sets default operation for Condition Panel of the value help dialog. In case the newly set default operation is not valid for the filter's EDM data type, then it is ignored. expected sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation

Since: 1.99.

properties.name: descriptionKey
properties.description:
Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: displayFormat
properties.description:
Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: enabledMultiSelectionPlugin
properties.description:
Sets usage of MultiSelectionPlugin. If enabled the default behaviour is changed and the ValueHelpDialog table uses the plugin which provides only "Deselect all" option and the ability for range selection. Also a limit of 200 items that are able to be selected as a restriction.

Note: Using MultiSelectionPlugin mode the method update will return a promise.

Since: 1.113.

properties.name: filterMode
properties.description:
Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: key
properties.description:
Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: keys
properties.description:
Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of conditions allowed to be added.

Since: 1.84.1.

properties.name: maxExcludeRanges
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges. If value is 0 - the exclude group of operators should not be displayed.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.84.1. replaced by maxConditions.

properties.name: maxIncludeRanges
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of include ranges. If value is 0 - the include group of operators should not be displayed.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.84.1. replaced by maxConditions.

properties.name: supportMultiselect
properties.description:
Enables multi-selection in the table used.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: supportRanges
properties.description:
Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: supportRangesOnly
properties.description:
If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: tokenDisplayBehaviour
properties.description:
Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

Since: 1.24.

aggregations.name: filterBar
aggregations.description: Allows you to add a FilterBar or SmartFilterBar control to the value help dialog.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new valuehelpdialog/ValueHelpDialog.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: cancel
events.description:
This event is fired when the Cancel button is pressed.

Since: 1.24.

events.name: ok

parameters.name: tokens
parameters.description: The array of tokens created or modified on the ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the OK button is pressed.

Since: 1.24.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: tableSelectionParams
parameters.description: The RowSelectionChange event parameter from the hosted table that contains the selected items.

parameters.name: updateTokens

methods.name: getBasicSearchText

returnValue.description: Value of property basicSearchText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property basicSearchText.

Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getConditionPanelDefaultOperation

returnValue.description: Value of property conditionPanelDefaultOperation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property conditionPanelDefaultOperation.

Sets default operation for Condition Panel of the value help dialog. In case the newly set default operation is not valid for the filter's EDM data type, then it is ignored. expected sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation

methods.name: getDescriptionKey

returnValue.description: Value of property descriptionKey

methods.description:
Gets current value of property descriptionKey.

Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getDisplayFormat

returnValue.description: Value of property displayFormat

methods.description:
Gets current value of property displayFormat.

Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getEnabledMultiSelectionPlugin

returnValue.description: Value of property enabledMultiSelectionPlugin

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enabledMultiSelectionPlugin.

Sets usage of MultiSelectionPlugin. If enabled the default behaviour is changed and the ValueHelpDialog table uses the plugin which provides only "Deselect all" option and the ability for range selection. Also a limit of 200 items that are able to be selected as a restriction.

Note: Using MultiSelectionPlugin mode the method update will return a promise.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getFilterBar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation filterBar.

Allows you to add a FilterBar or SmartFilterBar control to the value help dialog.

methods.name: getFilterMode

returnValue.description: Value of property filterMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property filterMode.

Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getKey

returnValue.description: Value of property key

methods.description:
Gets current value of property key.

Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getKeys

returnValue.description: Value of property keys

methods.description:
Gets current value of property keys.

Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

methods.name: getMaxConditions

returnValue.description: Value of property maxConditions

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxConditions.

Defines the maximum number of conditions allowed to be added.

Default value is '-1'.

methods.name: getMaxExcludeRanges

returnValue.description: Value of property maxExcludeRanges

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxExcludeRanges.

Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges. If value is 0 - the exclude group of operators should not be displayed.

Default value is '-1'.

methods.name: setTokens

parameters.name: aTokens
parameters.description: An array of token controls

methods.description: Sets the array of tokens. The sap.m.Tokens are added to the dialog tokenizer. Normal tokens are selected in the table. new sap.m.Token({key: "0001", text:"SAP A.G. (0001)"}); Tokens with the extra data with value 'range' are handled as range tokens or exclude range tokens. new sap.m.Token({key: "i1", text: "ID: a..z"}).data("range", { "exclude": false, "operation": sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation.BT, "keyField": "CompanyCode", "value1": "a", "value2": "z"}); The selected items or range tokens are returned in the event parameters of the Ok event.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the selection of rows in the table. This function must be called after a first binding or binding update of the table. It will set a table row as selected if a token for this row exists.

symbols.description:
The range operations supported by the ValueHelpDialog control.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/comp/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation'.

properties.description: The Equals operation for the ranges.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation.GE
properties.description: The Between or equals operation for the ranges.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation.GT
properties.description: The Greater operation for the ranges.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation.LE
properties.description: The Less or equals operation for the ranges.

properties.name: sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation.LT
properties.description: The Less operation for the ranges.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantItem

symbols.name: sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement
symbols.description: The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants, such as filter bar variants or table variants.

properties.name: defaultVariantKey
properties.description:
Provides a string value to set the default variant. Used for the save dialog. Has no effect on the selected variant.

Since: 1.22.0.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
Can be set to true or false depending on whether you want to enable or disable the control.

Since: 1.22.0.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description:
Indicates that the control is in error state. If set to true error message will be displayed whenever the variant is opened.

Since: 1.52.0.

properties.name: initialSelectionKey
properties.description:
Enables the setting of the initially selected variant.

Since: 1.22.0.

properties.name: lifecycleSupport
properties.description:
Enables the lifecycle support. If set to true, the VariantManagement control handles the transport information for shared variants.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: selectionKey
properties.description:
The key of the currently selected item. Returns null if the default item list is selected. This property is calculated when accessing it via the getSelectionKey method. The corresponding setSelectionKey method is not supported. The access via the standard set/getProperty is also not supported.

Since: 1.24.0.

properties.name: showCreateTile
properties.description:
Indicates that a Create Tile is visible in the Create dialog.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: showExecuteOnSelection
properties.description:
Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description:
Indicates that set as default is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

Since: 1.44.0.

properties.name: showShare
properties.description:
Indicates that the Public checkbox is visible in the Save View and the Manage Views dialogs. Selecting this checkbox allows you to share variants with other users.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: standardItemAuthor
properties.description:
Defines the author of the standard variant, for example, the name of the own company.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: standardItemText
properties.description:
Overwrites the default Standard variant title.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: useFavorites
properties.description:
Indicates that the 'Favorites' feature is used. Only variants marked as favorites will be displayed in the variant list.

Since: 1.50.0.

properties.name: variantCreationByUserAllowed
properties.description:
Indicates that end users are allowed to create variants.

Since: 1.85.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Items displayed by the VariantManagement control.
aggregations.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.26. replaced by the variantItems aggregation

aggregations.name: variantItems
aggregations.description:

Since: 1.26.0.

nodes.name: sap.ui.comp
nodes.description:
SAPUI5 library with smart controls.
Note: The controls in this library only support OData V2 (see sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel) and a default model (named undefined).

nodes.name: sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement
nodes.description:
Overview

The SmartVariantManagement control communicates with the flexibility library that offers SAPUI5 flexibility to manage the variants.

Usage

You can use this control in combination with the following controls:

  • SmartFilterBar
  • SmartChart
  • SmartTable
